Having stayed in other hotels for a higher price which were smaller and less modern made this one seem like an amazing deal. Hotel rooms (and bathrooms!) are known to be on the small side in Tokyo and this room was spacious in comparison. The staff were very helpful, we arrived a little early and it’s common in Japan to have to wait until the exact check in time to get the key to your room, but we were shown up straight away. They gave us detailed directions to places we wanted to visit and we had a parcel to post before leaving and they took care of that for us without any problems.Would definitely stay here again myself and recommend to others.

I like the hotel for it's easy access to Big Site as well for being in the center of the city rather than Daiba. The rooms are a little small for Western standards but what do you expect in Tokyo?! Professional services and reasonable breakfast. I have been there twice and will come again.

We stayed for 5 days from the 19th November in a corner room overlooking Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji and views were awesome. We had meals in the French and Japanese restaurants at the Hotel which were both very good. Central location with easy access to subway system

We really enjoyed staying here. The staff was very helpful and amazingly polite. The view from the check in desk on a clear day is priceless with the Tokyo tower in the foreground and Mt Fuji in the background. The rooms are a bit tight, but as I have understood from reading other reviews of Tokyo, small rooms are par for the course. The bed was on the stiff side, It didn't bother me but someone in our group who was a side sleeper had a hard time sleeping. Also the pillows are on the thin side. It really only caught me off guard the first night. The firm bed and thin pillows could very well be the norm in Japan, without trying other hotels in the city I have nothing to compare them to. The location to Shimbashi station and the Shiodome line are super helpful, we took the Tokyo metro daily and were able to use the Asakusa line or the Ginza line. Overall, I would was very pleased and would certainly consider staying again. Oh! One other nice thing is, there is a Family Mart in the basement, so we would get bottles of water before we started everyday.

Alarm went off in the middle of the night and we can only hear the message in Japanese so we had no idea if it was real or not, other than that it was a pleasant 7 days stay. I would recommend the message to be in both Japanese and English, if possible.

The Park Hotel is tucked away a 5-10 minute walk from the Shimbashi station in Tokyo. (which is very convenient, since it's on the Yamanote line, which just about everywhere we wanted to go in Tokyo was on as well) Also conveniently, there's a raised walkway on the third floor of the building that brings you straight to the station, so you don't have to deal with stop lights or anything. The hotel starts at around the 25th floor of its building, and goes up from there.We got one of their rooms with a view of the Tokyo Tower, and the view was absolutely sensational. At night, the tower is lit up beautifully, and it's really nice to just sit there and admire the view. On one particularly clear morning, we could see Mt. Fuji in the distance as well!The room was on the smaller side, which we expected, but felt cozy instead of cramped. We still had enough space to move around, put our things, etc. The bathroom was nice, and had a great feature - a heated area on the mirror that wouldn't fog up when you take a shower. The bed was comfortable, if a bit firm.Breakfast was buffet style, and had both Japanese and western style food. The smoked salmon was fantastic, and the sausage stood out as well. There were also these little raisiny pastries that I loved. There are plenty of places in the area to get food if you don't want to eat at the hotel, but we enjoyed the breakfast so much that we ate there every morning. One night, we came back early and got room service - I ordered a bento-type meal. The food was absolutely beautifully presented - I almost didn't want to eat it (but am glad I did - because it was fantastic).We didn't deal with the staff too much, but the one time we had the concierge make a restaurant reservation for us was a great, smooth experience. Everyone else was very friendly in the limited interactions that we did have with them, and English was no problem.Overall, we were very happy staying here, especially for the price we paid.

After staying in budget hotels in Tokyo with one bed for two the size of a postage stamp, the Park Hotel was a sight for sore eyes (and bad backs). Convenient location to most of the subways so it was easy to get around. Views are great since guest floors start at level 22. Rooms are very large compared to many hotels in Japan. Staff is friendly and helpful. Breakfast at $25 per person was a bit high, so we went to the cafe/bakery on the ground level or to a nearby Starbucks for coffee and breakfast pastries. The bus from Narita airport brings you to and from the door to the hotel. If you can afford it, this is a terrific place to stay.

Excellent value. Would highly recommend, especially for a business trip. Food was very good and there was a peaceful atmosphere with friendly and helpful staff. Proximity to the trains was a big factor. Better communication about that would have been helpful.

Good solid hotel with solid four stars, great location next to subway and rail station. Clean, with very helpful staff. Definitely would stay here again, small rooms but comfortable 2 good restaurantsDefinitely recommend

Stayed here for a recent Tokyo trip for 5 nights and found it a lovely intro to Japan; the location is in one of the newer sections of Tokyo called Shiodome and is wonderfully hypermodern and convenient to public transport (nearest JR station is Shimbashi where you can access the JR Yamanote loop line, and nearest metro is Shiodome, easily accessed either by skyway pedestrian walkway or underground walkway) and also walkable to Ginza, Hamarikyu Gardens, and Tsukiji Fish Market. There's tons of shopping and food nearby in the various skyscrapers; Shiodome City Center next door has a huge set of restaurants inside (I recommend the top floor's restaurant En) as does nearby Caretta Shiodome Center, and there is a Family Mart conveniently located on the B2 level of the hotel's building. The room was a reasonable size and had lovely modern decor and comfortable bedding. The shower had awesome water pressure, and the bath products smelled lovely. Love how generous Japanese hotels are with supplies! The views as others have noted are amazing, since the hotel starts at the 25th floor and up. Everything is hushed and quiet in the hotel (in most Japanese hotels I stayed at, so I slept well.) Service was always helpful and kind. We got the breakfast buffet twice, for $25 per person, and it had a nice array of both Japanese and Western items. Love the beautiful artwork and art theme of the hotel as well. And what is that wonderful smell they use in the hotel, even in the entrance walkways...like a peppery orange, it's great. Overall, I was very happy at this hotel and found it a great base to explore Tokyo.

The Park Hotel Tokyo is a great base for exploring the city as it is very close to Shidome and Shinbashi stations via a walkway. The rooms were clean and comfortable but it is absolutely worth paying extra for a room with views of Tokyo Tower. Stunning! On a couple of occasions we were lucky enough to see Mt Fuji in the distance! The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly too. There was one day in particular where the restaurant voucher we had been given by our agents was incorrect so they helped in straightening it all out with the agents which would have been much more difficult if we did that on our own due to the language barrier. I would definitely recommend this hotel but upgrading to the Tokyo Tower rooms makes a big difference!

The hotel is very well locate next to a train and subway station. The view from the hotel is awesome. The rooms are modern, not too small. The breakfast is not expensive and is very good. Staff very kind and willing to help. There are many options for restaurants and cafes around the hotel.

This is the fourth time I have stayed at the hotel. I stay here because of its superb location and the concierges have managed to get us most of the restaurants reservations we have asked them to get. For the most part, we know what to expect when we come here. This time however, the room wasn't as clean as we had expected. Perhaps because we got a Tokyo Tower view room this time around, and it may be a more used room, but I do not recall the same experience in the other rooms we stayed in. On our last night, the fire alarm went on as well at about 2am. Thankfully it was a false alarm, but we really had no idea what was going on

Would actually give this 4 1/2 stars if I could. We enjoyed our recent 4 night stay at the Park Hotel----very comfortable and nicely appointed room. Would have liked a bit more storage space to unpack, but the room was spacious enough to move around. Room was very clean, and with a comfortable bed. Breakfast buffet was a bit pricey but very high quality. Staff in hotel were extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful. Location was good in some ways---convenient to the Tsukiji Fish market, which is about to move. ( early November move has been delayed). We went there for sushi/sashimi breakfast 3 mornings. The Shiodome neighborhood is a bit cold and futuristic---having all been built about 10 years ago-----and only over time did we discover the network of shops and restaurants tucked into the lower ( or upper for the finer restaurants) levels of the neighboring giant office towers. We had easy and convenient access to trains and subway.

The concierge team were really helpful with the restaurant reservation (Includes those Michelin /hard-to-book restaurants). Upon my arrival, the detail of my reservation, as well as, detailed map was given to me. I was really impressed

I would not recommend this hotel. The access an signage of the hotel is very poor. My taxi dropped me in front of what seemed to be a commercial office building. I eventually found a small sign indicating the the hotel was on the 25 floor. The rooms are dated in need of renovations. The breakfast food was terrible I had better scrambled eggs st my high school cadet camp. To get to the subway you need a compass and a good sense of direction. In other words don't stay at this hotel there is much better st the same price

The Park Hotel is an ideal choice as a base for touring Tokyo.The hotel itself is completely satisfactory. It is clean and well appointed with a knowledgeable English speaking staff. Our room had a fantastic view of Tokyo Tower and the temple beneath it. Two metro stations can be reached from the basement level. This means that every subway stop in the city is at your feet. Moreover, the stations are loaded with eating places that cover a wide range of prices and specialties. The Park Hotel also had an excellent restaurant although we thought the breakfast a bit pricey. A twenty minute walk puts you in the Ginza with its shopping, dining, fish market, Kabuki theater. Or take a taxi for less than $10. The Park Hotel is the fourth stop for the bus from Nareta.

I simply love love loved this hotel and the amazing friendly and helpful staff. It was my 1st visit to Tokyo and they made sure it was the best. I had the most spectacular room with views of all of Tokyo. I don't think any other hotel can compare to what I experienced each morning waking up looking out at the sunrise and sunset over Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. I was satisfied with simply staying in my room if that's all I did during my visit. Sophia, the concierge was so very helpful along with the entire front desk staff. The assistant manager Chile was a delight to meet. The bellman was efficient in helping me check in and check out with my bags. It was more than a 4 star hotel in my opinion and I've stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels in many parts of the world. One thing I recommend is that they use the Mt Fuji tour guide I had which is Japan Panoramic Tours, so next time I stay, I don't have to go to another hotel for pick up. I highly recommend them after a spectacular journey to Mt Fuji. I look forward as a Travel professional to recommending this hotel to everyone who visits Tokyo and returning and making this my own permanent choice to stay each visit. The only downside for me was when I was exhausted after my long day of touring Mt Fuji. I wanted to order from the restaurant menu and take my food to my room and that was not allowed but they were so kind to accommodate me with an item to be sent to my room. Look forward to seeing you all again. Arigato!!

Rooms are a bit pricey esp., since they are the size of a dorm room for 290$/night but they make up for it by friendly front desk staff and location. Breakfast is charged separately and there not many European or continental dinning options for lunch or dinner. I would suggest the breakfast buffet though.

Located in a business area well serviced with transport links and restaurants. Very close to the Ginza area. Well serviced rooms and competent staff. However there are just as good hotels in the same area that are more reasonably priced. Would have to say not worth the premium rates it charges.

Stayed here for 2 nights on a long layover on our way to Thailand for our honeymoon. The location is pretty good -- walkable to the fish market (which was one of our favorite stops in Tokyo) and to public transportation. But if you're looking for a hotel with plenty of restaurants/bars in immediate walking distance, you'll be disappointed. As for the hotel itself, I wouldn't call this a luxury hotel, more of a business hotel. It's definitely worth paying extra for a room with a view. We did, and the view is pretty stunning -- but it's about the only great thing we can say about this hotel. Everything else was just fine. The lobby and restaurant area were welcoming and modern, and the service was good, but the room itself was very "budget," small, outdated and not particularly clean or well-appointed. Apparently there are some recently renovated rooms -- I can't imagine that ours was one of these, since ours seemed more like a somewhat dingy college student's apartment. All that said, since we were planning a very short stay in Tokyo and looking for something accessible enough to rail & the fish market, the Park Hotel was entirely sufficient. I imagine it's great for business travelers -- but for a vacation extending multiple days, I'd look elsewhere.

Only in Tokyo for a day, this was the perfect place to be situated. Check in/ reception is NOT on ground level; must take elevator to main lobby (which has views of the Tokyo Tower). Lobby has several cafes and eateries should you need. Two main elevators operate for all the main rooms which make it extremely convenient. Rooms are average sized for Tokyo. When arriving via taxi or uber, put your destination as "Shidome Media Tower" because every taxi we got into got confused, as there is a Park Hotel (or something similar) nearby. Can't even explain to you how many times we got dropped off across the street out of confusion! Great stay, great staff, would return.

Just stayed 9 nights in this wonderful luxury hotel. As is common in Tokyo it occupies the top floors of skyscraper with the lobby on the 25th and the hotel extending up to the 34th. All rooms have great views. I stayed in an Art King Room designated the Sumo Room. All rooms on the 31st floor have been individually decorated by a Japanese artist. Certainly the Sumo Room was beautifully decorated. Those on the Art room floor also have access to the Artist Lounge (very similar to the Club Lounge in other hotels) and an excellent complementary light breakfast. Service from the staff at all levels was friendly and discrete and all spoke English making the communication easy.I felt the whole experience was excellent value for money in a luxury hotel in Tokyo. The hotel is well situated in Tokyo very close to Shiodome and Shimbashi stations and many excellent restaurants of all price brackets. The Ginza shopping area is an easy 15min walk away.

I spent five days in this hotel on business. Very clean, great breakfast, views stunning. Recommended. Far better than the rubbish rabbit hutches usually found in Japan, especially by the airport. I would go back there at the first opportunity.

It's connected Shiodome station Yurikamome line.Even you can walk from Shinbashi station.I had a walk from Tsukiji market it took us about 15min.The room was beautiful,we reserved tokyo tower view was good choice!Staff were kind and friendly too.Only one thing, room service wasn't so good.I had pizza and pasta, pizza wasn't so nice...

When i visited tokyo for my honeymoon i stayed at the park hotel tokyo. The view is amazing!!!! Staff is great! Since we got there everyone was very kind and helpful trying to explain us everything because we dont speak japanese. Great food. You can see amazing artwork throughout the entire hotel.

Stayed there twice during our trip - both times on the 27th floor. Second time round the room faced the railway tracks so there was rumbling of trains from time to time but not so loud as to be annoying and after a while we didn’t even noticed it. Reception is on the 25th floor and is an atrium hub containing the lounge, restaurants, a bar called the Society and a smoking room decorated with murals. Panoramic view of the Tokyo skyline and Tokyo Tower – not to be confused with Tokyo Skytree - behind the reception counter and great spot for sunset photos. Getting to the hotel via Shimbashi station can be a bit tricky first time round even though it’s less than a 10-minute walk. The hotel’s website provides a useful access map. Just follow the Shiodome exit signs when you get off Shimbashi station. There are direct limousine coach services to and from the airports. Small coin-laundry room on the 26th floor housing only 2 washer/dryers. Iron and ironing board a bonus although it was a bit cramped. Lots of eateries (and a bar) across the road in Tokyo Shiodome building as well as a Tullys coffee house in Shiodome Sumitomo Building. Take the hotel elevator to the third 3rd floor and exit the Shiodome Media Tower onto the overhead walkway and turn right. They are all on that level. Free Wi-Fi. No password needed.Excellent location to nearby attractions. Extremely helpful (English speaking) front desk staff and concierge

Hotel room is nice but smaller than expected. The hotel restaurant is expensive. The view on the Tokyo Tower side is stellar with Mt Fuji in the distance. The hotel itself is located in a tower in the Shiodome district. There isn't much to do do within walking distance. A cab or metro ride is necessary to visit some of the more interesting locations in Tokyo. But I was very pleased with my experience.

Loved staying in our artist room! It was a unique experience and very fitting with the very cool Tokyo. I would recommend asking for a room with a good view as our view was a little obstructed by another skyscraper. Still an amazing stay though!

Good room, excellent bed, super restaurants, all in all an excellent choice......didn't even mention the superb location.Would come and stay again.Modern, well maintained urban full service hotel with friendly, formal and efficient staff.

Stayed in October 2016. Park is situated in a co joined building of offices. It is from the 16th floor up so you are garenteed a decent view any way you are. We had a bay view which looked pretty. We were on the 27th floor so quite high. The staff at all stages were very accomodating, friendly and helpful. We always felt welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Overall the hotel is modern, the room was very clean and food, although expensive, is good at the restaraunts. Subways are very close - directly below the building so commuting is a breeze. Shimbashi station is a short 5 min walk. The only negative was the Gym room. It is a room the size of a large closet and there is a spin bike and a multifunction machine with some band weights and thats it! However aside from that I would deffinately reccomend staying here, you wont be disapointed!

Stayed for one night just because of the reviews, and it didn't disappoint , we got a room in a high floor for the great view.the Facilities are very good and professional, seems like they perfected every small detail.definitely would recommend

We booked to stay at the Park Hotel as we were intrigued by the hotel being set on the 25th Floor of the Kyodo News Building. We arrived at the hotel after a long flight and were immediately looked after, our bags were taken up to our rooms and the staff were very polite and welcoming. Our room was great, very clean and well presented, and we had a fabulous view out over Tokyo. Anything we needed/wanted at the hotel, they were more than willing to accomodate.The area that hotel is located, Shimbashi is lovely, very business orrientated however very easy to get around and only 3 stops on the overground train to Tokyo Station. Quite central.We would most definately stay here again, and would recommend it to friends and family.

Although the rooms were smallish they were very comfortable and clean. The location was good for those that were prepared to walk to train stations. The view of the Tokyo Tower were wonderful and although we did not see Mt Fuji from the hotel it was a possibility. The coffee was ridiculously expensive. The staff were very keen to assist but had some English issues. The cab from the Hotel to the port that they organised was amazing. Full leather with Wifi, TV Internet screens etc. Note it was only 30 minutes to the port not long enough to play with everything.

We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel, as part of our honeymoon trip around Japan, and we discovered that apart from the beautiful and confortable design of the room, and the amazing views of the city, the location is just perfect! Very convenient if you are moving around using the metro or JR, and just 10 minutes away by foot to Ginza.

We had booked the Romantic room type with a view of Tokyo Tower and boy we weren't disappointed! The view was breathtaking, especially in the evenings. We had planned to check out some bars but instead just bought a few drinks from the Family Mart downstairs and enjoyed them in our room. Location wise, it was fantastic. We were pretty much next door to Shiodome station (for Metro trains) which was connected via underground to Shimbashi station for all JR trains. Also a short walk to Ginza and Yuracucho area. Will definitely be recommending!

The Park Hotel is a beautiful, quiet hotel located in the Shiodome district. Situated on the 25th floor of the Shiodome Media Tower, the hotel is strategically located near Shinbashi and the Tsukiji fish market. Rooms are spacious with excellent views of Tokyo Tower and the Tokyo skyline. The Yurikamome and subway are within walking distance and there are several shopping complexes (Caretta Shiodome) nearby with restaurants and stores. Price is excellent for the area and compared to nearby similar level hotels. They have an art theme where several rooms are decorated with the art of local Japanese artists.

Great location and views over Tokyo. General restaurants shops available in public area part of the building, there is a 7/11 in basement area. Great english speaking staff in reception, comfortable room.On tube line and the driverless monorail which I recommend you take a return trip to the bay area - very easy and pretty with open spaces to walk by the bay. Takes about 1/2 an hour each way.Choice of Trad western breakfast or asian. The buffet food could have been kept hotter, fair amount of choice.

This hotel was really nice. Very close to the train. Helpful concierge, I emailed them before my trip several times and they arranged a car service to pick me up at Narita and helped me during my stay. Breakfast was fantastic, very fresh. The bakery on the 1st floor of the building has the most delicious baked goods. The only negative is that the area is very commercial so you don't get a neighborhood feeling at all.

The area was a bit intimidating at first, monorails, pedestrian walkways in the air which became useful for avoiding crowds on the streets. Very modern and skyscraper sleek, filled with worker bees. The location was very good, Ginza within easy walking distance as was Tsukiji Fish Market and the lovely Hama-Rikyu Gardens. We sprang for the Corner King Tower viewand every night when we came home it was a beautiful sight - the city laid out beneath us.The food was not good enough but who wants to eat in the hotel ...and there aremany choices reachable thru the spacious underground passageways of the stations.Breakfast was not included in our rate and we found it not worth $25pp. Overall a good stay - not 5stars because of the food and the service but a good choice nonetheless.

Pricey hotel with everything available to you, except no bottled water supplied as with our other hotels, so buy your own. Breakfast is good (not included), lunch is good and the train station accessible from the third floor has many restaurants including a bakery. We had the Tokyo Tower outside our window, which is spectacular at night. Taxis were easily available and Ginza was around the corner (driving). I'd stay here again.

We love to stay here as our first place to adjust to Japan, It is conveniently located close to the Shimbashi station which goes basically everywhere and also close to the Yurikamome that you can take to if you'd like to go to Odaiba. The rooms are good size and the Thann spa massage in the hotel is wonderful! Beer and water vending machine on my floor and even a washer dryer if needed, although it takes quite awhile to dry.American breakfast food as well as Japanese in the morning offered as a buffet and I always just order a glass of wine and sit in the seats downstairs and use the wifi to catch up on work.

Stayed here for 6 nights with my husband. Staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Room was a good size, clean, bright and included a mini fridge, safe and hairdryer. The hotel takes up floors 25-34 of a news building so all the rooms have an awesome view, but ask for a view of the Tokyo tower-it is breathtaking at night. Easy access to Ginza neighborhood and the Shiodome subway station connects underground. I would love to stay at this hotel when we return to Tokyo in the future.

Located just off the Ginza line, the location makes it an ideal base to explore Tokyo. We were very pleasantly surprised with the price when we arrived - it is excellent value especially considering other prices we paid in Japan.The hotel in located in the top of a skyscraper offering stunning views across Tokyo, ask for a Tokyo tower view.The service was attentive and very helpful, couldn't have asked for any more. Look forward to staying again on our next visit

Firstly this hotel is really difficult to find particularly if you arrive by train. There are no signs until you get to the doors. Hotel starts on the 25th floor great views. The staff are very friendly and helpful but it is a typical city hotel and expensive to eat in the restaurants. One 120ml glass of wine cost 1100 yen. The area around the hotel has lots of restaurants but they are nothing special and the area lacks atmosphere. If you want Tokyo nightlife don't stay here.

Stayed here during a 24 hour layover. Easy to get to from the airport. Beautiful room with a great view of the city. Staff was also nice enough to watch our luggage after we checked out and explored the city.

We spent 3 nights in this hotel. The hotel lobby is on the 25th. Floor and the bedrooms are above so the views over Tokyo are fantastic. The hotel itself is very central and 2 stops on the JR train line which is only a couple of minutes away brings you into the centre of the city. It takes about 5 minutes.The breakfast in the hotel is expensive but there is a nice coffee shop on the ground floor which serves a lighter breakfast. We had dinner in the hotel's French Restuarant and it was excellent although wine is very expensive. The only downside we found was the beds were very hard so perhaps the hotel could look at this as we noticed someone else had commented on them too.

My family stayed for one night in a double bedroom with Tokyo Tower view. The view is fabulous because the hotel is located in very high floors. First impression is the décor is very nice with plenty of artwork and painting everywhere in the hotel lobby, corridors and rooms. It is a beautiful hotel in Tokyo. Easy access to Toei subway and monorail stations. Or just less than 7 minutes, 1460 yen taxi ride from JR Tokyo station.Excellent customer service from all staffs we came across.

First time to Tokyo, really enjoyed our stay small city view rooms with great comfortable facilities - Location Excellent 10min walk to brillant Ginza shopping & eating! 1min walk from Shiodome station or 10 min to Shimbashi walk under ground tunnel is the quickest option. . . TIP; Wifi access on arrival into Tokyo is must do! it is rather confusing trying to find your way above ground or below ground so much foot traffic bridges and hotels dont have name on the building. Buy a 2G sim card got us through 2 weeks perfectly with alot of use.

This is a 4 star hotel with a 5 star staff in a giant office park with nothing at Street level. In a different location I would love this place, but where it's located you do need to take cabs around...or walk a 15+ minute walk to the subways through the underground where the map is way off scale. For Business or a place to go shopping in Ginza and do a day trip or two a good spot. For nightlife, there is nothing here. Again, it's very nice, has very good restaurants, a movie set like lounge and exceptional staff. Thing is as a New Yorker...not being able to go downstairs and hit the street for bars and restaurants and how difficult it is to navigate the underground and 3rd floor walkaround it just wasn't for me. I would strongly recommend you take a cab to this hotel from whatever Train station you come from and make sure you get the address in Japanese from the Hotel.

Excellent hotel. Get a room looking over the Tokyo tower and you might get a sunset over my Fuji (which was epic for us) . The area around the hotel is pretty dull but very convenient for getting elsewhere

Good hotel. Rooms are average size, beautiful view with sitting area. Food however was overpriced. Wouldn't suggest the breakfast but the dinner was nice in the lounge area (very small menu)Staff were friendly and close to shimbashi station!

Park Hotel is located on the 25th floor upwards in the Shiodome Tower ,which is very centrally located.it is convenient for business travellers and for tourists. From this tower one can easily access the underground train station hence very convenient to commute. The hotel rooms are small but otherwise comfortable and all amenities are there. The management is very helpful . The pick up coach comes to the hotel for airport transfer several times in the day. As the hotel area starts from the 25 th floor & above ,the view from the rooms is good.

Not every room has Tokyo tower view. However, it's so enjoyable to have beautifully night view from 29F height. Hotel crews are friendly. Lobby is simple, elegant, and fancy. About 5 min walk to MRT with many restaurants nearby.

It's difficult to choose the best thing about this hotel since everything was wonderful. The rooms are very clean, spacious and well appointed with a thoughtful amenity package and little details (like a no-fog area on the mirror) make a huge difference. Having coffee & tea in the room in the morning was a nice way to start the day. Elevators are swift and the lobby area is beautiful. Directly exiting from the 3rd floor of the hotel you can jump on the Yurikamome Line to Odaiba where there is a great onsen and many other things to do. For all of your other journeys, you merely take the elevator to the basement level and walk (via underground passage) to the Shimbashi station or Ginza metro, hop on and go anywhere. On the way to the station you'll have many restaurant choices and a Family Mart to pick up any needed items (water, sundries, tasty snacks). This hotel is in a tremendously convenient location. If you take a taxi anywhere, beware that many will try to drop you off at the wrong hotel as there is a Royal Park hotel nearby and the drivers will get confused. The concierge at the Park Hotel will give you a flyer or a business card that you can give the taxi drivers to clarify where they need to take you when you're trying to get back to the hotel. Service at the Park Hotel Tokyo is stellar! The staff constantly greets you and offers assistance - extremely attentive. All of our interactions with the staff were efficient and friendly and they were especially helpful in accommodating our request for a room change when someone in our party had to leave earlier than expected. Binod (bell staff) assisted us to our room and seemed to be everywhere throughout our stay - always smiling. Concierge N.Chiome extraordinarily committed to ensuring we had a good stay and concierge Ms. Shiraki took extra steps to help us with every request. Overall it was a 5 star experience at an unbeatably reasonable price. Would definitely return!

The hotel is very well located, just near a JR station and Ginza.Rooms are pretty small, but modern.The Japanese restaurant is not worth going and the staff is very rude to foreigners.The overall service is a 3 star service.

We booked a room for four adults via Hotels.com and I started receiving notification that there was "an issue with my reservation" several days before we left the US. We called Hotels.com and they said the room we had booked didn't hold four adults but the Park Hotel was giving us an additional room for free. I was a bit skeptical and concerned since we were arriving in Tokyo at 10:00pm and going straight to this hotel. But this is exactly what happened - we had no problem at check-in and we definitely needed the extra room as what we had booked contained only two twins.The service here was outstanding, the views are very nice (this hotel occupies floors 25 and above of a large building). The room was comfortable though smaller. We ate at this hotel once and the food was okay -the breakfast looked very big but we did not try it. There is not a lot to walk to from this hotel (I think the train station is nearby) but it is in a nice location somewhat near the Tokyo Tower (you can see it from the lobby and some rooms) and nice areas of Tokyo. I would definitely stay here again.

The location of this hotel is fantastic for touring Tokyo as you can walk to both Shimbashi JR / metro station and Shiodome metro station in less than 5 mins. The service from all staff in the hotel was outstanding. Rooms were k pt lovely and clean. Only downside was a tiny wardrobe space and not very large room, even though we upgraded. This seems to be the norm in Tokyo but not ideal if you are travelling for a while and have a decent amount of luggage. We are in Japan for 3 weeks and couldn't actually unpack properly. We ate in the restaurant once and both had really tasty meals.

My overall experience at this hotel was great, the rooms were comfortable and tidy, and the staff were very nice to us. I was sad that we only stayed 2 nights. The views from my room was also amazing, and I could have stared at it forever (Tokyo is beautiful at night). The hotel's appearance immediately pulled me into it, and the interior was also extremely appealing and unique, I loved every aspect of the design, both interior and exterior. I didn't have any food there however, because my family doesn't usually eat in hotels when travelling, to save some money. I would say that the price for the hotel is a great deal, it even surprised me at how nice the rooms were for the price.

This hotel is in a great location near the train and ginza district. The rooms are typically small but well appointed and comfortable. The staff are friendly and very helpful. We had amazing views of Tokyo tower and my Fuji.

Our family of four stayed here for our last night in Japan. At check-in they swiftly organised our two rooms side-by-side, with terrific views of the Tokyo Tower. We checked out at 11am, and, as we were flying at 10pm, left our bags with the hotel to go explore the city. The lady at the front desk said that when we came back, we could use the shower facilities in the gym to freshen up for our flight home. Great service. We will be back.

We did not stay at the hotel but we visited our hosts in order to have dinner and see the great view. We looked for it though for a while as no one knew where to direct us to find the Shiodome area. We walked around it a lot at first.

If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view of the Tokyo tower then you are in for a treat. On a clear day you can see Mount Fuji from your hotel room window. Unfortunately the view was the only redeeming quality of the room. The room itself looked really tired and worn. There were scratches everywhere the carpet looked well worn and thread bare in certain places. The bathroom sink had a large crack in it and smelt musty.Upon arrival in the lobby the hotel looks really modern and stylish. So it came as quite a surprise when we saw the room. Breakfast was simple and limited in choice which was another surprise as I would have expected more from a hotel like this.The staff was very friendly and polite, no problems whatsoever. The hotel is in a very convenient location with good access to public transportation.

My wife and I stayed here when we landed in Tokyo. The room was excellent as was the coffee shop. The art on the walls and in the common areas by Japanese artists was a nice touch. What was truly exceptional however was the care and attention lavished on us by all the hotel staff, especially a lady at the concierge desk called Shimose Nozumi who went out of her way to be helpful. Park Hotel was a great introduction to a great country.

I stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo for 2 nights last month and had a great experience! The staff were very friendly and helpful and check-in was a breeze. I stayed in a room with a Tokyo Tower view which was a beautiful cityscape especially at night with the tower lit up. I would definitely recommend it if you want a nice city view. I found that Tokyo (at least in the Shiodome) had a lot of hotels that are the top floors of a building on top of a commercial building. In this case, the lobby of the Park Hotel Tokyo was on the 25th floor and all of the rooms were above that. So no matter what every room was at a high vantage point with great views of the city. The hotel is located in the Shiodome area of Tokyo which is a short walk from Ginza and Tsukiji Market (very useful if you're trying to go to the auction or Sushi Dai early in the morning). Also, the Shimbashi station is about a 10 min walk and provides access to just about everywhere else in Tokyo. There's also a lot of great restaurants around Shimbashi station. Also as a tip, there are both above ground and underground pathways that lead to both Shimbashi station and Ginza that I had a lot of fun navigating through. I'd definitely recommend staying at the Park Hotel Tokyo.

Very good hotel. Modern, comfortable, extremely clean, great views over Tokyo. We had one of the artistic rooms - nice touch. Staff welcoming and extremely helpful if you have requests. Excellent English speakers. The whisky bar has an impressive selection with brilliant presentation using hand carved ice balls. Wifi strong. One minor criticism is the breakfast which is a bit ordinary and of variable quality. Some of the bread seemed quite stale, but pastries good. Not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. Did not really try the restaurants. 10 min easy walk to station once you figure out the maze of pedestrian walkways. Limousine bus service from/to airport at the door handy.

We stayed 7 nights at this hotel as part of our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier with our stay. The hotel staff was always very friendly to us and spoke excellent English- we are from the U.S. so that was very helpful. The room was always clean and a pretty good size, plus since the hotel starts on the 25th floor of the building, it had great views of the city below. The location is great as it's right next to a couple subway stations and it was pretty central within the city of Tokyo. All the activities we wanted to do were within 5-10 subway stops. Even Disney was very easy to get to from the hotel. After long days of sight-seeing we were always very happy to come back to this hotel. Thank you for a great stay!! We will recommend to others!!

We wanted the best hotel that we could afford in a location closest to where we wanted to travel with a super clean room with an excellent view of the city and an extra helpful friendly staff. The Park Hotel did not dissapoint and meet all of our expectations, but like most vacationers a little cheaper without the loss of quality of service would have been nice. Thanks Park Hotel.

We couldn't have asked for more, except for a swimming pool and maybe an additional TV channel in English (only CNN)! The location was outstanding - we stumbled upon Ginza after walking back from the fish markets and the Shimbashi train station was a couple of minutes away either under or above ground. Every staff member we met was extremely friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is clean, the staff is very polite and views are good from every room as the lobby is in the 25 th floor and all the rooms are above it. The breakfast is very basic, actually a bit under. We had a premium king room which price was high but there wasn't anything special in the room. Clean, but lack of personality, not worth of paying extra. Taxi drivers always took as to a wrong hotel because they only knew the Royal Park Hotel which is a couple of blocks away. It was annoying as it was impossible to explain to drivers because they don't speak english at all.

I will admit that coming from a large, high-tech room at the Conrad Hotel in Seoul I was a bit taken aback at how small my 'queen-size' room was at the Park Hotel. However, I learned that small hotels rooms are the norm in this huge city with 20+ million people, especially for a reasonable price. Over the course of 6 nights, I got past the size of the room and appreciated both its cleanliness and the large window with a fantastic view of the city, facing Tokyo Tower. I also really appreciated the excellent staff, who spoke English well and went out of their way to be helpful, especially with transportation and the logistics of getting around Tokyo. The housekeeping staff kept the room very clean and well stocked with toiletries. The hotel is also well-situation, right above a train station and near shops, restaurants and small grocery stores. The food in the hotel is also good. I will likely be returning soon to Tokyo, again on business, and will consider staying at the Park Hotel again.My two suggestions to the staff: 1.) your lobby is on the 25th floor. Walking into a large business building is confusing and carrying a lot of luggage by oneself while trying to figure out where to go is difficult and inconvenient. Other hotels like the Conrad next door have staff at the entrance to welcome and direct guests, and assist with their luggage. It would be much appreciated if your hotel did this as well. 2.) The bed was not comfortable, and I know I wasn't the only guest who thought that. 6 nights on an uncomfortable mattress made sleep difficult. Please consider investing in a better quality mattress for your rooms.

I stayed at the hotel for three nights during a first visit to Tokyo. The hotel tower can be a little tricky to access initially but otherwise central to many areas, notably the westerner friendly and flashy Ginza neighborhood.The professionalism of the hotel and hospitality industry in Japan is striking at first. Things are thought of, attention to detail is commonplace, and staff generally go out of their way to keep you satisfied. The Park Hotel follows form with all of the above.I opted for one of the slightly larger, "artist" rooms, which I was plenty happy with. Small and efficient by western standards, but clean and well appointed. I ate at all three of the property's restaurants. All were borderline quite good. The hotel's staff and service are what makes it success. As a westerner haven type property I can only imagine the volume of obnoxious American (I'm American) and other ignorant tourists they deal with, yet seeming maintain an impressive level of care and patience toward their guests. Don't expect magic, but for the money this hotel is a safe bet I would wholly recommend and may return to.

I am disappointed at writing this review, why, because my wife and I had such a great time in Tokyo and the people were absolutely lovely and this hotel, the location was spot on perfect! but about the hotel.... the location is where it stops.This hotel is linked to a business office building so you have to go through the ground floor turn right, go through the doors, go up a few a levels in the elevator and then you will be in the hotel itself. Now when we used the shuttle limo bus from the airport, we saw that at every hotel we stopped, staff would come out and greet the bus driver and then take the customers to the concierge and I guess assist them with check-in.With Park Hotel Tokyo, the bus driver took our bag down and we had to make our own way there. When we were at check-in the service staff were excellent of course as all Japanese culture is. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade for $xxxx (can't recall the exact price) a night however we said no thank you, we would like to use the money to enjoy ourselves in Japan. Just want to let the managers of this hotel know that both in Hong Kong and Beijing (which we were prior to our last stop in Tokyo), we were offered a upgrade for a fee and when we said no as we wanted to have fun outside the hotel, they said because it was our first time in their hotel, they upgraded us anyways for free. P.S the hotel (I AM CERTAIN) was not fully booked.After finally checking in, we got to our room. Looking at the artwork in the hotel lobby, we could only imagine how nice our room was. When we got in... it was a shock. The room was very very very small. Yes, I have stayed at several hotels in my life for both Business and Leisure and both in Australia and outside Australia, but this hotel was small.There was an artwork on the wall but that is about it! I would have much rather not put the very hi-tech toilet and spent (assuming) $5,000aud and perhaps made the room slightly more comfortable.Furthermore to find that I had to shower in a Bathtub where I had to use the shower curtains as a method to stop the water from going out.... I was willing to ask the concierge to find us another hotel room but wife convinced me not to.The hotel is known for it's artwork, having shower curtains is not very artistic.The beds are not very comfortable either. Unsure if this is Japanese technology or the secret of sleeping comfort however they were not.On a much brighter note - the hotel is situated perfectly within 2 minute walk to the train station and over 50 restaurants and bars including small grocery stores.The hotel staff are extremely friendly and a pleasure to deal with as are all people in Japan.The buffet breakfast we had was delicious however I would make a small note to management, I understand the location of the restaurant is quite tight, however it would have been good not to sit so very close to each other.In Summary:If you don't care about your hotel as you are planning to enjoy Tokyo outside the hotel, then definitely stay here as it's location is prime!If they change the bedding style and build proper shower that has a shower head and shower glass door, then I would stay in this hotel again, otherwise, if they gave me $200AUD discount each night, I still don't think I would stay here.

I chose this hotel over another equally fine hotel nearby on the basis of its really helpful response to my enquiries about transport from Narita, which worked out seamlessly. The queen room was comfortable, well organized and impeccably serviced daily and had a very good view through a large window (which also had a padded seating ledge) towards the Sumida river and the Hama Rikyu Gardens, including other high rise buildings close by. Others rooms face toward Tokyo Tower, but you can get this view in reception. This is an art hotel with some individual rooms painted by artists; but the splendid atrium (which starts at Reception and the comfortably furnished foyer on floor 25 and goes to level 34) abounds with art exhibits which guests and the public can enjoy. There was a beautiful temporary exhibition during our stay which included night time light projections on the atrium wall. Tokyo is confusing for a first time visitor, but concierge staff here offered invaluable advice that made everything achievable, including personalised maps with detailed instructions on how to access the subway and different lines, as well as making excellent recommendations for dining. It was like having a personal guide to the city and we greatly appreciate this skilled local knowledge.

Family of 4 with 2 youngsters. Stayed in a twin room which was spacious enough. The staff are very courteous, friendly and helpful and we're able to communicate clearly in pretty good English. Advised on places to eat and how to get around. My daughter unfortunately came down with a high fever and the quickly arranged for a taxi as well as called ahead to the hospital and provided all the relevant information we would need. The hotel is in a very convenient location, walking distance to Ginza the Tsukiji fish market and close to major train stations Shiodome and Shimbashi just below. The Hamarikyu gardens very nearby are worth a visit. For those with kids, they will really appreciate a visit to the Hakuhinkan toy shop also short walking distance away. In the hotel if you go to basement 2, there is a family mini mart open I think 24hrs which is good for snacks. From there you can also access the train stations. And you can access the Caretta building which has numerous restaurants. Instead of going to the first floor if you go to the third floor then you can get around the immediate vicinity using overhead walkways. Sound like a small thing but I appreciated the free filter coffee in the rooms, staying at another hotel at present that costs twice as much and no coffee and stayed at one which was 3 times the price and only provided cheap instant coffee. The kids also liked the free sweets at the reception. Didn't eat in the hotel as food options nearby were so convenient including breakfast at the Tsukiji market which you should make time for.I would almost give the hotel 5 stars, the service, cleanliness and value is 5 stars. To get a better quality room one would have to spend much more. Would definitely stay there again.

This is an excellent hotel located next to Shinbashi station (a few minutes walk away via the Skywalk - although we did get lost one night trying to find the right exit so beware). The rooms are largely and clean and the staff enthusiastic. The breakfast (either Japanese or western) buffet style.We really enjoyed our stay and will be going back in a couple of weeks.

Excellent allocation, very well trained staff, clean, modern, close to many subway and railroad stations, 10 min walk to the harbour, neighborhood with small restaurants of Japanese food, etc. Can't complain

Park Tokyo hotel was a great selection of staying 3 days in Tokyo. The adjacent train station (shiodome station) and underground connection to metro (shinbaji station)net are the its best benefits. You could reach the Tokyo spots in minutes. Although if you prefer you could walk (15min) to Ginza or to Tsukiji market. The hotel also enjoys a privilege view to Tokyo city and Mt Fuji on a clear day. We stayed at 32 level and the lobby is at 25 level, where you have your breakfast.

This is an excellent hotel in Shimbashi, just two stops from Tokyo station (JR line). The lobby is on the 25th floor, and the rooms are on the floors above it. I stayed in the Bamboo room overlooking the Shimbashi train station. Didn't know to ask for a view of the Tokyo Tower... Service was excellent. There are many, many restaurants right next to the hotel, and also in Ginza, which is a few minutes walk. One problem was the noise from the trains - not terrible, but didn't expect that on the 31st floor.

We found this hotel relatively easy to find, we had the hotel's instructions and used the underground passage ways to get to the hotel. Our room was not available on arrival - we had got there very early. Within an hour we were contacted to say we could move in to our room which was fantastic. We had a Tokyo Tower view room which was well appointed with a comfy bed a choice of pillows too. The Tokyo Tower was great to look at in the evening with the different coloured lights and the city spread out around.The staff were very helpful and friendly. If you like shopping Ginza is very close and an easy walk. One of the highlights for us was finding one of the main streets in Ginza closed to traffic on a Saturday and people taking photos from the middle of the street and just enjoying the extra space. In a crowded city like Tokyo, having the whole street to wander along was real luxury! Would recommend this hotel to others if you are looking for a central Tokyo City stay.

This hotel is a bit tricky to find, we asked policemen on the way to get there and they were extremely helpful, but once you get your orientation right, you will love it just like we do. Great view from the room either from Tokyo Bay or Tokyo tower, we had The Bay view. We enjoyed the first moment we walked in. We checked in a bit earlier, no problem, the room was available! It was a Japanese hospitality that made you all feel welcome. It closes to another train line so get the subway map from the hotel and you will be fine. Will stay there next time we visit Tokyo again for sure and can't wait !

We had a wonderful stay at The Park Hotel. A great room with a fantastic view, an excellent location, wonderful friendly and helpful staff, and an extensive breakfast buffet, We chose a corner room which was more than adequate for us. The room was always spotlessly clean. Loved the warm toilet seat. We were able to travel around Tokyo easily from the nearby Shimbashi train station and there are a number of interesting sites to visit within walking distance such as the Tsukiji Fish Market and the Ginza shopping area.

We were booked here for three days by our tour company. We stayed in one of the artist rooms. Felt unbelievably pampered by the staff. Our room was gorgeous and deluxe king bed was enormous. Our view was nice too. The morning buffet has everything you would want to eat. The location next to rail station, shopping and restaurants is ideal. Also within walking distance from Hamarikyu Park, a must visit. We loved every moment of our stay here.

This was my third stay at Park Hotel Tokyo in four years. I had booked a City Queen room at 18.900 Yen. The room wasn't great, a bit dark and had a funny smell when I arrived. Also, it was too small. I was told 22 sq-meters but it looked more like 18-19 sq-m. I upgraded to King-size room which is far better for an additional 4.000 Yen.My general impression was that this hotel now needs to pay attention to small details. For instance, there was a couple of times when the room wasn't cleaned up to standards. This didn't happen in my two previous stays. Also the walls at B2 level need to be repainted, that the hotel's private access from subway station level.Staff is helpful and friendly especially the younger employees, some senior staff seemed bored to work there, especially at the lounge.There used to be coupons with a discount for breakfast that makes it more attractive.

We spent a night here prior to joining a cruise. The hotel starts from the 25th floor with office space below (not uncommon in Chinese & Japanese hotels we've been to). Wonderfully welcoming staff, efficient & cheerful check-in and clean, comfy & well appointed room. We had a twin room but beds were larger than standard singles & extremely comfy. Despite the hotel being in the middle of such a busy metropolis (we didn't think there was a single inch of spare space in Tokyo) with a rail line running above the road right outside, our room was so quiet you could forget exactly where you were.

For the price you cannot beat this hotel in Tokyo. It is a great location. Easy to get to from Narita or Haneda. Service is excellent. Rooms are remarkably comfortable. Great water pressure and hot water; excellent toiletries.If I had a complaint it would be that the linens are a little bit worn.This is now my regular hotel in Tokyo.

Within quick & easy reach of central Tokyo. Close to attractions such as the Ginza. Good value for money. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms on top floor gave good view and sufficient space to meet our requirements.

We were very happy to spend our last night in Japan in this lovely hotel. Wonderful welcome, staff provided great check in service and escorted us and our luggage to our room, making sure we knew where everything was. Very nicely appointed room and we enjoyed the view from the 29th floor. So easy to walk to the Ginza shopping area for sightseeing, and hotel happy to look after luggage after checkout. Also used the Airport Limousine Bus to get to Narita Airport.

This hotel location and overall service was excellent, The French restaurant is not. Average food and poor service. Wine selection was terrible and wine pour worse. I wouldvstay here again, but avoid the food venues. Staff was great in the remainder of the hotel. There was easy access to Ginza and downtown events. Bus to Haneda was also very good.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and it is a great base for a holiday. The metro station was right next to the hotel and the JR also less a 5 minute walk from the hotel, which is very handy. The staff are very nice and the rooms are very clean. The gym is very small and needs to be booked in advance. They had 3 machines and 1 wasn’t working at the time and only two people can use it at a time. They offer a buffet breakfast (at cost) which had variety of western and Japanese items.The Tokyo Tower can be seen from the reception desk and is around 20 minute walk from the hotel. Ginza is also walking distance.

We stayed in one of the 'art rooms'. Although the rooms are somewhat small (even by Japanese standards), they are well-appointed and comfortable. The best part about staying at the Park Hotel was the helpful staff. When I mistakenly booked the hotel online for one extra night they allowed me to cancel the extra night with no penalty. The concierge was very gracious and helped us make numerous reservations for events in the city. The front desk was always ready with directions and the room service was very prompt too. All-around I recommend this hotel.

Having stayed at a couple of Hotels in Tokyo during this trip we were very impressed with the service here. The Park is conveniently located close to the Shimbashi Station and makes for easy transport around Tokyo via the Metro subway system.The service at the hotel is the thing that stood out for us. You have several restaurant options and also room service (not standard in Tokyo) which is handy when you are a tired traveller. We particularly liked the bakery on floor 1 which allowed for an easy snack lunch or dinner with Camembert cheese and wine from the family mart at the bottom of the building.Staff had excellent English skills and were exceedingly attentive, right down to the greeting of staff at the reception area and delivering luggage to your room. Our bags were carried down to the airport limousine bus stop at the entrance to the hotel and the porter waited with us to ensure there we no issues. We found the limousine bus to be the best way to get to and from the airport and was reasonably priced at 3100 Yen per person.The room was generously sized and well appointed with a view of Tokyo Tower which is especially lovely at night.Bathroom was spacious with shower above bath which may be difficult for some with mobility issues.Wifi fast and very easy to use with no password required.Our king size bed was indeed king sized and very comfortable.We were on the 33rd floor and occasionally heard slight rumblings of trains but this was very minor and did not detract from our sleep.Would definitely stay again.

We were on a stopover during our honeymoon and stayed here for a few nights. Everything was perfect, very helpful staff and beautiful amenities. Best part: THE VIEW FROM THE ROOM!! Unbelievable. Also great location, near 2 main metro stations and allowed us to easily get around the city. Very recommendable.

Great location in the heart of Tokyo and near the JR line, although was not aware of the multiple entrances. As after returning from dinner we could not get back into the entrance and had to call for assistance! Staff were extremely friendly and were always willing to help out, great service for suggestions to travel around Tokyo and booking restaurants for us.Hotel design and room was incredible. We stayed in one of the artist's rooms and the views were spectacular! Only downside was the beds were on the uncomfortable side. Would recommend to do Tokyo in style with this hotel!

Just had five days here and it is an excellent place to stay. Right by two main stations with easy access to anywhere you want to go. Pay the extra for a corner room, great views and very spacious . Staff are very helpful, spa is great, breakfast excellent too! Highly recommend.

This hotel is very well located for transport from the basement or walkway of the tower you can access most useful Tokyo subway lines , JR line and monorail within 5 minutes. The service is this hotel was fabulous every member of staff keen to help and really friendly. The breakfast/bar is in the lobby which has a huge atrium ceiling . it ultra modern, had an art exhibition in place when we were staying which included a 20 metre high projected moving art photos. Breakfast buffet was very good some traditional Japanese you could mix and match with your western breakfast. The rooms were on the small side but I think this is fairly normal for Tokyo. Excellent value for money. Note this hotel is also walking distance to the Fish Market ( current location although this maybe moving later this year) . Also walking distance to the Hamarikyu gardens where there is a ferry pier for the Umeda River boat . there are a number of restaurants in the surrounding tower blocks/ shopping centres and only a couple of subway stops to many more. Definitely recommend for location and value for money. Tokyo is so huge that nowhere is the "perfect " place to stay as you will have to travel to other sites/attractions so best if you stay somewhere literally above a subway station.

We would definitely stay in this hotel if we were to visit Tokyo again. The hotel is conveniently located near the train station and you could also get to the airport by train as well from this hotel. One of our rooms were smokey smelling but hotel was fast like lightning and switched out the room immediately and stayed around to make sure they were properly changes into the new room. Hotel staff were always pleasant and courteous and made sure our rooms were to our expectations. Thank you for a wonderful experience at your hotel!

Park Hotel is no hidden gem of good service, impecable design and facilities; it's a bright shining star!We had a week long stay here recently and - having had stayed in Tokyo before - I was shocked at find such an outstanding equilibrium between price and quality. We stayed in one of the rooms overlooking Tokyo tower (costs extra but is worth every penny); the view was simply breathtaking. From the 29th floor, you could literally spend a week just looking around at the scenery, both during night and day. The breakfast was truly amazing, although we did not use it every day. As were the other facilities. The gym is very small (2 persons max) and needs to be booked in advance. You can only book once in advance (so not for a whole week ahead. What was also very usefull was that they have a concierge desk that has a good understanding of English and can help you with any kind of request (from finding a pool to swim, making reservations at restaurants, to renting a bike to buying tickets for an underground techno party). They are very friendly. The thing that will stay with me the most however is the very friendly staff and the amazing, magnificent view. This was one hefty bill that I didn't mind paying. If I ever get back, I will surely stay here again!

I stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo for 9 nights, and I would definitely recommend this location. It is within a short walk or short metro to the Ginza district, and to several sights. The location is central and easy to access. I was very much at home in this hotel. I had a single room, room 3021, and it was nicely appointed and had plenty of space for me. The service is excellent in every way, and the breakfast buffet is varied and quite nice. There is a small guest laundry (or you can send your things out), a small gym and a lovely lounge. The staff are generally multilingual and you will feel comfortable here.

We stayed in Park Hotel Tokyo for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon. We arrived directly from the airport using the Airport Limousine Bus service from Narita (was about 3200 each, or 30USD/CHF).Upon arrival, the concierge was very welcoming and took our bags directly to the room, check in was smooth and the receptionist gave us a couple of recommendations of places to eat nearby (it was quite late when we arrived). Also the concierge desk (and reception) is very useful for booking restaurant/trips, I highly recommend using them to avoid any telephone calls directly. They will also print off directions and picture of the exact location (sometimes quite hard)We took a Tower view room and were not disappointed by the view, it was incredible (especially for the reasonable price...). The room itself is relatively small (which I hear is normal for Tokyo), but I have had smaller rooms in Europe before, however the window to the view has a great seat/bench so you can just stare off into the distance!The hotel is relatively well located (Shiodome station or Shimbashi), however you would need to take Metro/JR to the majority of the sights/attractions. We just bought a suica card and 2,500 each was enough to travel for the duration of our stay (we are big walkers though, so some might need some more)Bed, bathroom was all to a high standard and the room was serviced every day. This was our first experience of Japanese toilet, which was very interesting! Wifi is included too. We did not try the restaurant inside the hotel, however with all the amazing food in Tokyo, I am not sure why one would. For breakfast, we used to use the "FamilyMart" (small supermarket) to buy some coffees, snacks, or go to a Starbucks/equivalent on the way to the station.Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our time in Tokyo and the modern, smooth Park Hotel Tokyo really helped us ensure to get a good rest and still get to enjoy the view!Would stay again and recommend.

Well what to say about this beautiful place. The huge window behind reception set the scene and they even wished me a happy birthday for the following day during check in. We were allocated a top floor room overlooking Tokyo tower which left us slack-jawed as we entered. Try to stay on the top floor, it's stunning. Although with rooms starting on (I think) floor 25, you can't really get a bad view. The room itself was more spacious than we anticipated and easily on par with standard London hotel rooms. We had space for 2 stupidly large suitcases open on the floor, walking room around the bed even with our things escaping the cases, a chair and table by the window and a clear path to the bathroom. The bathroom was great and I was amazed by the little steam free area on the mirror which is just at face height - what a touch! The service we encountered was top notch and I even got a half bottle of champagne as a birthday gift which set my birthday celebrations off with a bang. Everyone was so polite, helpful and calming in their manner. We returned to the hotel bar for some post-birthday-dinner drinks and met the most wonderful chatty bar manager who talked us through a world of whisky, even offering up some tasters from his very own collection. We tried his favourite which was a crazy super-burning batch made in total limited quantities. Very lucky!As amazing as the views are during the day, the city always comes alive at night and I could have sat on the windowsill seat for the rest of my days, watching the teeny tiny cars and trains below making their way to new towns. The bullet trains are so quiet as they pass and we could barely hear them through the toughened windows. Upon leaving, we chose to forward our baggage on to the next city and when I enquired as to how it would work when we arrived at the next hotel, the bell porter informed me she had already called ahead to confirm everything so we just needed to check in and the bags would be delivered to the room. A system so efficient I feel like it could never work anywhere else in the world, despite how convenient it would be.All in all an amazing stay for my 30th birthday and every bit what I had imagined. Thank you to the park hotel for making it so special! Arigatou gozaimasu!

The hotel is is conveniently located for JR Yamanote line, which will get you to most of the major tourist sites; plus subway lines as well. There are restaurants nearby, however, the choice is limited. We had a room that over looked the river and Odaiba, which was nice. The beds are king size, unlike alot of hotels; and you can change the pillows which we'd reccommend.

I stayed here for 4 nights with my son in July in a twin room.It was my second stay here.I paid extra to stay in Tokyo tower room but I found this room had intrusive train noise so I requested a change after one night to a room overlooking the Hama Rikyu garden which was quiet.The staff are very welcoming and helpful.The lobby has a tall atrium and is very spacious.Breakfast is served there.Compared to the Royal Park Hotel nearby, the Park HotelIs further from Shimbashi stationIs cheaper (rooms and breakfast)Has nicer lobby ambianceHas superior serviceThe comfort of the rooms was similarThe quality of the breakfast is better

We really enjoyed all aspects of this beautiful hotel. It's very clean and comfortable, nothing is too much trouble for the staff, and the views from our room were amazing, even in the rain! Everything you might need is available either in the hotel or in the subway area below. Breakfast is a wonderful array.

Nice hotel in a convenient location. Stayed in a tower view room which had a great view of the Tokyo Tower and surrounding areas of Tokyo. Standard hotel room in the mid price range for Tokyo. Bed was comfortable, TV had a few English speaking channels (there is a button on the remote that changes between English and Japanese if the broadcast was originally in English) and was clean. Bathroom was reasonable size , again clean and stocked with nice quality accessories. Refrigerator in the room with a few drinks but we removed and stocked with stuff from the family mart located just near the rotating door on the same level as the train station. Didn't eat or use any of the facilities so cant comment but the staff were friendly and helpful. As others have said, do not confuse with Tokyo Royal Park Hotel as they are very close by each other.

Park hotel is Located right at the Shimbashi train station, it is easily accessible from Narita Aiport by limo bus.The room was modernly decorated and fairly spacious for Tokyo.The window in our room was very big , basically the whole wall was a window and the view from our room was fantastic, The bathroom was small but spotlessly clean, and well eqipped with loads of goodies. The staff Is courteous and helpful.Breakfast was not included and cost 2400 ¥ per person.

This is a very convenient hotel. There is a subway station in the bastment, an access to another station for a diffrent line on the 3rd floor, walking distance to the Shimbashi JR station and Ginza line thru the walkway in the 3rd floor (about 5 min walk).The staff is great, very welcoming and helpful.Breakfast buffet is 2400 ¥ per person and it starts at 7 am. We only had it our first day and it was very good. As you start walking around the area you will find other options but not available as early.There is a convinience store in the basement (B2) with ATM and good breakfast options.The room was very clean and the views were impresive and we didn't have a Tokyo tower view. I highly recomend this hotel, there are plenty of restaurant options of all price ranges and the access to the main tourist areas. We took a taxi to the Tokyo station to catch the first bullet train to Kyoto (6 am) and the taxi fare was less than 1500¥.

Great and helpful staff for our entire stay. The hotel is situated on a few minutes walk from the train station so easy access to where ever you need to go. The rooms were spotless & well maintained. Breakfast is not included and expect to pay high for in-room dining. I would recommend walking downstairs to the little French pastry shop for your morning fix!

Beautiful rooms, delightful breakfast if you have it included. It is easy to miss the convenience of the hotel if you stick to street level. Rooms have great views of the city.The hotel is walking distance to the Tsukiji fish market (until it moves). One of the best aspects is not obvious. On the ground floor take the escalator down. You'll find a 24 hr family mart, great for jet lag victims getting the munchies at two in the morning. Keep going underground and you can find a McDonalds, various restraurants, currency exchange, drug store, a bigger family mart, access to two subway lines and the Shinbashi rail station.

Me and my partner came for 2 weeks a few months ago.The lobby is calming, with interesting views of art, a sense of large space and natural light. The staff are always on point to help you, and no smallest thing is beyond them. My Japanese is limited, however Shinbashi was a lovely location to practice. The hotel staff however spoke perfect English, which was welcomed since I was a nervous bilingual! The staff deserve the utmost praise and recognition for their efforts, tireless hours and never failing to greet any individual with a warm smile and an offer to help.The hotel itself was clean, with the rooms being a tad on the small side admittedly, but the view was stunning, even though we didn't select the Tokyo Tower view!Our room was always clean, I never spotted one flaw despite being very articulate with cleanliness. The location was fantastic, there were cafes, restaurants and a local station all within a 5 minute walk away. We got to explore a majority of Tokyo (And even had a day trip to Osaka) without any issues on getting there.Also, it's handy to know that if you were like us and needed to print your return flight ticket, you could for free. The staff were very helpful showing us.A taxi is always parked outside, so our trip to the airport was one without blunder as well.I would very much love to come back again.Thank you for making my holiday a throughly pleasant one.

A basic clean and efficient business/tourist hotel. Fairly good value for Tokyo. Uninspiring lobby restaurant/bar. A gym so small you have to make an appointment. It's a little isolated unless you want to walk to Tsukuji Fish Market. Rooms are clean but pretty small with too much furniture for the size.

Lovely hotel conveniently located 15minutes walk to Tsukiji Fish market and Hama-rikyu gardens. The closest subway station is Shimbashi and you can get pretty much anywhere in Tokyo from here. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor and this gives the rooms great views across Tokyo. The rooms are well appointed and the breakfast had a good and varied selection. The staff are ultra polite and it was never a problem at any time to help answer all my questions.Would have no problem recommending staying here.

My wife and I spent the first days of our honeymoon at the Park Hotel. Great location, tasty and varied breakfast and perfect organisation, super clean, speechless view from the room window. The staff was amazing and we loved that nearly every day there was an art exhibition or an installation inside the hotel itself. You can also book a small private gym with view on the City. The overall experience was absolutely wonderful.

This hotel is on the 25th to 34th floor of a high-rise office building. The views are stellar. The room was extremely comfortable, clean, and had amenities beyond what most places have. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My only "suggestion" is that I didn't really know how to get there from the Shimbashi train station -- the hotel's website wasn't very informative, and navigating it was a bit problematic technologically. (Also, when I confirmed the room, I couldn't get a clear PDF from the confirmation page -- it captured some of it but not all of it. I've never had this problem before or since, so I assume it has something to do with how their webpage is set up.) The price was a bit high for my usual standards -- but the place is great. The restaurant options were all way above anything I'd spend money on (e.g., $15 for a glass of wine), so I didn't try any of them. I'm attaching photos of the local map the hotel provided once I arrived - I wish I had this info before I arrived (but didn't find this info on their website). The location was excellent for walking around Ginza, and to the fish market, and to the garden nearby. I'd give this 4-1/2 if I could, but they don't allow half points.

It was nice stay and I wnat to stay again here. Staffs were kind and room condition was good. I especially liked amenity. There was Febreze, which kept me fresh during the trip. Finally, the Tokyo tower room was fantastic.

Good location, super friendly staff. Nice modern hotel, the rooms are great and i think for tokyo standarts in this price range quite spacious. Subway station right in front of the hotel, and lots of restaurants around. Going to be staying here again if i visit tokyo!

We had a modest budget to play with as a family of 4 in Tokyo and believe it or not having searched around before hand the Park Hotel came out as one of the more reasonably priced by Tokyo standards!
