Since it is very close to the railway, you may hear a little train noise in the room, which to me is acceptable.There are limousine bus going to Narita airport and Haneda airport, but not frequent. So you need to check the bus schedule carefully.Staffs can speak very good English, which is quite impressive.Hotel lobby is on 25th floor. Lift entrance at ground floor is a little difficult to locate though. Because there's no clear sign to show you the way from JR station or subway station to the hotel.Anyway, I definitely will stay in this hotel again.

Park Hotel is a modern international hotel at Shinbashi. LOCATION: A few minutes walk from Shinbashi station, so it's really centrally located, just 20 minutes by train to pretty much anywhere in the city. A 10 minute walk to the main part of Chuo Dori street in Ginza. Once youve worked out how to get there from the station, (bit confusing because of the many raised pedestrian walkways etc) it's so easy (walk past the crazy Miyazaki Steam-Punk Clock & you are close... look for the street maps). There are great restaurants nearby in the Shiodome Centre building; at the station and further, at Ginza, plus a Family Mart etc for snacks.LOBBY: On the 25th Floor, beautifully laid out, great view of the city, really interesting artwork (which changes regularly)STAFF: Friendly, efficient and extremely helpful: making bookings for us, helping us with directions etcROOMS: Large by Japanese standards; well laid out; extremely clean; lovely amenities; Artist rooms are a nice touch (even if you dont like the art, how terrific that a modern hotel is trying something different? Full marks from me for that alone) Rooms with a view of Tokyo Tower are stunning.Overall, this is a modern, international standard hotel that has taken an extra step in reaching beyond being a standard bland business hotel.

This is a hotel everyone need to be considered, should you are tired with touristic located hotel. This is hotel with great view, superb service and good location.We had an early bird rate double room with view to Tokyo Tower w breakfast, it was an awesome choices. First, I thought this hotel was hard to reach from Station, however in fact this hotel turned an an excellent choice to move around using subway due to its under ground access to iShimbashi Station and Shodome Station. The hotel is located in Shiodome Media Tower, in the Minato business area, it is quite and upscale where it also close to Ginza and Tsukiji. Lobby is located at 25th Floor of the building. It has an superb staffs, who work with Japanese pride, prompt, politeness and passionate. When we arrived in the early morning, the rooms was not both ready, but they allowed us to occupy one room.We ordered a birthday cake for my wife months in advance, and they really worked and took care the request meticulously. We feel we treated as a special guest when the lady whispered me to ask when the cake should be send to the room. She informed me, that they will send a compliment champagne for us as well. When we backed to get our second key, the front office whispered whether it was the right time to send cake to the room. Finally, we got cake which has manicured as we request as written "HAPPY BIRTHDAY MOM, WE LOVE YOU" with small candle, and champagne. Thank you guys, you are awesome! Arigato! The rooms were adequate size, modern setting and has magnificent Tokyo Tower view. We were lucky since we had a blue sky weather on on our trip. We enjoyed the view of Tokyo Tower with Mount Fuji at the back drop from dusk til dawn..  The breakfast also great. Good selection of foods and meticulous staff in serving. With right location, good size modern room, passionate staffs and great view,This is one of hotel you need to try once you are in Tokyo.

We stayed there from February 29th until March 4th. Overall I can't say anything bad about this hotel, everything was great. We stayed in the corner room on the top floor with great views on the city. A room was a little smaller then I've anticipated but well this is Tokyo not Vegas. Great service, great people. One thing that was very weird to us was that fact the reception area was on 25th floor We arrived at 6 AM in the morning and when we walked into the hotel there was nobody on the first floor. My wife and I got a little worried, we could not believe that the hotel is closed at night. A few minutes later somebody asked us if were to check in and told to go to 25th floor. I wish there was some kind of sign or something just to let people know where reception was.

We were absolutely delighted with our stays at this hotel - from its location to the friendly staff to the clean rooms (with fantastic view of the Tokyo Tower on the 2 separate occasions we stayed) and the laundry and the convenience store at the basement. Nothing could be faulted. Highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here as part of a family holiday in Japan and had a great room with great views. The hotel is in a nice location that is convenient for many attractions but a little quieter. The room and hotel were well kept and clean, and the breakfast which was included was a high quality and a great way to start the day.Now the but... I have held off on writing this review as it is a fairly big but and one that keeps coming back. At ~0400 one morning a fire alarm sounded, stating 'a fire has started on the ground floor, evacuate', after a couple of minutes it was still going so we had no option to evacuate, no easy thing from 30-odd floors up. We started our descent and the alarm kept going, only after ~20 mins and when we were at the 12th floor did it change to 'this has been a false alarm'. On reaching the ground floor in a dark foyer we found a single security guard who didn't speak English and a lady who had no ID and told us to get in a lift back up. Funny but people refused initially. The various explanations that we were given didn't work logically. We were quite shaken by the event, however, the staff just chose to brush it under the carpet and almost denied it had happened.A real shame as we did enjoy the hotel.

I had the impression we are arriving at a 5 star hotel,howeve after havig to make a line at check in after flying 20 hours,that was the first sign it WASNT.Staff extreemy nice and polite ,no bad word here.Attempt to have dinner was denied due to lack of space.Breakfast was good,pricey,like everywhere in so called 4-5 star hotels.THe concierge was very helpful eventhough she was busy most times,an we had to make a few attempts to talk to her( busy with other guests) the room was looking over the Tokyo tower,stunning at night.Room was not very clean,we found hair on the bathroom floor upon arrival,the Bide pipes leaked,and a light to moderate dump smell was in the bathroom coming from the drainage.All reported to reception,were handeled promptly.VEry limited English channels,even CNN is dubbed to Japanese.When we left with lots of luggage on our departure day( the lobby is on the 25 th floor) i was asked if im taking a bus or a taxi to Narita,I answered " Taxi" and was left to help my self. I did see them carry luggage the day before for guests who departed on an airport bus that must be booked in advance,so there must be a deal there between the two,as Taxi guests like us had to struggle downstairs unaided.In general it seems like more of a Japanese Express business hotel,very busy,reception overloaded and so is the concierge desk.We met only one WONDERFUL service provider,an Italina guy who is a waiter at night,wish i remembered his name.Dont worry about coming here,but dont excpect to be a VIP.

When we first arrived we discovered that the hotel lobby is situated at the 25th floor of the building. First impression was that it was awkward but when you are in than you find the amazing side of the hotel with quite, clean rooms with perfect organization and service. The open buffet breakfast was perfect for every taste.

We greatly enjoyed our stay at Park Hotel - it was super easy walking access between JR Shinbashi and the hotel, and the view of Tokyo Tower couldn't be beat! Breakfast was tasty, and we greatly enjoyed everything about this hotel - and can't complain about the price!

It has what you would expect from a good international hotel in Japan. The location is also good. Very much like a good Marriott if you allowed me to compare. Was our very fist experience in Japan and it was comforting after more than a day of traveling from south America!

I don't agree with the hotel description as being luxurious. My room was pretty basic, small and a little worn. The staff is very friendly. However the gentleman working the bar / dining area needs to be a bit more flexible. I asked if I could order some food. The time was 10:15 but was told no. I wanted to sit in the dining area and eat but was told I could go up to my room and order room service. I asked if I could order room service and eat it in the bar area and again no. Way to make a guest feel welcome after a long day of travel.

I like that the rooms are given much more authenticity by having an artist room concept! The service is top notch. At the lobby you never need to ask for attention when you need something, they rush over to you immediately.Would've wanted a guest-only-limit access to guestroom floors though.All in all, our stay was great! Has direct access to subway, so that's a major plus!

I liked this hotel. Very clean and up-to-date. Friendly staff. Modern with a Japanese asthetic. Room was small but efficient. Location near trains and metro--worried it would be noisy, but it wasn't bad. Not a very touristy area, though close to Ginza. Wished there was a small shop or casual Cafe--there seemed to be in the building but all was closed on the weekend. Seems more a place for business people to stay perhaps? Still, a very positive experience. If you want to be in that area of Tokyo, I would highly recommend.

Great hotel for under $300. Located in Ginza, with easy access to the subway to get around Tokyo. The rooms have great views and for a bit extra you can get an artist room. The bar is nice and intimate and there are a few restaurants within the hotel

Staff were great, the cleanliness and facilities within this hotel are excellent. The location for the Metro, restaurants and various sights is excellent - it's only a short walk to Tjuksi Fish Market, the Monorail for Odaiba (would certainly recommend a visit) stops at Shiodome.We cannot speak highly enough about the friendliness and responsiveness of the staff here. The location is first class (sits over the top of Shiodome station and is a short walk to Shimbashi station (Metro), and the rooms are of a very high standard - we stayed in 2631 (Koi Carp - Artist Room). By the way, the WiFi is very fast which can be quite unusual in the many hotels I have stayed!

Accomodation is very nice with a view of the Tokyo tower although a bit small if you're checking in with family. Staff really provided good customer service and even waited with us for our taxi to arrive.

Location:The Hotel is located inside Shiodome Media Tower, starting at 25th floor. It is connected to Shiodome station ( Yurikamome Line) and Shinbashi station ( Yamanote and several other Subway Lines) by walkway ( ~5 min), making it an excellent location for sighseeing around Tokyo. Major hotspots like Tokyo Tower, zojo- ji shrine, Imperial Palace and Tsukiji Fishmarket are within walking distance.The Hotel itself is somewhat into Art, with a lot of paintings, handycraft, sculptures etc on display all around the public area. Hotel bar has its own DJ, mostly playing relaxing lounge music.Rooms:We had a premium room on Floor 29, approx 30sqm. Room was in pretty good shape, with enough unused space for our baby cot. High quality bathroom amenities from Thann. Our first room was directed towards the rail tracks, which are highly frequented in Tokyo (Yamanote departs every 3-5 min, Shinkansen about every 5-7 min). Despite being on 29th floor, it can get rather noisy. Don´t get me wrong, it is not as bad as it might sound, just if you have a light sleep, make sure you get your room set away from the tracks.Service:Check- in was friendly and fast, all staff friendly and helpful. Upon Check in, Hotel Staff suprised our daughter(2 years) with cookies and a small gift.After complaining about the noice from the tracks, we got an upgrade on a slighly bigger room facing away from the tracks, luggage and baby cot was moved towards the new room by hotel staff, and upon check out, received a gift from hotel as an excuse for the inconvinience.Definitely a hotel i would recommend to stay at!

We stayed here and woke to find Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji out our window. The rooms were very nice and clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. There were 3 metro lines available from the basement of the hotel, one close, the others a few minutes walk away but, all accessed from underground. Kept us out of the cold and rain. There was also a Family Mart right outside the hotel. A few minutes walk to fast food, shopping and restaurants. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor and rooms above. Gave us that great view of the city. They were very kind when we asked them to hold our bags before and after checking in and out. Tokyo is an expensive city but this hotel was not as expensive as most. And the extra cost for the view was worth it as Mount Fuji is seldom seen according to a guide. When we were on the street level we couldn't see it, only from the hotel. More than worth the extra cost. Loved seeing all the lights at night too.

We stayed here in March this year we had a great stay great base for us to explor Toyko we is a wonderful place to visit all the family have said they would stay again really friendly helpful staff Rooms cleaned daily to a high standard

My sister and I stayed at this hotel and its excellent. The receptionist and staff are welcoming and polite. This hotel is close to everything and enjoyed all the art display. It has a good view of the city and Tokyo tower. You can never go wrong with this hotel.

This hotel was a very pleasant surprise! Very nice at an inexpensive price. It lives up to its award as a top budget hotel. Rooms were large compared to many Tokyo options, very clean, and came with nice amenities like slippers and toiletries. We upgraded to an Artist Room- one of the rooms that was painted/decorated by a local artist. Super cool! We got the room off a site like Priceline and got a good discount for the upgraded room. The upgraded room also comes with a free small sake or green tea (though they have free teas and coffee in the room regardless).

Lovely hotel with a nice view of the Tokyo Tower especially if you choose the room with the tower view. It is in Shiodome which is bit of a new area full of office buildings but you can take metro to elsewhere in central Tokyo easily from Shiodome or Shinbashi station. It is bit of a walk from Shinbashi station and may be easier to ask for direction as map in the metro station can be bit confusing because or the 20 or so exits! It is also a short metro ride to Tsukiji fish market which make your life easier if you fancy a morning trip to see the tuna auction or to queue for the sushi.

Lovely staff, common areas look great and it's nice to see their patronage of the arts (eg artist rooms and exhibition whilst we were there) but...The room was small and quite basic. Not even any way of playing music apart from an ancient built-in radio. The art on the walls was very second-rate. There was no pool and the exercise area was nothing to speak of. The restaurant was pretty ordinary and it's not in an especially good location. I also thought it was relatively expensive but I only have one other reference point in Tokyo.

The hotel is small, cosy and quiet. Friendly staff and best location. Only breakfast could offer more varieties. The Hotel is located in Shiodome area with direct Metro Access and the next big station is just five minutes to walk.

The hotel is located in the Shiodome complex conveniently close to a lot of restaurants, train stations and convenience stores. Access from Haneda (which I arrived in) is not as convenient as from Narita. I had to take an Airport Limousine bus to Tokyo Station before taking a taxi to the hotel. Hotel itself is pleasant enough with a lot of vibrant colors and paintings. Breakfast was also complete, with a choice of western and Japanese breakfast. the only concern i had was that my room faced the JR station and I was woken up by the trains every morning. The hotel has my recommendation but get a room away from the station side.

Nice hotel placed on floor 25-35 of the Shiodome Media Tower, a business district near the Port.Part of the Design Hotel Collection, it is full of art in the hall.The room are small and the bathroom is also dated....Great restaurant named TY bis and conciergerie very kind & prepared.

Offers basically what can be expected for the price picture. Friendly staff.The room was relatively small, but it is rarely offered spacious rooms in Tokyo.Well-equipped and tidy.Really close to much in spite of this a little hard to locate in the area

The location was convenient being close to Shimbashi & Shiodome station.The hotel room was nice, clean & modern. We had a lovely view of the water. Free wifi was important to us. We didn't eat in the restaurants for breakfast or dinner as they were quite expensive.Would definitely stay again!

We visit Tokyo annually on leisure but this is our first stay at Park hotel Tokyo. We wanted to try the hotel because it was a TripAdvisor Travellers' choice winner for romance.Pros 1. The hotel / room is stylishly designed. 2. They provide Thann toiletries. 3. The concierge was very helpful. 4. Free wi fi in room. Cons 1. Location - although it is connected by several train lines, 3 of the lines are quite a walk away via underground - in Shimbashi station - not shiodome itself. There are 2 Family mart convenience stores downstairs - and many restaurants , but it's not the most convenient base for shopping. 2. Noise - we were on the 32nd floor, but it was really noisy (till late night) from the trains and for some reason, there were regular sirens going off every night of our 3 night stay - not sure if the hotel is situated near a fire dept or police station...perhaps we were just not given the 'right' rooms with the views that everyone was raving about...3. Comfort - pillows and bed were too soft. Even with 2 pillows (1 of them buckwheat) it didn't make for a comfortable night's sleep4. Facilities / amenities : there is a gym - which you can only use if you make a reservation in advance. We tried to get a slot on the same day but slots were full.5. Last but not least, we asked for a 1 hour extension to the standard check out time of 12 pm and was told immediately that we would be charged for every hour we extend. They would not even grant us a 30 min courtesy extension. To be fair, the staff were all pleasant, just that the hotel policy is not. In conclusion - there were more cons than pros for our stay at this hotel. Having stayed at other tourist / business hotels near Ginza and in Shinjuku, in a similar price range, we expected a certain standard, and sadly it fell short. For the same price there are better located hotels with more comfortable stays.

The hotel was in good condition, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean, and we appreciated the coin laundry facilities. I enjoyed the view from my room, but the bed and the pillows were terribly uncomfortable.

This was our second visit to the Park Hotel and we hope we return again. It is so clean, so convenient and the staff are very helpful. The breakfast is very good. Get a room with a view of the Tokyo Tower. We were lucky enough to see Mount Fuji clearly on two days in a row.

Great modern hotel. I booked as a design hotel, which was well reflected in communal areas and design of interior, although rooms a little more generic. Great in room amenities (toiletries, drinks, pyjamas, slippers etc) and very clean. Rooms not huge, but well layed out with lovely window seat to appreciate amazing view, we could see Tokyo tower and Mount Fuji. Not the cheapest, but we booked well in advance and got a great deal, but don't think full price is ridiculous. Lovely little bar, but most expensive beer of entire 17night trip! Breakfast was a good choice of western and Japanese and food refilled frequently, decent coffee. Used the spa, which is small but great service and the best massage I've had in ages using Thann products, bliss! Location is above a station and a short walk to other stations. Small gripe would be the duvets a little thin and a tiny bit of wear and tear in room, but will probably stay again.

I found this hotel to be quite decent - reasonably comfortable with good services and friendly, helpful staff. However, I was let down by how small the smallest double room is - it is really quite small indeed, with the bathroom being particularly tight - and also the noise from the nearby train tracks, which was noticeable at 0600 even at 33 floors up!So, OK to stay here but don't expect too much.

This lovely hotel is on the upper floors of the Shiodome Media Tower facing the Shiodome Center that houses the Headquarters of companies like NHK, Panasonic, etc. The hotel is well connected to the Shimbashi station [7-10 minutes walk], taxis are a hail away too & it is a stop for Airport Limousine buses from Narita and Haneda airports making it perfect for the business traveler. It is also very close to the famous Tsukiji Fish market, Ginza and other famous attractions nearby... making it a great option for the leisure travelers too.The rooms are decent sized by Tokyo standard and each room has a great view of the city, the best rooms are those that face Tokyo Tower! What a sight. The hotel provides basic amenities and they are just enough for a good and comfortable stay. Book ahead of time to avoid higher rates. Its one of my favorite hotels to stay in Tokyo... by the way, the staff is great and they speak English!

Great location atop Shiodome Subway station (convenience) and as a launch pad for sightseeing. Reception on 25th floor with view of Mt Fuji on a clear day. Rooms are on the floors above the reception which means very little (I mean little) city noise reaches the rooms, but all rooms get a city view. Rooms quieter than at home! Good and polite service, great welcome, rooms good size for Tokyo standards. Breakfast looked good (we were always out early). Can't comment on the restaurants. Overall we have no ifs/buts to share.

I stayed Park Hotel twice and I have to say, they provide the best service. Along with top notch world class customer services, its location is very convenient to Ginza and major subways connected by beautiful underground passages. Shiodome also offers many things to do and to shop. I strongly recommend this hotel. You will experience Japanese courtesy.

We stayed in one of the artsy rooms on the 34th floor that overlooked Tokyo tower view. The view was gorgeous- especially at sunset which overlooks all of Tokyo including Mount Fuji in the background. We only stayed here one night as it was pricey but great for a splurge for our last night in Tokyo.

Our first room was non-smoking, yet it absolutely reaked of smoke. We asked for a different room, and got one, which had clearly been doused in air freshener and Febreeze minutes before, to mask the smell of smoke. The room, a twin, was really tiny. Dissappointingly so. The staff at the hotel are all very nice, but their level of English is generally poor. The concierge service was a joke... they were not able to recommend any restaurants at all (amazing... I have never come across such poor service, and in a city with so, so many restaurants!!!), and once we found the restaurants ourselves, they proceeded with an unnecessarily complicated booking process involving paper forms. All just to make a phonecall on our behalf. I would not recommend this hotel.

I love everything about this hotel especially the view. It was like looking at a postcard everytime you look out of the window and we were lucky enough to see mt fuji on certain days. The staff were so helpful especially with directions. I would definitely love to go back.

We had a corner room on the 32nd floor with fantastic night time views across the city. The room was spacious, modern and spotlessly clean. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast buffet was great. We used the laundry which was reasonably priced and very efficient. Clothes handed in by 10.00am are back in your room by 6.00pm the same day!On the lower basement floor of the building there is a small supermarket which sells just about anything you need. There are also about 5 inexpensive restaurants down there which are set up for local office workers. They're fun to eat in and you get to mix with the locals, but they're only open Monday to Friday.The location is really ideal as you can walk to the fish market in about 10 minutes and to Shimbashi station in around 5 minutes so you can get to anywhere in the city very easily.

We stayed at the tokyo tower double room. Spectacular view and comfortable stay. The location was convenient and the staff were really nice and helpful. Best to book the rooms directly with the hotel via website as we found it cheaper than 3rd party.

I was quote pleased with this hotel for the price. It spans from the 25th through the 34th floor, meaning I imagine most rooms have good view. Mine did.The hotel staff spoke English as well as anyone I encountered, which was convenient for me.The gym is by-appointment-only, which I found a bit odd. I doubt it's challenging to claim, and maybe that is usual in Japan, but it's not an ad-hoc idea.There's a nine-story courtyard through the middle of the hotel, where the lobby and restaurants are, that gives a nice place for people to gather.Likely a ten minute walk from the subway and train stations, you can travel solely above or below ground, which is nice when weather is a factor. Lots of restaurants surround the area, including several mom-and-pop types, as well as Taco Bell, McDonald's, Subway, and others of the sort.I'll probably spring for something a bit pricier next time I'm in Tokyo, but I would definitely recommend this to someone in this price-point.

Staying in this hotel for 3 times, love the location and easy access by any public transport. Friendly staffs with a lovely smile. Very quiet at night time. Near by odaiba, there are few shopping centre and a outlet in there, so you can spend a day in there, if you feel hungry, there are a lot of choice in there as well.

The room was a good size by Japanese standards and the view was incredible. The hotel seemed to take pride in the artwork both in the rooms and around the hotel which is nice if you like that sort of thing.It's located very close to Shiodome station and about a 15 min walk from Shimbashi. Staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English.

Paid for a corner king room with Tokyo Tower view and it was incredible. After a long flight we got the metro to the nearest stop, it was a bit difficult to find the hotel but when we did arrive the staff were lovely and spoke excellent English. The whole hotel is modern with a luxury feel. Would definitely stay again!

We found Park Hotel through designhotels.com and booked the Artist Queen Room. The hotel is situated in Minato-Ku, a 10 minute walk to the main shopping streets in Ginza and easy accessible from the subway. We were lucky enough to get one of the rooms with a view over Tokyo Tower and all the beautiful surrounding buildings. We ended up spending way more time in the room than you would normally do in a hotel as we simply couldn't stop taking photos of the breath taking view. I don't know what 'LG4KL' is talking about with his 'Great basic hotel' titled review. There's nothing basic about a hotel with multiple restaurant and bars (one that specialises in whisky called 'The Society', and an award winning spa. Our breakfast wasn't included in the room rate but was available to us for 2,400 yen pp. It doesn't have a pool but then again neither do a lot of the places in Japan we checked out.The staff were very friendly and approachable, and overall the hotel is a great one if you are in Tokyo for a few days and want to stay central with easy access to everything that Tokyo has to offer. Finally, the Park Hotel as part of design hotels offer some beautiful art, design and architecture and we would recommend this hotel to anyone that is going to Tokyo. Very happy and very impressed.

We stayed 3 nights at the Park Hotel. The views from our room (32nd floor) were brilliant. The room itself is pretty small but completely fine for our needs. The check-in staff were great. It is well located for shops and restaurants in Ginza and the fish market is also a fairly short walk (15-20 mins for each). Shimbashi subway is a 5 minute walk away which has great connections. Only complaint is that in advance I asked for some help with communicating with a guest house that we hoped to stay in later on our trip (communication only via phone in Japanese) and the hotel refused to help us. I thought this was a bit rubbish. Our subsequent hotel in Kyoto was more than happy to help which I think showed up the poor service in this respect.

Stayed in several Japanese hotels before and this has been by far the best experience! Fairly spacious rooms for Japanese norms. The hotel is situated along the Yamanote line, within walking distance from Shinbashi station and Shiodome station. The lobby is on the 25h floor of the Shiodome Tower also housing Kyodo News and is built to withstand earthquakes. The rooms start from 26th to the top floor.If you arrive via train you can walk through the basement access with shops and restaurants and take their dedicated elevator straight to the lobby on the 25th floor.We discovered Park Hotel while we booked our Tokyo trip through Expedia. After reading all the great reviews here we were sold immediately.Initially there were only City Queen rooms left as the period we booked for was Chinese New Year so went ahead anyway and we're pleased that when we called the hotel a few days later they were able to give us City Twin rooms anyway. The boutique style hotel appeals to both business travellers and families offering an oasis of tranquility with splendid views of Tokyo tower, Shiba Park and even Mount Fuji and a clear day. Also within walking distance is the Tsukiji Fish Market!Kudos to the very accommodating super friendly staff at he front desk and the 24hours concierge who all are fluent in English.We arrived late in the evening and the front desk staff already recognised us by name!Rooms are very clean and comfortable and heated in winter, cooled in summer by air conditioning adjustable individually in each room.As the weather was cool and dry we even managed to get a humidifier / air purifier for our rooms. Bathrooms and rooms are fully equipped with amenities, safe, hair dryers, multi standard electrical plugs, brushes, washing clothes, toothpaste, lotions and shower gels by Thann, ...Front desk staff even offered us to take the Japanese style pijamas robes home as souvenir when we asked if we could buy a set.Didn't manage to try the hotel restaurants as there are plenty of eateries in the immediate neighbourhood, even in the basement from the main Shiodome Tower building where the hotel is located. There is also a 24 hours Family Mart convenience store with hot food too and alcoholic drinks including beers, wines and Japanese whisky if you crave for something in the middle of the night. Within walking distance halfway towards the Shinbashi Station there is Caretta a full shopping mall offering more restaurants / cafes, fashion stores, liquor stores ...We took advantage of their airport limousine bus service bringing us safely back to Narita airport.We arrived at the requested time at the 1/F meeting lobby and our luggage was waiting for us and already tagged to be dropped at the correct terminal.In a nutshell a great tranquil location within walking distance of the major Yamanote Line JR train loop connecting you to all parts of Tokyo.A budget friendly fairly spacious accommodation and super friendly hotel staff.Next time we're in Tokyo we will definitely be back at the Park Hotel! Extremely recommended for families and businesses alike!

A solid hotel with good service. WiFi worked flawlessly (no PW needed - woouldn't it be greta if more picked up that trend?). The breakfast is pretty ok buit not top class. Rooms are fairly small ut very functional.

We thoughly enjoyed our stay at the Park Hotel. Our room was a little on the small side, but was very clean and had all the amenities expected in an upscale hotel. We were on the 27th floor and had a great view of the Tokyo Tower and the city. The staff was alway very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The hotel is just a short walk to Tokyo's transit system allowing us to explore all parts of the city. There were plenty of options for food both at the hotel and within easy walking distance.

Stayed in City Queen Room with Tokyo Tower View before and Premium Twin room after Hokkaido. The "before" room is Japanese standard sized but is worth paying a little more for the view whereas the "after" room is a lot bigger although no tower view. Both rooms are bright with a big window (almost floor to ceiling) on one side of room.Good base to explore Tsukiji market and Ginza as both are within walking distance. Shimbashi station is also within walking distance which is good to catch train to Haneda airport. The concierge service is great, from making recommendations, helping with meal reservations as well as detailed instructions to reach places that you want to visit.

Our room was on the 32 floor and was called a corner room, but the large windows were curved. It was very nice and best of all was the view of the Tokyo Tower and on two mornings we saw Mt. Fuji covered in snow! My husband likes trains, so he watched the trains on eight tracks going in and out of Shimbashi station below, including the bullet train.With the help of the concierge in the hotel and maps in the underground passage, we figured out the subway system. We had a problem at Ueno station finding the footbridge to get over the tracks to the park and museums. Answer: stations have a policeman who manages English and can tell you which way to go. For westerners there is a bakery shop on the 1st floor of the Shiodome Media Tower (where the hotel is located starting on the 25th floor) where you can get goodies for breakfast. We take Starbucks instant coffee packets and use these in the morning. And when the bakery is closed on the weekends either go to Delifrance bakery in the underground passage, or to Printemps French department store in Ginza, lower level, and buy some wonderful bakery goods for the next morning.Also, have the concierge write out the name of where you want to go in Japanese if you plan to take a taxi anywhere. And take the hotel card so you can get back. The hotel staff was really wonderful and we appreciated their help everyday.

The pictures do not do this hotel justice. The views from the lobby when you walk in are stunning, and there is a huge window in the room. The service is also incredible. They made a reservation for us our fist night and provided a print out with all of the restaurant information (in English and Japanese) to give our cab driver making it very easy to get there. My only regret is not staying here longer!

My hubby and I stayed here for the night on our way to Hong Kong and it was perfect! We were just a few blocks from the Ginza neighborhood with tons of shopping, food and nightlife. Also, we were a short walk from the Tsukiji Fish Market. I loved the room, the decor and the hotel staff. Our room was clean and comfortable and exactly what we needed after a long flight from the U.S.. I would stay in this hotel again and again.

The Park Hotel is located at the top of the Shiodome tower.We found the hotel very peaceful and calm. Theroux was small but very nice. Great views and all amenities you would expect.Would be great if there were more than two English TV channels.Location wise is brilliant with short walks to severe different stations.We didn't relies upon arrival but the Tsukiji fish market is only 10 minutes walk away. Go early if you want to see the auctions! If you miss that, fish market doesn't open till 9.Breakfast was expensive and for us not really worth it. Starbucks across from hotel was nice and much more reasonable.We would recommend to others and stay there again ourselves!

the location is very good, we booked the hotel because it's really a short 10-min walk to the fish market where we had lunches every day. it's also adjacent to Shinbashi station (if recalled correctly), convenient store on B1 in the same building, lots of eatery in the shiodome buildings. the room we had was a queen room with view of tokyo tower, had to pay a bit extra but the view was fantastic. room was small and clear with complete amenities. concierge was VERY helpful with directions and reservation.

The Park Hotel is super convenient to multiple metro stations, but also walkable to Ginza and the fish market. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms are small, but well appointed. I had a lovely stay and would stay again.

Was really nice to stay at the Park hotel Tokyo. The rooms are really nice, breakfast is great i just didn t feel i was in tokyo. I had a really nice sleep and the view was great. The metro is really close but the area was too quiet for me

We were a little hesitant as this hotel was more reasonably priced than others. But we were pleasantly surprised! Service was outstanding, rooms were a reasonable size for Toyko. Location was perfect, near the subway, train and walking distance to the Ginza.

The hotel is amazing located on a 50-somthing floor inside the Shiodome Media Tower. It has a great view of the tower of Tokyo from the lobby. The service was impeccable and highly effective gettuing reservations (previous to our stay via email). The room was small (as every other hotel in Tokyo) but nice with interesting choice of decor. We got a bottle of Moet because of our honeymoon. The one thing that disappointed was the simple and expensive breakfast. Near Ginza. Very centric but not a touristy location.

I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in November and the stay was great.The room has big bath tube and a decent size flat screen TV, which are my favorite. The hotel even offered me a free upgrade to the Tokyo view room as a perk of being a park hotel member. You cannot really beat the view. (But I will try the park view next time)Their concierge service is really helpful and fast in responding to emails. But I got bit annoyed when they asked for my reservation information multiple times, as I expected they can track my information by my contact email. (might be just a system issue)The hotel is 15 min walks from he Shibahsi station (JR and metro) and right on top of Shiodome station. So basically, you can access all the kinds of rail transportation.I will definitely stay in this hotel next time i visit Japan.

Nothing can beat the amazing view of Tokyo Tower AND Mount Fuji together, from the reception on 25F as I checked in during Sunrise. The rooms were the standard 22sqm you find in Japan but instead of boring classic design the whole hotel from lobby to rooms is infused with different art from Japanese Artists - a big plus if coming back regularly for business as I love to be inspired by new and creative works. Tateru Yoshino Bistro is amazing value for the quality of food. Such a nice bar they have yet still serving me Hendrick's Gin & Tonic without cucumber (had to insist and send the drink back to be fixed) despite a 2nd visit, is a a real pity. Hotel is situated beside JR station lines and Tokyo Metro lines so you can get anywhere easily. Limousines bus stops right at this hotel as well so you do not have to mess with big luggage in the subway getting to the hotel (Taxi in Japan is more expensive than Sydney!) Thanks to K. Takazawa for kindly arranging for luggage to be brought down and loaded to Limousine Bus and making everything seamless with a smile. Not to mention a very sincere bow when sending us off up the bus - such professionalism unique to Japan is already an eye opener. I had to book 2 nights to secure an early check in at 7am - nice that reception remembers but the whole check in process needs to be refined as they could have handed the information sheet (to write name and details) to both my colleague and I from the start, instead of slowly repeating the words spoken and process one by one - wasting a good 5-6 minutes for my colleague next in line. Free wifi without password is a great convenience

I have stayed here for the last two nights, and have been so glad! The room, for Tokyo is a really nice size, the amenities are great, deep tub, nice restaurants and bar. Outside the hotel, if you leave on the second floor, there is a pedestrian walkway - make sure to visit the clock on the hour for a real treat! The location is right at the edge of the Ginza area for great shopping, and there is a great half-day tour right from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel!! From the lobby, you can see the Tokyo Tower and, in the winter, Mount Fuji.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, and initially mistook it for the Royal Park Hotel, which is quite glamorous, about a half block away and just about the same address. We learned a lot about Japanese addresses this trip....The hotel is tricky to get to when initially trying to find it as it's part of a business building so there are multiple entry points on multiple levels. It is however conveniently located, clean, and was otherwise exactly as expected. The staff were exceptionally friendly, and while there really isn't any tipping in Japan, someone will escort you to your room whether you want them to or not, and the lingering suggested that a tip was expected. This might have just been our experience, but it seemed fairly common place.

This is a very conveniently located hotel with an absolutely amazing view of the city skyline and mt. Fuji on a good day. The lobby is on the 25th floor and the hotel has about 10 floors and the front desk lady was kind enough to give us a top floor room, the second morning we were able to see mt.Fuji clearly for a brief moment and I am grateful. Getting around is simple, it's located at the Shiodome subway station and 7 mins walk to the Shimbashi train station via a sky walk between business buildings. across the street from the hotel you'll find Tokyo's biggest salary men's area, tons of small restaurants/bars/clubs and if you go the "brighter" side there's the famous Ginza, where most expensive shops reside. And it is it's very easy to transfer to Tokyo station for day trips or Hamamatsucho for Haneda airport monorail.The breakfast buffet was very good, plus you have the option to have breakfast at a popular shushi restaurant at Tsukiji fish market, one stop from the shiodome station. You each get a set worth about 2,000 yen which is quite filling, not as good as those famous ones such as Sushi Dai but much better than any sushi place outside of Japan...the fish is fresh and that's a given, but the Japanese rice is the one that made the difference, you almost cannot buy Japanese rice outside of Japan because they just grow enough for domestic consumption, only a small quantity is exported if you are lucky to find them at home. Most "Japanese rice" you see in the supermarket is from California and they are not the same grade, so be careful.

I book according to TA rankings and this was a regular high. There were a few good things but a few slips that make me question its high ranking.Location - very good. Good access to Haneda Airport and in fact everywhere, by metro and JR. You can also walk to Shimbashi and Ginza at late night for food and shopping, it was safe and convenient.Views - the view from the lobby is going to take your breath away. First you notice Tokyo Tower literally a bit too close, then in the background is the gorgeous Mount Fuji. No wonder people just stop moving as they walk into the reception area.Check in - efficient and reception spoke English at a much higher level than the average Japanese hotel receptionist. However flat out denied requests rather than the standard 'try to arrange, no guarantees', but maybe this is a cultural difference.Now the problems:i stayed in a single room. It was a bit compact. And the views were less stunning than what you thought it would be; it faced the Conrad next door. The biggest problem was the problem I had with the wifi. There was no wifi in the room. I don't know if that's a design fault, but the staff member sent up with a router seemed to suggest that it was pretty common that these rooms couldn't get wifi. But even with a router plugged in, the internet was painfully slow. If i had serious business to do online, I would be very frustrated. This hotel charges 24,000 JPY a night, 3-4 times higher than a lot of other hotels where speedy wifi is a pretty default amenity provided without misses. When I questioned this further, the staff didn't seem bothered to deal with this issue and just shrugged their shoulders.I think the room would be worth 16-17,000 JPY a night, but not at a 20,000+ premium where I can get a lot of hotels with the similar calibre.But yet still the location was too good so I might have a second stay, or in a nearby property instead next time.

I stayed here 3 nights. Had an evening arrival at Haneda and took the train to Shimbashi Station. After the chaos of the trains, it was like arriving in a world of calm when the elevator opened to the 25th floor lobby! The greeting by the staff was very friendly and courteous. I was given a room on the 32nd floor that was not huge, but certainly decent sized for Tokyo. Plenty of room to walk around the queen bed. There is a nice chair and ottoman in the rooms, along with window bench seating. The lights are all controlled from the bedside. The bathroom was small, but had everything you needed, lots of Thann toiletries, and great water pressure in the shower. There is a closet for hanging your clothes and a good sized safe for valuables. This hotel probably had the fastest Wifi I've ever had in a hotel! Great download speeds.Restaurant serves a good international buffet in the morning with Asian and Western offerings. Service was very professional and their English was good. Easy access to Shimbashi and it's subway and rail lines that can take you anywhere you want to go in the city. The Shiodome office complex is connected by both basement tunnels and 3rd floor elevated walkways. They have maps in the lobby that explain it all. Upon check out, I asked for them to call a taxi for me, and they escorted me downstairs, hauling my luggage the whole way, and took me to my taxi, even standing on the curb to wave goodbye as I sped off. Wonderful service!Overall a great choice in Tokyo. Very quiet, nice clean rooms and comfortable surroundings.

The Park Hotel is right at the end of the Ginza and next to both the Shinbashi station and Shiodome station so it is very convenient . The hotel and the area is new and modern. It is a business area so there are so many restaurants and little shops. The view from our room was towards the Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fuji. It is a wonderful view. The staff was always so helpful. We used the services of the concierge everyday. All of the ladies spoke English and printed maps for us. The amenities in the room are luxurious and our room was spacious with two beds and a refrigerator. We stayed there at the beginning and the end of our two weeks in Japan. They held our extra luggage for us so we didn't have to take everything with us as we traveled. I highly recommend.

The Park Hotel Tokyo is a great hotel to stay at in Tokyo. Super convenient, helpful and friendly staff, nice rooms, great views. Couldn't fault it and will definitely stay again when I'm next in Tokyo.

We stayed here for 4 nights. Being our first visit to astray in Japan, it was a bit of pot luck that I booked this hotel. But it was certainly worth it. The room was clean and large enough for the 3 of us and the staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is very close to Shimbashi station - walking distance - where the main JR lines run through. So all parts of the city are easily accessible! We only had breakfast at the restaurant - it was very quiet (as in noise levels) for us! For 2400yen it was ok - you can probably find better value for breakfast just a short stroll away. The lobby is on the 25th floor which was very cool and decorated by local artists. Would definitely stay here again!

Located in the 25 - 34 floors of A Shidome building, this is an excellent option while staying in Tokyo. Located within walking distance from Tsukiji, Ginza and Shmbashi station, you can move around Tokyo quite easy. Restaurant at the lobby is very nice, and all the staff is nice and friendly (specially the concierge: she made the stay memorable). Rooms are clean and quiet. The rooms are some kind of small, but not as small as you can find them in Tokyo. It is an excellent option for business travelers.

I stayed two nights and stayed in a artist painted room (Otafuku face). The experience was really nice, the room was quite large for japanese standards, it was very clean and well equipped. I had a great view on the Mount Fuji and Tokyo Tower . The hotel is situated closed to business centers and to Ginza. The wifi works perfectly well, the staff was very nice and helpful and the breakfast was fine. There is not much choice for the restaurant but there are many facilities around. I also rented meeting room and it was well appointed and had a great view on Tokyo

very good in almost all aspects, customer service, cleanliness and location, shimbashi is bang in middle between Shinjuku, Shibuya, Tokyo, Ginza, Roppongi, Akihabara, Asakusa and Odaiba. very good package overall.

We stayed three nights in a standard room with Tokyo Tower view on level 31 (room 3110). With plenty of space for both of us and our suitcases/shopping this room was spacious and quite large by Tokyo standards.Fabulous views across the city of Shibuya, Shinjuku and Mt Fuji, excellent buffet breakfast, very clean, and a lovely foyer bar to relax at night. We also enjoyed the art exhibition around the corridors of our level.Would return here in a heartbeat and felt this was real value for money at about US $200-250 per night.Highly recommended.

This was the first hotel we (my partner and I with another married couple) stayed at of our 3 weeks of travel ahead and my first reaction when I walked in the room was - WOW!!! On arrival people were overly helpful and offered to help us with our luggage (one large backpack, 2 snowboard bags, a suitcase each and a backpack hand luggage size each) so it was so nice to have the offer there after lugging it all from the airport.. Check in was easy and straight forward and once we got up to our rooms the first thing I noticed was the amazing view!! We were on the 2nd highest floor and had a clear view of the Tokyo tower and my Fuji right next to it with the rest of tokyo's high rise building around it.. It was a one queen bed room with sufficient space for our luggage around the bed and still able to walk around.. There was a ledge to sit on and admire the view and decent blinds to shut out the after noon sun that was quite hot in the room - aircon was obedient so that was nice on the cool nights.. The mini bar was stocked well for my unwell partner to have some cool water on arrival and snack later in the night.. Bathroom was spotless with an assortment of offerings such as shampoo conditioner toothbrushes etc... The only downfall was we often got the train to shin bashi as that was the most convenient for us but once we realised toei shiodome was closer and half the walk then we used that a little more.. Hotel was a little hard to find initially but once he had found it it was easy!! Most of the things we did required a bit of travel however it was quite lively only a couple of streets away for an easy feed on our first night :) we didn't have meals included but u figured that was made up for with the amazing view!! Staff were always very helpful and welcoming - no problems with English and if they did they could refer us to someone who's English was better.. Highly reccomend this hotel for all travel types, it was overall safe, clean, great environment and reasonable price for the service and quality of the rooms. Hope this helps!

I stayed on a Sunday and Monday night in January in a twin room with my adult daughter for 20,000 yen per night.I was delighted with this hotel choice.I booked last minute through Booking.com and there were no Tokyo Tower rooms available.Our room on the 28th floor overlooked the bay and some of the very nearby Hama Rikyu gardens where the plum trees are starting to bloosom.The room was not spacious but not cramped with two beds and 2 large suitcases.Very clean.Good WiFi. Quiet.Comfortable beds and pillows.Bathroom had shower over bath and curtain.Location is excellent.An easy walk to Shimbashi station for JR trains and subway lines and closer still to the monorail to Odaiba.We easily walked to Ginza one day to the 12 storey UniQlo flagship store.There is a Don Quixote store nearby, worth checking out if you haven't been to one.On departure, for convenience we caught a taxi to Haneda for 6000 yen.We did not find having the lobby on the 25th floor to be inconvenient.There is a large central atrium and, in keeping with an artistic theme at this hotel ,the lobby was decorated with an art installation of large red and white birds.Very attractive and comfortable.Some of the rooms have unique wall and ceiling murals painted by different artists.The photos are impressive.I found the staff to be consistently, genuinely kind and helpful with excellent English skills.Most of the visitors I saw were English speaking.Better service than the Sheraton Grande Tokyo Bay and the Mira Costa.I was impressed by the level of service and hope to return.

This hotel begins on the 25th floor above the Shiodome train station, which also has the monorail which was great for a ride over Rainbow Bridge and the bay and walking distance to Shimbashi Station with the main JR Lines, therefore very easy and inexpensive to get around from here but a more upmarket location and peaceful. There were lots of very good restaurants and cafes in the immediate area but it did take a little while and quite a bit of walking to work out where the majority of them were. The hotel itself is very nice and well run, the rooms are quite small but the size in workable. The whole hotel including rooms is very clean and comfortable. and all the staff are extremely helpful. They stored our luggage on our last day until our evening flight and were very obliging when we needed to access bags to repack for some shopping. We booked airport bus transfer through the hotel and they delivered our luggage to the front of the hotel and had it loaded on the bus, fabulous service. The only meal we had there was breakfast and for 2400yen was just average. The coin laundry for me (travelling with 2 teenagers) was a plus when deciding a hotel, unfortunately this was not a good experience, they have 2 washer dryer combos, the wash cycle was fine but the clothes were still damp after 8 hours of pumping coins into the machine, we were leaving on the bullet train next morning so had to hang all the heavy clothes around the rooms and turn the heating up to get them dry, not good. I did report this to staff but they didn't seem to think it was an issue or that we had spent almost 3000yen in the dryers, wish I'd looked for a coin laundry. Apart from this I'd certainly recommend this hotel as it was a very pleasant stay. We stayed at this hotel twice during our trip to Japan and the first time paid more for Tokyo Tower view, which was excellent, on our return we had standard rooms and the view was over the gardens and down to the water, beautiful view, I think I'd just recommend standard and you can see Tokyo Tower from the foyer.

Great stay at the Park Hotel, a cool hotel with lots of art around the foyer and an awesome view of Tokyo Tower with Mount Fuji in the background on a clear day. Close to everything, once you have worked out how to use the subway / metro / rail network there is the Shinbashi station directly beneath the hotel which makes it convenient and close to everything Tokyo has to offer. Staff were great, friendly and helpful for the non Japanese speaker. The room was very clean and very functional, in fact it made me wonder about the sizes of western hotel rooms being too big. A great place to stay and will stay again when I travel to Tokyo again. The Family Store in directly beneath the hotel adds to the convenience and they too have great staff.

The hotel is perfectly placed right next to Shambashi station so transport plus eating options are excellentIt is actually a reasonable walk from central Tokyo if you wishRoom was comfortable for both stays. Get a room with a view of the tower if possible (you will also see Mt Fuji on a clear day)...rooms start on 26th floor so very quietStaff all very helpful and effecient. Good range of whiskies in the bar and loungeDecor interesting (art oriented)The breakfast buffet was good.A modern hotel with very good Japanese culture serviceWill stay there again

The name here is once again maybe a bit misleading: Park Hotel...definitely no park around :) but otherwise a very good propery, here is why:The hotel is located in the upper floors of an office tower. It is a less busy tower of the otherwise busy Shiodome area. You can't be more central: there is a metro stop in the same building, which takes you anywhere you want. It is also a good place to stay if you attend a fair in Tokyo Big Sight/Ariake, as it is on the private Yurikamome line which takes you there in 30 min.Reception and restaurants make one floor, everything is elegant, quiet and efficient. Staff speaks ok English -not all of them, but there is always somebody on hand to help the less anglophile ones. All front office issues are sorted out well, a bit slow maybe, but generally good. Yes, I also had wrong bill compositions and credit card issues, and yes it took a bit of time to sort out, so my hint is to do it the evening before check-out.There is many different room types to choose from from the reservation menue -not sure if they are really different and what the differences really are. Most room names sound like gift packages. I took a standard corner room. It was indeed small but at the end all I needed. Bathroom small as well but sufficient if you are not over 100kg. There are good amenities, coffee/tea making facilities and everything is spotlessly clean. As it is a tower hotel, all rooms have great views. I am not sure if it is worth paying more for 'Tokyo tower view'...Breakfast is the traditionally weird choice of 'western' and 'japanese' -the western option being good but still with all the strange mixes of western items that only Japanese chefs can produce. The Japanese option remained a mystery as most food for non-Japanese was not to be identified, but it looked all fresh and delicous. Both breakfast options are reasonably priced for Tokyo standards.Staff in general friendly, courteous and efficient -smooth operators as everywhere in Japan. The complete package of this hotel I liked very much. It is not one of those large chains, but still offers service similar, and people there are nice and friendly. Location is most perfect if you are attending the fairs, or if you are ok with being close to Ginza, Ebisu, Shinagawa and Southern parts.I do recommend this hotel very much, I simply like it and I enjoy coming back.

The location and property were great. Concierge was also very helpful, and spoke great English. Upon checkout, the front desk accidentally double charged my credit card, then couldn't undo it. Took a few days to fix, which was very frustrating.

Hotel was great. A friend advised us to get a room with a view and it was well worth the extra $25 a night - amazing city, tower and Mount Fuij views. The hotel is close to both a subway and mainline train station so travelling around the city was very easy. The room is a good size for Tokyo, comfortably furnished and clean. The only downside to this hotel is the concierge service - which was awful. We were given very wrong information on 3 seperate occasions - one which meant we had a 5am start for no useful reason, one that cost us a lot of money in last minute cabs and one, a query about travel to see the snow monkeys, where we were given information so poor as to make us more confused not less, and again cost us time and money. So, stay here but avoid asking the concierge desk for any help!

We stayed in an artist room, which I recommend. The rooms are relatively spacious and have everything you need. Staff were great. We did not eat at the hotel. It's just a few minutes walk to the train station and easy to hop on the "green line", which is really all you need to circle the city and get to the airport (transfer to a bus or train at nearby Tokyo station). Also a pleasant walk to the fish market and Ginza, as others have mentioned.

Rooms are on the larger side for Japan. Stayed in an artist room with a view of Tokyo Tower, which was beautiful. My only gripe with the room was that the bathroom was dated and had a slight odor. The hotel is about 30 minutes by subway from most places we were going to (Shibuya, etc.), it wasn't a problem for us but something to keep in mind.Also, when checking out the hotel asks you if you want them to charge your card in your currency or yen. The hotel's currency conversion rate is not the actual currency conversion rate of that day but a conversion rate wherein the yen is slightly stronger so if your card doesn't charge foreign transaction fees ask for them to charge you in yen since your credit card uses the REAL conversion rate. (Every hotel/train station we used to exchange money did not use the actual conversion rate so it's best to exchange all your money at the airport where they used the real conversion rate.)

The location is brilliant for the fish market and either Shimbashi or Shiodeme stations, which allow you access to all the districts. It has a bar but it is very quiet and quite pricey. The breakfast is a great selection and the concierge are so helpful and will book restaurants for you, give you directions etc. The views are incredible and they organise great baggage forwarding services.Make sure you: get a PASMO card, like an oyster card but can be used in a cab as well as the tube! So if you have any money on it left you can pay part of the taxi with what is remaining.Dress: It is ultra fashionable here so think the latest trends.

Park Hotel is just a tad outside Ginza and Tsukiji Market. But walk ten minutes and you are at the heart of Ginza---something we did repeatedly without much effort during our stay. It connect well to the train station via overhead walkways that can take you and your luggage without much discomfort on your part.The views are great especially if you get a room facing Mt. Fuji. One evening we walked for sushi dinner by the Tsukiji area and it was a pleasant 20 minutes or so.

Getting here was a bit tricky,the hotel lobby is on the 25th floor of an office building. Once I found it, I found it to be in a perfect location, it's a 2 min walk to Shiodome train station & about a 5min walk to Shinbashi train station (JR line). If you're using the trains, don't use them before 10.30am (it's mental). The hotel was clean & the staff were really lovely,their English is limited, though they did make every effort to help me & they always greeted me when they saw me. The room I had was 3203 it was a nice room, the bathroom was small,it did the job ( the water can get very hot & the shower sprays very hard) but it's nice having the water spray hard, it helped with the sore back I had from travelling,though the bath is very small. My room was reasonably quite I did hear the odd police siren & train. I'd highly recommend turning off the airconditioner or you'll wake up with a headache.The hotel has a smoking room in the lobby, it had pretty paintings on the wall in there. I tried the breakfast & dinner. The breakfast was okay.... though the bacon was rock hard & pretty expensive. The dinner I had Beef with veggies, the veggies needed to be cooked for another 3mins & the beef was pretty salty & it was also pricey.If you want food, your better off walking to Shinbashi station were they have Taco bell or going to the Familymart on the ground floor for random funky food. Overall I'd stay here again.

I stayed here for a week, in two different types of rooms. One facing the West provided the fantastic view of the Tokyo Tower and the Mt. Fuji behind. It was absolutely stunning view. From the other room, I could see the river and the Tokyo Bay, an equally breath-taking view. If you seek a room with a view, this hotel could be one of the top choices in Tokyo. (Cerulean Hotel may come equal, but you know, then you have to deal with their hefty rate.)Rooms are relatively large (in Japanese standard.) and well-maintained, although the first room I stayed showed certain but negligible wears in interior decorations and furniture. I think the hotel would be more suitable for those 35 yr or above. If you are young and adventurous soul, seek the hotels in Shibuya or Shinjuku. This hotel is located to old and more traditional side of Toyko, also right in the middle of business district. The neighboring area gets very quiet after ten.

We stayed in one of the Artist Rooms. It may not be everyone's cup of tea but certainly adds a lot of character to the room. Each artist room is one of a kind. Amazing view of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji on a clear day behind the reception. Handy to subway. A warm, comfortable stay.

Its location is perfect- connected to the metro line Shinbashi stop and a short walk to other lines. The view from the room to Tokyo Tower and the rest of Tokyo is breathtaking! We stayed in an Artist's Room which was super cool.Staff are friendly and speak very well English compared to the rest of the country. A convenient store is located on the ground floor of the building.A wonderful stay!

The Hotel is in a great location and very nicely appointed. Staff spoke some English and was helpful. When asked for a restaurant that the local Japanese ate at, they gave us a few. We ended up at Yoshinoya's and loved it. Very inexpensive and very tasty as well. We found Yoshinoya's throughout our 2 .5 week travels in Japan . . . it became my favorite place to catch a quick breakfast to start the day. Park Hotel Tokyo has a beautiful lobby and ajoining bar area. Rather pricey drinks, but a fantastic atmosphere . Staff was very accommodating and helpful. Close to Tsukiji Market as well. A short walk to the JR Stations. Will be staying there once again on our next trip to Tokyo . . . . . before Tsukiji Market moves !

Fantastic view of Tokyo and the Tokyo Tower - we could see all of the way to Mt Fuji. The room was high quality and very clean. Staff were very helpful. Buffet breakfast has lots of options. Lots of restaurants close by.

This hotel is known for its different art pieces within the room - stayed for a night with a view facing Tokyo Tower. Please book with the Tokyo tower view - all worth it. The night and day view is just phenomenal ! The room is a little small but again, pretty common for all rooms in Tokyo. The front desk was professional - staff could speak English. The hotel is connected to the shimbashi subway which is about 10 mins walk. There are lots of restaurants in the shimbashi station - western, Japanese, Italian, Starbucks, Lawson convenient store. Definitely recommended to stay here - hotel was a little pricey but worth the stay. I would like to compliment the staff from Concierge (think her name was Marie?) the young girl who studied in Canada prior to returning to Tokyo. She was really helpful. The other gentleman that was really helpful was the gentleman from Mynamar and stayed in Tokyo for 20 years - I'm sorry I could not remember all their names. Recommended a crab restaurant to go to in Ginza. Would definitely recommend this hotel for travelers. The hotel is also walkable to Ginza - about 10 mins? Overall pleasant stay here. Rooms were clean and service was great.

Park Hotel Tokyo exudes a quiet yet artsy vibe unlike the other chain hotels we are so used to during our travels. It is situated in a quiet but very accessible location -- nice to come home to after a hectic day of sightseeing. Our family of 4 ( 2 rooms) stayed for 6 nights and it was one of the most memorable vacations we ever had. What impressed me the most, however, (apart from how beautiful Japan is), was the ease of communication with the concierge. They were prompt in answering my queries and requests before and after our trip. Worth mentioning is a particularly funny incident wherein I inquired whether I accidentally left behind the ID cards of my children in the safe when we were already back home. Ms. Asuka Shiraki, the concierge, emailed back promptly saying no IDs were found, but rather a pair of socks left behind by my son. I was so impressed when the hotel offered to send it back to me! This just shows the extent of service Park Hotel Tokyo is willing to extend to their clients. Kudos also to the others from the concierge and reservation, Ms. Sabrina, Ms. Nozomi, Ms. Nami, and Ms. Yumiko for addressing my emails promptly. You made us happy and we shall be back.And by the way, I told them to just dispose of the pair of socks.

Only need a few things of a hotel. This place had it all but a decent size bath to soak up weary legs after a long day exploring the sights. Views great and the location perfect to get to the main areas with easy access to the metro system. Would stay here again.

Overall very nice hotel and staff. Clean and classy with a comfy bed. Room didn't feel too tiny considering what is around in Tokyo. 5-10 min walk to get to platforms for Shiodome Subway and only a tiny bit further for Yamanote JR Line at Shimbashi Station. Being close to a station served by the Yamanote Line would be one of my key recommendations for staying in Tokyo because it does a loop of most major districts on the to-do list for tourists. So this hotel worked for us for this reason, however I would maybe suggest it better to stay over towards the Shinjuku / Shibuya side of town which feels to have more of the 'bustling electric Tokyo' big city feel you might be going to experience. That said its only about 20-25 mins to get there from Shimbashi station.

I stayed here for the first part of my honeymoon. I was really keen to book some high end restaurants to eat at to celebrate my honeymoon. I contacted the concierge and they were very prompt in replying to me (1 business day) and they were very helpful and patient. I made a mistake with one of the restaurant names and ended up asking them to book the wrong restaurant. When I emailed them to cancel that booking and book the correct one they did so with no question. When I arrived they provided me with the documents that had the restaurant addresses if I wanted to taxi and maps if I wanted to get there by train. The concierge also offered to book us bus tickets to Mt Fuji.We booked the queen room with the Tokyo Tower view. The room was clean and big enough for both of us with our luggage. The bed was comfortable although the pillows were a bit strange, they seemed to be filled with lots of small beads or something, not the usual feather ones I'm used to. The seat that is located against the window was great to sit on and watch the world go by outside. The hotel was located above Shiodome subway station and also has access to the Yurikamome line. It is also close to Shimbashi station if you need to catch a different line to the Oedo line. Because it is located in a business district there wasn't too much that was open late however it meant that it was quiet at night.

I stayed in this hotel for a week in December 2015. It was a great location for us, we caught trains from the nearby Shimbashi station (which you can walk to underground, above ground, or on ground level), to all the destinations we visited in Tokyo. The rooms were a decent size, clean, and quiet, and one of our rooms had amazing views of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. The staff were very friendly and helped us courier our luggage to Osaka with no issues, so that we could catch the Shinkansen just with our day packs (much easier!).

The staff of the hotel is experienced and is doing everything beyond expectation to make your visit in Tokyo successful.in general our advise is to travel in Japan with another couple only.instead of a group toursJapan is easy to travel ' people are extremely friendly and the tour of Japan becomes much more enjoyable. The communication with the local people is without tour organizers and as such more close .

I've been here since the very beginning of this hotel. rooms and facilities are dated a bit but its located within business area so very quiet. Most of all staff members are just lovely, they are just great. .

My husband and I stayed at this hotel recently. The location was great as it was very close to the subway station and 10 minute walking distance to Ginza shopping area. The room was very small but clean and the staff were friendly. The view from our room was really nice. The breakfast however was not good. It had a very limited range and it was exactly the same everyday. The scrambled eggs were quite disgusting, and there was no option of having your eggs cooked the way you liked. There was only a single two slot toaster and no hot milk. I definitely didn't look forward to breakfast in the mornings. The girls at concierge were very nice and friendly but didn't seem to have much knowledge of advising tourists where to go and what to do. Overall it was an ok hotel for 4 stars but I wouldn't go back.

We stays for 6 nights in total. 3 nights initially then we went to Kyoto and Osaka and we come back and stayed for another 3 nights. This hotel had been booked by our tour agent. It was their second option. The hotel is well located close to most facilities, very close to Ginza. The room was clean but very small. You have to change the elevator twice when you need to go out which is not a big deal. The staff were nice and trying to be helpful in finding places or booking events. Breakfast was the same every morning without many varieties indeed. I think hotel management should look into having a few different more options or at least changing the menu periodically.

The Park Hotel is a perfect base to explore Tokyo. The Yamanote line will get you everywhere you need to go easily ie Shinkuku,Shinbuya ,Tokyo and the airport(s) Really comfortable with sensational staff that couldn't have been more helpful and accomodating. We loved our stay here.

We enjoyed our stay over the New Year break. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Shiodome train line and the Shimbashi station is 5 minutes away. The shopping area of Ginza is around 10 minute walk and restaurants in this area are great.The hotel staff are all very accommodating and the rooms are of a good standard for the price. There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel but expect high prices for everything you order, as coffee was 9500 yen ($12 Aud)The only negatives are there is no reception when you enter so you need to contact the reception via phone to have a porter sent down for your bags and the buffet breakfast was poor in my opinion with a version of slop served up as scrambled eggs.Overall a decent hotel for the money

Beautifully decorated and appointed hotel, with nice views. Fantastic location close to major attractions, subway and train station. Nice restaurants. Helpful staff. One of the few hotels we stayed in which had some self laundry services. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Very good hotel, higher floors on a skyscraper building.Spectacular view.Very attentive staff, very discrete.Bathroom very well equipped, everything very good quality. Shower very strong.Pillow not so comfortable.

Stayed with family at this hotel during the Christmas period of 2015. We had a twin room and a triple room. Fantastic service provided by Hiroaki Ishii San of Room Division when checking in and out. The Reception of the hotel is on the 25th floor of the Shiodome Media Tower. Nearest subway is Shiodome station and Shimbashi station. Do not go to the ground floor, stop on the 3rd floor and use the pedestrian walkway to get to Ginza and Tsukiji in 10 mins. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the nearby Caretta Shopping Mall and also the Shiodome City Centre. There is even a Ding Tai Fung if you are craving for some Chinese dumplings after all the sushi, tempura and ramen. We extended our check out time till 4pm for a very reasonable rate of Y1500 per hour. They came to our room to collect our luggage, kept it till the arrival time of our taxi to bring us to the airport. You just need to bring yourself to the first floor to wait for the taxi at the appointed time and your luggage appeared without any prompting. Very efficient service. Super clean rooms. Great amenities. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Tokyo.

Only allow babies in cots up to 1 yr old. After that they "have to share your bed". Ridiculous rule and when we asked why this was the rule we were told "because it is the rules"...!!! Absurd and another example of how Tokyo is poorly prepared for international visitors for the Olympics. Room was clean and nice though.

The hotel is situated on the top floors of the Shiodome Media Tower. Check-in is on the 25th floor with rooms above the lobby level up to the 34th floor. Rooms are nicely laid out with very nice amenities.Good location to JR train station as well as being right on top of 3 different subway station and easy access.I might have given an excellent rating except they only have 2 restaurants which both need reservations and the 2 nights that I stayed there I was not able to eat dinner in the hotel (Saturday and Sunday). I was a disappointed in that I could not eat in the hotel. Also, breakfast is served in the lobby but again seating is quite limited. But the concierge was a great help in finding me an Italian Restaurant within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. It was located in another business tower up on the 41st floor with just fantastic views...Ar's Italian Cuisine.The staff were all very friendly and some spoke multiple languages including English, French, Spanish, and Chinese.

The first thing you should probably know is that this is not the posh Park Hyatt Hotel which was made famous by Bill Murray in "Lost in Translation". That's in the bustling Shinjuku area and is approximately five times more expensive than this hotel. If you're someone who thinks nothing of the price differential, then maybe we should go out sometime so you could put a ring on it.
