The amazing views (Mt Fuji and the tower from the reception area and the city, park, and river from my room), the beautiful photo display at street level, the impressive art in the reception-atrium (and at night the art is projected onto a huge wall in the atrium that you can see from all levels as the circular hallways look down into the atrium), meeting points for day trips within easy walking distance, the handy Family Mart convenience store (I bought my food and drinks from there) and a couple of restaurants in the basement of the hotel (which seemed very popular) . I had never travelled solo before so was a little anxious about how to find the hotel from Shinbashi station (while pulling my suitcase), but needn't have worried as it was easy to find being just a couple of blocks (a few people have commented it was difficult to find the entrance to the hotel but I had no problems despite being geographically challenged). When I left, I used the limousine service which goes directly from the hotel to Narita airport (and easily booked at the airport and at hotel reception who will also happily store your luggage for you). I loved the great views whizzing up in the lift to the reception on the 25th floor and the reception staff had great English and were very helpful.

The view of room is stunning with Tokyo tower night scene, this is one of the hottest hotel 5 years ago. The room size is tight, been with city twin supposed to be 22 Sq ft but I seriously feel tight, as bathroom is relatively big with full size tub.Amenities are great, location is great at Shidome station and well connected to subway and many local restaurants along the connected malls. The area is very nice and chic, especially great in ambiance during Christmas. Have airport bus stop or you may use Conrad Tokyo's stop at opposite, Pricey but the area is pricey,

We arrived quite early to the hotel but the room was ready and they let us in straight away.The breakfast bouffet had a very good and tasty selection of western and japanesse food.Ours was the cherry blossom room, which was very spacious and had amazing views of Tokyo, including the Tokyo Tower, and on a clear day Mount Fuji.The staff was very friendly and helpful.The access to the hotel can be done from the JR underground station but it is a bit difficult to find but in the end turned up to be very useful on the rainy days.

Bathroom is a bit small, at least in the queen non-city view room. The bed is actually big enough for two! They have a nice breakfast buffet in the morning (and as with all hotel buffets is a bit pricey) and a fantastic French restaurant on the premises. The bar is open until 1:30 am and serves good, but small, hand crafted drinks. In general, adult beverages are very expensive in Tokyo. The hotel is within walking distance to the Shinbashi station which will get you wherever you need to go in Tokyo and Japan. Also within walking distance is the fish market which is absolutely fascinating! A great weekend stay!

My wife and I stayed at the Park Hotel when we visited Tokyo (Sept 20, 2015 to Sept 26, 2015). The cab ride from Haneda airport is about 30 to 40 minutes depending on traffic. Cost of the cab ride was approximately 6000 yen (including the highway fee). We arrived at the hotel at approximately 5:30pm. The reception is on the 25th floor. Check-in was smooth and efficient. The staff at the front desk were very professional and extremely polite. I also rented a mobile wi-fi hotspot for this trip from Japan Wireless. I made arrangements for it to be delivered to the Park Hotel. During the check-in, one of the staff members brought me the package (without me even asking - hows that for excellent service). The staff member who brought our luggage to the room, took the time to explain the amenities of the room, hotel and the location of the emergency exits (and again, without us asking). Excellent service again! The room, as others have mentioned is on the larger size for Japanese standards. The bedroom was well organized and clean. The bathroom was also in the same condition (clean and organized). The breakfast buffet starts at 7am. A good assortment of Western and Japanese food. The only minor suggestion I have for the Hotel would be to start the buffet at 6:30am instead of 7am. The hotel is connected to the subway underground path which made it extremely convenient to explore the city. There is also restaurants within walking distance (about a 10 minute leisurely walk - the hotel is also connected to an outside pedestrian bridge, which made crossing the street safe and simple). You can also walk to the Ginza area too for more restaurant options and shopping (about a 15 - 20 minute leisurely walk). There's a Family Mart convenience store and a couple of restaurants in the basement of the hotel. We didn't use room service because of the restaurant options. Apparently there is also a coin-operated washing machine on the 26th for the guests to use. Check-out was the same as the check-in process (very efficient and professional). We took the airport limo (a bus from the hotel to the airport - cost was approximately 1000 yen/person). The airport limo tickets can be purchased at the concierge. We probably would have taken the airport limo from Haneda to the hotel if we knew about it (will definitely use this option when we visit Tokyo and stay at the Park Hotel again). The concierge offered to mail the wi-fi package back to the rental company, Japan Wireless, this is without me even asking (he saw that I was carrying a package which needed to be mailed)!And finally...Neither my wife nor I can speak Japanese (my wife can read some very basic Japanese words), and it was very appreciated that the staff took their time to patiently speak to us in English. The next time we're in Tokyo we will definitely be staying at the Park Hotel again. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodations!

Park Hotel Minato KuTokyoThis Hotel by taxi is about 1¼ hours from Narita airport, and on the way, you get to travel over the rainbow bridge and if you choose to go by rail it is about 1½ hours by train. This journey does not use the bullet train.From Haneda airport the journey takes about ¾ hour using either monorail or taxi.I recommend taxi on first visit or you will never find the hotel or its entrance and this applies to most addresses in Tokyo. The hotel can be accessed on three levels. By basement if arriving by subway, ground floor (called 1st floor in japan) or 3rd floor if using the above ground walkway. My Japanese wife never never work out how to access the hotel even after 5 nights stay. However this Hotel is well located for central Tokyo, Ginza, Tsukiji and using the local Shibashi station and Shiodome Subway you can easily travel further afield.The reception for the Park Hotel is on the 25th floor and on reaching it the excellent service began. We arrived at 10.30 am and were delighted to find our room was ready. On the 33rd floor we had a splendid view of Sumida River, Hamarikyu Gardens, Tokyo bay, the rainbow bridge and directly below The Yamanote & Shinkansen lines. Very spectacular!The room was large by Japanese standards and really comfortable. It was equipped with everything one expects to find in a quality hotel. English language TV was available although it often switched to dubbed Japanese without warning. The Wifi was strong and surprisingly there was even an English plug socket installed.Breakfast was served on the 25th floor adjacent to the reception area. Buffet style it catered for both western and Oriental tastes and apart from the pathetic toaster it was all really ushi. We did not try any of the restaurants in the hotel. There are so many different places in Tokyo to eat and we intended to experience as many different Japanese culinary styles as possible. This Hotel is a good and comfortable base when visiting Tokyo

Stayed in a corner room - great view. Everything else was poor though. No light, no side table for one person. Lack of storage in room in general. Staff are uncaring. Front desk staff could not find friends of ours staying in the same hotel, when eventually found the name - gave wrong room number. I asked for one hour later check out - "no problem" but for 1,500 yen (I refused). On check out they charged more than the booking's "total price". Weird "booking" system for fitness room. The room has not been vacuumed properly. Breakfast was not worth the money charged. Nearby major station results in noticeable noise and vibration from very early morning.

We stayed here for several days in February 2015 on our 2 week visit to Japan. Great hotel without 5 star prices. Rooms large and clean. Fantastic views location at Shiodome and Shinbashi stations very convenient. Walking distance to major shopping and close to excellent restaurants. Included breakfast is excellent with concessions to western tastes. Taxis easy to find out front. It is very easy to get lost in this building complex so be aware of where you are going and how to get back. Recommend this hotel highly.

The staff are so welcoming, friendly and helpful, nothing is too much trouble for them. Loved the breakfast and had a very comfortable peaceful room with a good wifi connection. Very close to the subway and the fish market. As the hotel doesn't have an entrance on the street it was quite difficult to find in the subway maze! The concierge gave some good restaurant recommendations, our favourite was En in the shopping centre nearby. The bar had a nice view serving lots of different whiskies. Overall a very good place to stay.

HelloGreat sport, small room and I didn't get the chance to have a room with the view of the Tokyo tower but the location is nice and you can do a lot around the hotel.Trendy and chic at the same time, polite staff, free Wifi all over the place. I will for sure pick the same hotel for my next stay. Room are a bit small but it's fine for a business trip. Book a room with front view, maybe more expensive but I will next time.

Park hotel Tokyo is the best hotel we have ever been too! Amazing staff, very friendly, amazing views and food!! An experience of a lifetime!! Cannot wait to be back next year! 10 out of 10!! Please stay at park hotel Tokyo you will love the experience xxxx

Wow! Beautiful view, nice lobby, good cocktails at the bar, and amazing room! We were lucky to be able to reserve an artist room, and upon our arrival we were upgraded to a larger King size room. We stayed in a newly decorated Sumo room, the art is beautiful and the details amazing, the view not so bad either, you feel like you are in the Jetsons when you look out of the window! The hotel is also a short walking distance from Ginza district and station (or a couples minutes ride on a cab), also, the metro station is right underneath the hotel. It’s very convenient and well appointed. The concierge recommended a Fugu restaurant for dinner and got us reservation for the same night we arrived, and it was amazing! We really enjoyed our stay and would love to come back to this hotel!

Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. Everything was perfect. We had a room with view of Tokyo Tower and Mount Fiji. Be sure to book one of these rooms. It's worth it. View changes around the clock. Staff is friendly and very helpful. Location is great with directly access to subway stations via underpass. Walking distance to the fish market and Tokyo Tower. Shinjuku, Rappongi, Shibuya and Asakusa can be easily reached with subway. Great shopping area and many local restaurants.

My wife and I stayed here for five days and four nights. The hotel is very nice, modern, clean, and the staff is very friendly. I would stay here again, and recommend this hotel to friends and family.

We booked a room with a view of the Tokyo Tower. The room was amazing. It had a window seat which was perfect for enjoying a glass of champagne at night while gazing out over the city, or for drinking coffee in the morning. Staff was very nice and helpful. Location is great. There is direct access underground to the train/subway station which is really useful when it is pouring rain. This hotel focuses on art and has artwork on display in the lobby and on the 31st floor, and even in the guest rooms. Also, at night they project art onto a huge wall in the atrium. It is an added bonus! There is a reasonably priced little bakery on the first floor that we utilized for lunch and breakfast.

Location is pretty good.View to Tokyo Tower is great (and if lucky even Mt Fuji)Breakfast Buffet is good and around 2,400 yen.Facilities are good although some parts of the building need some maintenance.The only downside is the amount of businessmen within the hotel, which reminded me of my job in the midst of my holidays. Besides this little downside, everything was just great.

Very nice no thrills hotel, well located with direct underground connection to two metro stations. This was very handy for us since it did not stopped raining!Room had a nice view to Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji on a clear early sunrise day, it was comfortable but small. Nice bar for tasting Japanese whisky will a cool view of the city from the 30th floor. Did not tried the French or Japanese restaurants but their menu looked interesting.

From the moment of check on the staff were very friendly and helpful.it did take a little bit to find the hotel coming from the train but not to hard. The room was a good size with a decent size bathroom. Really good location not to far from the train station and the art the hotel has around the lobby was really good. And you could buy some of it. And if you are a smoker there is a smoking room in the lobby. If your not a smoker you wouldn't even know it was there.

Staff spoke English very well unlike other Japanese hotel. Easy access into Shinbashi for shops, restaurants and Metro. The breakfast has a great array from Western cuisine to local Japanese meals. Would come back to stay there again.

I stayed 3 nights with my husband for our honeymoon.Our bedroom (city view of Tokyo bay) was tiny but essential, clean and well furnished.Perfect location to visit Tokyo, underground access directly from the hotel lift.Plenty of restaurants, bars at walking distance.

This hotel is the best place in Tokyo to view the Tokyo Tower throughout the night from your bed. Just book the Tokyo Tower View Room to get the amazing view of it. You even can see the Tokyo Tower right in front of the 25th floor Lobby. The staff are very friendly. We drop our luggage just one day before we checking in, and they are very willingly to help us. Location is so great, near the Shiodome City Center to do some shopping. And it also near the Tsukiji Market, we can take a 1km walk to reach the market.

Loved staying here. It really made our first trip to Tokyo. Great location, such lovely, friendly staff, calm atmosphere, very comfortable rooms and beds and a really good breakfast too. Highly recommend it!

This was the first hotel we stayed in after arriving slightly apprehensively in Japan. We need not have worried. The staff spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful with maps and directions. The breakfast was very good catering to western tourists as well as Japanese.Our room was quite a decent size as we got a corner room. However there was no space to unpack your clothes. We found this all Japanese hotels we stayed in.The views from the hotel were great - no need to go up an observation tower!The hotel is well located for the train and metro. The raised walkways are confusing to start with, but you get used to them.

Smart business hotel with European size beds & good size rooms great views over the city. Nice bar area and good breakfast selection. Staff were very professional and friendly. Easy access into Shinbashi for shops, restaurants JR line and Metro. Hotel was quiet we didn't hear the trains below us at all.

We stayed here overnight at the start of a week tour of Japan. We transferred from Marita airport by hotel bus. This was very easy and much less complicated than train.The hotel is smart, the staff welcoming and the environment pleasant. Rooms are small by western standards but well appointed.This was our first experience of a Japanese hotel and we were not disappointed.The breakfast was varied and plentiful

The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Tokyo. We walked a short distance to dinner in the Ginza district every night. The hotel staff is exceptional and always went out of their way to assist and accommodate your needs. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor of a business complex, somewhat usual, but views from the lobby are impressive. Breakfast is not included and is available at an additional cost. Tokyo has many options for breakfast, it's not necessary to eat at the hotel.I recommend staying for an additional cost in an upper level hotel room above the 34th floor with a Tokyo Tower view. Our family room was very small on the 26th floor facing the massive railway station that remained very noisy throughout the night. Our room was not ideal but efficient for a short stay of a few nights. We were touring in Tokyo long days, and only staying in the room to sleep. The bathroom and beds and walking area within the room were very compact.

Very nice hotel. We got a room with view towards the Tokyo tower which was quite impressive at night specially. We took an artistic room which was a bit small. Did not matter much as we only spend time to sleep there. Hotel staff is very friendly and a the bar a dream for whisky lovers. Location is good, close to a metro and train station. There is not very much close by the hotel but Roppongi hills is a 10min cab drive or 20-30min walk away. Good base to explore Tokyo.

This hotel has by far one of the best stuff that you could find they were very helpful and willing to help you, room was clean and comfortable and the location is awesome because its minuets away from Shimbashi city center and station, and shidome station is very close to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for the travelers to Tokyo. I enjoyed my stay there.

We really liked this hotel. The rooms are comfortable and have a great view (although we couldn't see the Tokyo tower from our bedroom). The staff was great and very helpful. There was a mix-up with our agency and they booked us a twin room instead of a double and they were happy to accommodate us and switch rooms. The staff also helped us make some reservations. The wifi worked very well. Also the hotel is conveniently located in Shiodomme and has an entrance directly through the subway. Just take exit 7 in the Shiodomme station. You will also find a Family Mart right next to it with is very convenient. Overall it was a very good experience and the views are amazing.

We loved the Park from the moment we checked in. Excellent location, very central - great room beautifully decorated and great view. The service for very efficient. The only disappointment was the breakfast buffet which was rather basic and therefore we felt a li'l over priced. Outside of that I would recommend this for any one travelling to Tokyo.

Great views, good size queen bed room with cool decor.Really quiet, excellent air conditioning and free WiFi.The staff are very helpful with everything from restaurant bookings to getting an umbrella.It's close to the station and close to one of the many parks.A lot of places to eat at lunch times, simply to to the underground and you'll find an abundance of them.Getting here was easy, we took the transfer limousine (bus) from Narita Airport. Dropped us straight outside

Great location w direct access into subway at Shiodome. Staff exceptionally friendly. Contacted concierge to book dinner for us at a local Michelin star restaurant in the worlds top 50 and they got us a reservation no problem. Massage on arrival was great - esp after 11hr flight. Booked through concierge prior to arrival. Main area of hotel is really cool. Bar was great for late drinks. Japanese restaurant perfect for our first night dinner. Room probably standard Tokyo size. Comfortable but no wow factor. A really great place to start our trip round Japan!

The staff was great and the hotel was very clean. It is in a great location, lots of restaurants, public transportation, and shopping at your doorstep. Registration is on the 25th floor and street level entrance on 1. There is no bell person help until the 25th floor. The rooms are very clean, however only a tiny amount of draw space.

The writer repeats herself in saying that this hotel, centrally located in Shiodome area (Shiodome sito-site) is just the best. I feel so happy returning here, familiar, friendly, clean and with the interest of latest art exhibitions. There is nothing to fault. Within easy walking distance of Shiodome station and Shimbashi (that's about 7 mins walk away) there is everything in this mini-city that one needs, including the handy supermarkets underneath to garner one's room provisions. Whilst the rooms are small (who cares) it is exceptionally good value for its convenience and the staff just bend over backwards to assist. This time I arrived from Haneda airport, having taken monorail and changing for local train into Shiodome - perfect.

Great location near several subway stations, friendly helpgul staff. Stayed in a designer room, very nicely decorated and simply amazing view over Tokyo and Tokyo tower. Also quite affordable, would definitley recommend Park Hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo!

Excellent service from the front desk staff the moment we arrived. Room is spacious and very clean and has all the comfort for our stay. B2 of the hotel connects to the subway stations. Airport limo direct to the hotel doorstep. Will definitely stay in this hotel on my next trip.

According to Japanese standard, the room was very spacious; excellent structure in a strategic location very close to the shiodome metro station. Walking distance from a plenty of nice restaurant karasumory e Ginza

This hotel is very well located and no matter which room type you choose, there will always be a great view. Moreover, the staff is really committed to your well-being and the rooms are clean. Special mention for the central hall where you can eat breakfasts and dinner ... Je recommande vivement cet hotel de qualité, aux prix non exorbitants et très biens situés dans Tokyo !

My family and I stayed at Park Hotel Tokyo for nearly two weeks in July. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, and on our side of the building offered great views of Tokyo Tower. The beds were firm and comfortable, and the air-conditioning was excellent, which was necessary with outdoor temperatures in the 90s. The bathroom was large and spacious. Tokyo hotel rooms are generally small so it required two rooms to accommodate our four-person family, but we felt at ease allowing our grown daughters to stay in their own room. The service was outstanding. The only disappointment was the laundry room. It had only two machines and the dryer hardly worked, but when we called the front desk they gladly took our wet laundry and returned it to us dried and folded. The location is very good because it offers many good dining options in easy walking distance. It was also a 5-minute walk to Shimbashi station and less than 30 minutes to Ginza.

Very nice experience. Helpful staff, awesome panorama Windows and view over the city. Can see my Fuji when its good Weather. Its located in a calm area so its nice. They have restaurants. Very close to ginza shopping. And the train stops close to the hotell. I cant see any negative around this hotell they get very good judgement from me. Wanna come again there!

We stayed at Park Hotel Tokyo for four nights. Being the first time in Tokyo we would be out all day, so we wanted something simple and in a decent location. The hotel was initially a little difficult to find as there are several office buildings and therefore also hotels in the area (the hotels are normally on the top of the the office buildings).Our room was a standard room with a city view. The rooms are small but well-equipped with a small desk, comfortable bed and new bathroom. Amenities were and were re-stocked every day.There was no roomservice since the on-site Japanese restaurant was closed - it should be reopened by now. We did not try the French(?) restaurant, and for breakfast we went to a nearby Japanese bakery instead.Location-wise there is easy access to most sites by metro, but there is little life in the location, especially by night as it is a business area.Service-wise this hotel was great, easy check-in and check-out and the staff always greeted us whenever we came back from our adventures. It is a business hotel, but it is great value and high standards throughout. I was unable to fault this hotel considering the price and rating.

The hotel is conveniently located close to Shiodome and Shimbashi Stations, allowing its guests an easy access to any part of Tokyo. The station itself is huge with many exists and it took us a while to find the right exist first time we arrived. Moreover, there's Park hotel and Royal Park hotel at the same #10 exit to make it even more confusing :)The hotel is really nice, the staff is very kind and professional and the room was super clean and comfortable. We took the room with the Tokyo Tower view and it was simply amazing. We really enjoyed our stay.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo!

Just returned from a multi-city tour of Japan through InsideJapantours. Out of 4 different hotels, this one receiveves two thumbs up with myself and my traveling party of four. Staff was personable and gracious. They never failed to greet us during our multiple coming and goings throughout the day. We had a trainee, Ms Kubota assist us with very good english and was quite pleasant. She was most helpful with directions and money exchange.. We are most thankful when they assisted us with a medical urgency. One of our traveling companions had a dental emergency. The holiday of Obon, limited our options. The hotel staff arranged for a taxi, the staff, Ms. Satori instructed the taxi driver to take us to Tokyo's International Hospital. Our companion received quick care and antibiotics for the problem. We were very satisfied. Ms. Kubota also helped us with forwarding our luggage to our last destination's hotel, thereby eleminating the burden of carrying luggages on the very tight spaced trains.The hotel is located very near the Shimbashi station, this was advantageous to many of the sites we visited. The breakfast buffet was very good offering both traditional Japanese and Western selections. Even the uber selective teens enjoyed it. The rooms were small but cozy, clean and modern. The view was grand. The hallway carpet could use some updating. Their is a convenient family mart downstairs for sundries and actually good meals that they are willing to heat up for you.It is well worth staying here.

The location is perfect. It is connected with one of the train station - forgot what it is. Restaurants around the area. There is a convenience store in the basement area with restaurants and shops. Room is well equipped with necessities. View of Tokyo Tower and the night view is magnificent.Service is great which is a given in Japan.

We stayed 5 nights at the Royal Park hotel. We got the apartment on the 34th floor. It had a great view on Tokyo tower and the harbor. The hotel lobby is at the 25th floor of the Shiodome tower. There was a large bedroom, luxury bathroom and nice small kitchen and living /dining room. Very comfortable.The hotel has a great location near the fish auction (10 minutes walk) and near subway stations, Shimbasi and Shiodome. It has a very helpful staff, great breakfast. The atmosphere is not typically Japanese, more like a very convenient business hotel. We stayed there with two small kids.

The location near two train stations shows easy access to Haneda airport, Tokyo Big Sight and down town.The bed was more comfortable than most beds in Asia. The size of the room was slightly larger than most single rooms in Tokyo. The staff was very helpful to get me checked in, to my room and stored my luggage the next day. I would book this hotel.

A brilliant hotel in an ok location but very close to the shindome station which takes you every where in Tokyo. The hotel check and check out was very smooth. The room views is good. The rooms are very small and the singles beds are small too. If you're over six foot like me you're feet will dangle of the bed a little. All in all the hotel is decent and a good stay

Had a wonderful stay in Tokyo. The view from the room was amazing. Hotel was near subway and train stations making it easy to get anywhere in the city in minutes. Hotel staff was wonderful and were extremely helpful. They also spoke English which was very advantageous since my grasp of the Japanese language was very basic.

This was a great location for sight-seeing, shopping, dining, and using the subway/trains. The hotel was accessible from the Shidome subway station. The station also had great shopping and an excellent choice of restaurants were in the office building connected to the station.

Easy to get to, major rail and underground stations nearby linked by underground walkways to the hotel and other buildings. Small convenient 7-11 shop near lowest hotel entrance. Ginza district, a nice park and Tsukiji Fish Market all nearby.Friendly, helpful and courteous staff who speak enough English. Also staff helpful in dealing with our dietary requirements after I emailed them prior to arrival. View from the rooms we stayed in were amazing as the hotel starts on the 25th floor where the reception and lounge are, interesting artwork in the lounge.We stayed in a family room which sleeps three and was of a good size for the location. The bathroom was OK size wise and clean. Shower above the bath. Hi-tech toilet as expected.Breakfast very good, wide choice. Evening meal in lounge restaurant was nice, the Japanese steak was very tender and "melt in your mouth". I would definitely recommend the French Restaurant as well.Overall we would stay there again.

The staff in the hotel are very friendly. Check-in took around 30 minutes due to lack of staff on desks. The rooms are quite small but make up for it in quite stylish layouts and a great view! The hotel rooms are well sound insulated and the broadband is very fast - unfortunately unreliable in the lobby. Overall, an average hotel for Tokyo standards.

The staff were really helpful and our room was ready early when we arrive in the morning. Breakfast was good variety, didn't eat at night here as there were cheaper alternatives nearby. Would stay here again for the location

Things started well, but then went downhill. The atrium and lobby are gorgeous. The lobby is on the 25th floor of the building, and the rooms surround the 7 story tall atrium. It's impressive and clean looking. At check-in we requested to check out thirty minutes late. They said no, claiming the hotel was full. When we got to our room, there was a distinct smell of body odor. We should have complained, but didn't since they said the hotel was full. Physically, the room was nice, more like a western hotel than typical tiny Tokyo rooms.At 4 AM we were awoken by a fire alarm. The instructions on the loudspeaker told us to take the stairs to evacuate the building. Remember, we were 30 stories up! Fortunately, by the time we put ourselves together and found the staircase, an announcement told us it was a false alarm. Some other guests were less fortunate and actually got locked in the stairwell. When the alarm went off again 15 minutes later, we ignored it. Management put notes under all the doors apologizing for the alarms, but basically implying not to bother complaining or asking for a refund.

The hotel is in a good location - short distance from Ginza and Tsukiji Fish Market. Good access to the subway network too. Hotel reception is on the 25th floor with view of Tokyo Tower.Noticed there are overseas attachment staff who accorded us great hospitality too! It was a pity there was a false fire alarm in the wee hours that should not have happened but reckon this is an one-off event.Like that this hotel is not in a very busy part of Tokyo.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Park hotel and found it well located, especially in a city where there isn't really a centre as such to stay near. It is above Shiodome station, which via the Oedo line gets you to Shinjuku or the fishmarket in the other direction, among many other destinations obviously. The new driverless Yurikamone Line head over to Obeida district, (which is well worth a trip. You go over the Rainbow bridge and there is some amazing architecture there not to mention a Venetian themed shopping mall) and the entrance to that is right outside the hotel on the 3rd floor. Otherwise Shimbashi station is close which we used a lot for the Ginza line, or the JR lines for places like Tokyo station (for a trip to Tokyo Disney), or for the fast train to Kamakura, also highly recommended. Bring your swimwear in the summer and check out Kamakura beach. We arrived via the Narida Express and then took the Yamanote line to Shimbashi from Tokyo station and walked from there. Beware, there are lot of steps and in the heat of the summer (not to mention the humidity) it was a bit of a slog with luggage, so taxi is an option I guess. Once we wandered in the underground area of Shimbashi/Shiodome once or twice, generally we found our way around quite easily. There are also great above ground walk ways which help (level 3 from hotel). The reception is on level 25 of the Shiodome Media tower, which is a distinct triangular building. Note, do not confuse the Park hotel with the Royal Park hotel Shiodome, which is confusingly just next door in the Shiodome complex. The room was great as we stayed in an artist room on the 31st floor (Zodiac room), and we had amazing views towards the city and Tokyo Tower as well as Mt Fuji (only visibly as a barely there outline due to haze during the whole 9 days we were there). The room is snug, but enough room to happily spend the evenings there after a whole day walking about Tokyo. The window seat is a treat. The bathroom is perhaps best described as cozy, but features a Japanese toilet (heated seat, discreet noises to mask, uhm, naturally occurring ones. Rinse, lather, repeat anyone?), which we got used to very quickly and now miss. Also plenty of toiletries and also some coffee/tea making facilities and a mini fridge in the room. The mattress was relatively hard, but we both slept well every night, so no complaints there. It is also very quiet and the trains don't run all night so we had no problems. To keep within budget we ate lunch out and about most days and got dinner from one of two Family Marts (convenience stores) which are downstairs in the subway area of the building. They serve very tasty ready meals and they will heat them up for you as well. Not to be confused with any convenience store food I’ve come across in the rest of the world, this stuff ranges from fresh salads and fruit to ramen, udon, sushi, chicken, pork dishes and also some western food such as spaghetti carbonara or pasta with tomato sauce. They also have a great selection of cold beers and wines, as well as sake and juices, water etc. And they have desserts, and no trip to Japan is complete without sampling the sweets here (just make sure you don’t need fillings as they really like it sweet!). So we loved the Family Marts and were regulars quickly.We ate once at the hotel itself at their Japanese restaurant (see separate review) and did not have breakfast other than room service on my birthday, which was plentiful and yummy. We usually had breakfast at the Tulleys café reached via the subway level of the hotel (only the far right elevator goes to that level!) and walk until you get to the Kinkos/Family Mart. The café is outside across from there. There is also a way to get there from the above ground walkways. They have great hotdogs, buns, pancakes and very good coffee. There is a funky and rather large clock which looks like it ought to be in Alice in Wonderland that does a display (it toots, honks and blows steam) every hour on the hour, which is a couple of levels up from café and also reached from the level 3 walkways. We used the concierge twice and her English is impeccable, thanks to some schooling in Canada. She was very helpful and found us a great and affordable Kaiseki, as well as other bookings. The free in-room Wi-Fi was fast and a great amenity to have, in fact it was one of the reasons we booked this hotel. Oddly, Japan isn’t as much of a paradise for internet surfing or telephony as one might think unless you have a Japanese contract/SIM, so it was very helpful. The welcome sake was much appreciated and if I am ever lucky enough to return to Tokyo, I would definitely stay there again. Even a (false) early morning fire alarm didn’t spoil things and made for an interesting experience.

Pros: amazing concierge service and friendly staff. fluent english speakers available. nice room. good breakfast. many restaurants and coffee shops located in the neighboring office buildings (go via Basement level 2)Cons: 1-person fitness room must be reserved in advance, very worn equipment (fraying wires on the weight machines), wifi was slow and sometimes didn't work at all.

Stayed here for 4 days at the height of summer. I mainly picked this hotel because it was reasonably priced (compared to other places in Tokyo) and the views. I got a room on the 33rd floor which had a pretty nice view over the train tracks and if you stepped right up to the window you could see the harbour. So pretty satisfying but maybe just a bit sad compared to the amazing pictures on their website. I guess you need to pay for the pricier rooms. The room was fairly small but with a few furniture moves, it was quite comfortable. Provided amenities are very good.The location has positives and negatives. If you're staying in Shiodome because you want to see Shiodome, then you're set. Anywhere else you want to go is fine unless you're good with walking - even if you're getting the train. You'll do more walking than you think because everything underground seems quite spread out but mainly because unless you're a local or some kind of genius, you will get lost a lot. Despite doing it three times, I didn't once successfully navigate my way from Shinigawa station to the hotel. There was a lot of walking around, back-tracking, staring at station maps, pouring over google maps, crazed rambling through shopping centres... None of this is the hotel's fault and it's actually quite well signposted and close from the local Shiodome subway station. If you master getting to and from trains, it's well connected to lots of the cool things to do in Tokyo. When in the area, I definitely recommend walking around on the 3rd floor walkway which connects the major hotels, offices and shopping centres. If you get lost, get up there as it's easy to see and they have directions. It's a straightforward 15 minute walk to the fish markets.I didn't eat in the hotel but strongly recommend heading down to the Family Mart in the basement level of the building for breakfast or other meals and snacks. It's a convenience store but way better than you would get in Australia or many other parts of Asia.I had a late flight and asked whether late check-out would be possible. Whenever I've asked this previously, I've always been offered at least one hour free of charge. In this case, he immediately told me an hourly rate of 1500 yen per hour for a maximum of 4 hours. I thought this charge was a little steep but I guess it's not totally unreasonable.There was an earthquake which could definitely be felt but the hotel didn't fall down, so that's good.

While small, the room was modern and very clean. The view over the bay was panoramic. The hotel is minutes to the railway, shopping and restaurants. A walk in the park is recommended. The breakfast was good value with plenty of choice.We would stay here again.

We visited August 6 and August 11. On Aug 6 we booked a city view and for our last night in Tokyo, a tower view. Both rooms were essentially the same (queen bed) with the exception of the spectacular Tokyo tower night view. The rooms were comfortable & clean; good wi-fi; many items available for use in the bathroom; and front desk staff/lobby personnel exceptionally helpful and friendly. We found the price quite reasonable and definitely recommend this hotel

Me and my wife stayed over night with our children of 4 and 6. This hotel was nice and close to a street with cheaper restaurants where they didn't mind a couple of quite wild children. Nice breakfast with both english and japanese breakfast. The children loved that we had a room very high up and the view was certanly great. Wery helpful staff and close to the fishmarket with some sushi restaurants. We enjoyed the art at the hotel.

We stayed in this hotel 14/07/2015 for 3 nights in a corner room with a view of the Tokyo Tower and wasnt disapointed we where on the 29th floor and had an amazing view, the room was large with a massive bed very comfortable, quiet and clean.The mono rail and train station are joined to the hotel so we had no problems with transport. The staff where very friendly and helpfull. We enjoyed it that much we stayed there again for 2 nights at the end of our holiday. When we go back to Tokyo will definitely stay at this hotel again.

This is a fantastic hotel, I have been here already any times. The service level is excellent, extremely friendly staff: you really feel welcomed here. The rooms are quite small but beautiful, quiet and extremely clean. Very well equipped bathroom, splendid TV, superb wifi and a mini bar with drinks for reasonable prices. Delicious breakfast buffet. From the 33rd floor we had a fantastic view on the Tokyo Tower.

My son and I booked for a stay in a twin room with Tokyo Tower view and it was excellent. The room was beautifully clean though, as is often the case with Tokyo hotel rooms, a little small, nonetheless the space was more than adequate. The room as nicely decorated with good quality furnishings and the bathroom was spotless. There was a flat screen TV and radio and the aircon was fine, which it needed to be, as the temperatures were generally in the 30s. The staff were helpful and wonderfully polite. We requested extra coffee supplies one night and had barely put the phone down when they arrived. My only reservation was that there was no information about hotel amenities or the area available in a language other than Japanese. Reaching the hotel from Shimbashi station is a bit of a hike, Overall though, worth every penny.

Small room in a quiet, high floor in a mostly office building. The hotel is the top 10 floors or so with a massive atrium allowing light right down to the hotel lobby. Reasonably central, you can walk to Ginza in about 20 minutes, and connected to both toei and tokyo subway systems without having to go above ground.The room, although small, was well laid out, clean and modern.A nice hotel, but not exactly in the thick of things in Tokyo.

Ask for a room on 33rd or 34th floor overlooking the tower and you'll not be disappointed.Staff were very friendly and helpful with a special mention going out to the team manning the concierge desk.We found this hotel to be great value and in a great location...even a false alarm fire part evacuation didn't ruin it for us.

Ive been to Tokyo many times and stayed at different hotels each time, and Park Hotel is so far my favorite hotel. The service and rooms are of very high quality for the room rate the hotel charges. I stayed at 2 different Artist rooms facing the Tokyo tour, and both were extraordinarily beautiful. Fukami at the Concierge was very polite and helpful. The only concern I had was that the quality of the pillows and mattresses could be better. Overall, I had a very good experience at the hotel and would definitely come back on my next trip go Tokyo.

I stayed at this hotel for several nights in November last year, and I enjoyed everything about it. Being a bit of a techie, I was super-impressed by the speed of the Wi-Fi in my room, with Upload speeds of more than 50 Mbps.November is a great time to visit Japan, for it's Fall (autumn), and half the trees are changing colour. Yes, it's a bit cool, but worth it. Most people presume to visit Japan during Cherry Blossom time, but that's when everyone else is visiting Japan, and the locals take holidays then to see the blossoms, and so prices rise and hotels and trains are harder to book.The only difficulty I had was finding the hotel. It doesn't have a real street address, and there is no direct street access to the hotel.

On top of a commercial building, reception is on the 25th floor and we were on the 29th. There is an atrium from reception to the top 34th floor but bar and restaurants on the same level as reception. The hotel has an emphasis on art with some of the rooms being decorated by local artists. The hotel is within walking distance to the Ginza (about 20 mins) and is connected by walkways to an MRT station. The bathroom had lots of amenities - toothpaste, toothbrushes, cotton buds, disposable razor, comb, clothes line over the bath, body lotion and all the usual shampoo etc. The toilet had a heated seat with built in fan and bidet. The mattress was quite hard and there wasn't a luggage rack but otherwise the room was great.

Stayed as a couple for three nights during May 15. Friendly and helpful staff, they even held on to our luggage after we checked out on the last day, as our flight back was late in the evening and we didn't want to lug it around all day. The location is easily accessible by public transport but also within easy walking distance to Tsukiji market (great if you want to go super early!), Ginza, even Tokyo Tower (we visited this late at night and had a lovely walk back to the hotel) etc. We had a clean room with gorgeous views. No complaints whatsoever - would happily recommend! We are coming back to Tokyo next year and will be looking to stay here again.

We stayed here for 6 nights in July/August. The hotel location is awesome and you can get to anywhere in Tokyo from either the station connected to the hotel 3rd floor or from shinbashi about 10mins walk. Ginza is 10-15mins walk. We arrived on a Sunday and took the train from the airport to Nippori station and JR to shinbashi. Here we got confused a little, so instead of dragging out suitcases around took a taxi to the hotel (730JPY). I would recommend the train route for weekends, but not for weekdays as JR can be crazy busy. We took the direct shuttle on the way back, and was much more convenient. Just make sure to book your shuttle much in advance as it sells out quickly. They say it takes 2hrs, but for us on a Saturday return, it took just 75 minutes. The hotel main lobby is on 25th, so took the elevator there. Check in was smooth, staff spoke decent English, and we were given a nice room on the 31st floor with zodiac art and a lovely Tokyo tower view.The room was nice, a bit on the smaller side, but efficient. It was well stocked and comfortable/cozy. All standard accessories were provided. We do have to ask for an iron, but also saw a laundry facility with ironing board on the 26th floor. Did I mention the view was awesome. I am sure in nicer weather with less haze Mt Fuji could be seen from the room. The room is quiet, except for a light hum from the trains. Not disturbing in any way, but just something we noticed as we live in quiet rural setting. I actually enjoyed watching many kinds of trains passing by. (My secret fun thing to do was to go up from 1st to 25th floor using the corner accessible elevator, which gave an amazing perspective of Tokyo). The staff was very polite and courteous. We tried the breakfast on a couple of days, and found it to be satisfactory. Nothing memorable though, besides good service and am interesting lobby area that opens up to the top of the building. We also tried the Thaan spa for a massage. It was quite relaxing, and nicely done. The hotel is connected at the 3rd floor to other buildings. There was kind of a street festival going on when we visited, so it was fun to see some jpop etc. The only bit of a let down was that there is no swimming pool. Not a deal breaker, but having enjoyed some awesome highfloor pools in HK, it would have been icing on the cake. Also, tripadvisor lists one of the area for the hotel as odaiba, while odaiba is reachable from here by a 15/20 minute train ride, the hotel is in shinbashi/shiseido not odaiba. Overall, a nice experience, friendly staff, and central location that even a first time visitor can manage. Will stay again.

We stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip. There's an amazing view as soon as you get in the lobby which is on the 25 floor of this very tall building. There's a bar and a restaurant on the same floor with another amazing view, very romantic as well. The staff is very professional, the breakfast is delicious and beautifully put with sofas and relaxing chairs and the amenities in our room were plenty and everything we needed (you basically don't need to bring anything as for your toiletries from home as there's everything and replenished perfectly). This is a great choice of hotel and the location as well very close to main points of interest and very well connected with train and metro. Absolutely recommended.

It has an amazing view as the lobby is on a 25th floor of a building, and the rooms on the remaining floors above. It's extremely well located as it had a subway entrance just below the tower. Great service. And great staff.

Our corner room on floor 33 was really comfortable and clean with superb views. We found the staff helpful and polite and always ready to sort out any little problem. For example, our European hair straighteners wouldn't work on that voltage so a power converter was quickly supplied -crisis averted! Fabulous breakfast, both western and Japanese and we also had a very good, reasonably priced dinner in one of the restaurants

Lovely hotel in a good position for exploring Tokyo, being only two stops on the JR over ground rail loop from Tokyo central. Rooms a little on the small size but not a problem as this is typical of Tokyo where space is at a premium. One or two people have moaned about staff attitude at this hotel but my experience was that they were almost falling over themselves to be helpful. Thank you to the staff who agreed to let us use the shower facilities on our last day, even though we had checked out earlier. After a days sightseeing in 35c heat we were most grateful for that prior to heading to the airport for a long flight.

My room was located on the 28th floor and spacious for Tokyo standards. However, this hotel does not seem to comply with basic safety regulations. I checked the two emergency exits on my floor... just to find that both doors were locked! So in case of fire... basically you're trapped!

I don't normally stay in hotels of this standard but decided to spoil myself with a little luxury and I was not disappointed. It was fantastic. A room on the 30th floor with great views over this bustling business centre, exceptionally good room service food and total calm and quietness once inside your room. It is inexpensive in comparison to other hotels of the same standard and cost me only AU$140 a night so I was glad I chose it and may pamper myself again the next time I need to visit Tokyo.

Excellent hotel, very well situated in calm street while being close to a lively district around Shimbashi station. Rooms very clean, like everywhere in Japan, all is at a very high level. However, although we were sleeping at 30th floor, the noise of the trains can be disturbing. Wonderful view on Tower.

This hotel had the most romantic views i've ever seen. View of the Tokyo tower in all its glory from the room is enough to make your stay worthwhile, but then you have their artist rooms, which will make you want to spend far more time in the rooms admiring the beauty of the artworks. They come with their own stories and they are beautifully unique. Such a wonderful experience. The hotel itself is nicely located with train and subway stations very close by, lots of sightseeing places and restaurants etc, the bus from the airports have one of their stops right at the hotel. The rooms start from a much higher floor level so you cant go wrong with room at any floor that you pick. The wi-fi works great, the staff is extremely helpful and friendly.

I spend a lot of time in hotels and Park Hotel is excellent. The hotel provides quality service, a very attentive staff, easy access to public transportation, and the price was great. Highly recommend this hotel

Shiodome area is one of Tokyos most modern areas, with many skyscrapers. Hotel is located perfectly. Hotel lobby is located at 28th floor. From there you have straight access either to Yurikamome line(3rd floor) or subway. There is also 24h Family Mart at the bottom floor. Also the big Shibuya station is within walking distance which is also accessible from the bottom floor. Fresh sushi and Tsukiji Fish Market is about 15 minutes walk from the hotel. We started here our 3 week trip in Japan. Stayed for 5 nights. Right from the check in you get a glimpse of the famous Japanese hospitality. Everything worked smoothly. Also at the first evening we got the most stunning sunset ever. Views were pretty impressive over Tokyo. Room was European size as was the bed. They were also clean and comfortable. Only the whole carpet floor is a minor turn off. Smoking is prohibited in every room. Perfect place to start your Japan trip!

Staff were very friendly and eager to help. No language issues as several staff spoke English.Room was great, good view of city, very clean and quiet.I would recommend this hotel.it was part of a great first experience in a foreign country.

Nice business hotel. The rooms are nice and not too small with exceptional views over the city. The location is not far from Tsukiji Fish market,Tokyo tower and the imperial palace. Friendly staff and nice breakfast.

We stayed at Park Hotel Tokyo just for 1 nignt and 3 hours of this night I spent sitting near the window and exploring the city view from the 28th floor. We had a room with the railway view, so it was so exciting to look at all these trains.The hotel located in a good region, very close to Ginza and all other places of interests. You can reach the hotel lobby just by the underground pass, hust be sure, that you took the right exit from the station. The hotel is very nice, during our stay we had a chance to enjoy the exibition in the hotel lobby. The room is good enough, equipped with all amenities you may need during your stay. The breakfast buffet is so good, we had a choice of Japanese and European meal, so everybody will find something tasty. It was a great experience for us to live in this hotel, so if you are looking for the hotel with a view and good service, you should choose this hotel for you stay in Tokyo.

Perfect place if you wanna see the tokyo tower. However the room is small and a bit stuffed if stay long inside. I also dont recommend for breakfast too. The quality of the food was pretty bad. Overall i was satisfied

My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend trip in Tokyo and we were not disappointed! The location is ideal to be able to get around the city. There is easy access to the subway and JR lines right from this hotel, we were always a short distance away from exploring the city. If you are looking at this hotel and debating to get the Tokyo tower view, I HIGHLY suggest you make the upgrade! The views at night were breathtaking to see the city lit up right in front of your eyes. Our favorite thing to do at night was to open all of the curtains and lay back and take in the beauty of Tokyo. The hotel was very clean and staff was courteous. They had nice smelling bath products that made you feel like you were in a spa; definitely nice after a long hot day of exploring one of the largest cities in the world!

Our arrival at the Park hotel was met with one of the grossest hotel rooms we've ever stayed in. There was a lingering smell of cologne and body odour and the carpet was filthy. I called down to the desk and asked about switching rooms. They sent someone up and he showed us three other rooms, all for a slightly higher cost per night but it was like night and day. Our new room, which was about $50 more per night (a savings from about $80 normally), was fantastic. It was huge with a massive bay window and amazing views from the 27th floor. The Thann Casa suite was very clean and had a nice big bathroom with good quality toiletries. There was a projector on the ceiling that you could turn on that had a fish pond video playing out on the top of the bedding (this is seriously hard to explain but was very cool). We could see the Tokyo Skytree from our room along so night time was great with all the lights. Overall the hotel is pretty good, the staff were a little weird at times and I wasn't crazy about the location so I would most likely never stay here again but the room was very nice for the last part of our Japan trip. I would recommend staying closer to main stations while in Tokyo and this hotel is a bit of a walk from Shinbashi station but it took another 5-10 minutes to wait for two different elevators to get to our room. As others mentioned, the lobby is on the 25th floor so you need to get up to there first with only one elevator operating. This was poor planning on their part as it got quite annoying and made it hard for us to go back to rest in the afternoon before dinner. A decent hotel but I would look around for something better for the price.

One week in Tokyo was an outstanding experience. This centrally located skyscraper close to Tokyo and Shinbashi stations has been a perfect base for us to go to the conference or visit the city.Rooms are big, well furnished, very clean and the staff as everywhere in Japan, extremely polite and helpful. You can get to the hotel in many different ways. The most convenient is public transport and the underground tunnels. Hotel itself is located on top floors of the building with an excellent view to Fujijama from the lobby and rooms on the side. I’ve had a view to the railway station and as a transport lover was a great experience to observe shikansens moving around. Apart from the view to certain points of the city you can enjoy the Tokyo landscape to a distance of more than 20 km sitting on the windowsill of the enormous screen. A superb view.Breakfast is average for this type of hotel but you can enjoy both, Japanese and European/American cuisine. The bar is rather expensive but you can help yourself with a convenient store downstairs :)

Beautiful hotel with comfortable room , super nice views of the city and very helpful , very friendly staff. Good breakfast. Top service. Great location. Not a bad thing to say really. There was a fascinating Yokai exibition. Hope to be back and stay in an artist room. Recommended.

Stayed at Park while in Tokyo. Amazing location - right of the Metro which was awesome. Close to major tourist sites and Ginza. Upgraded to a Tokyo Tower view which was well worth it. Hotel staff and service was top notch. Clean and spacious rooms. Highly recommended for those visiting Tokyo.

Staff so helpful room really good with terrific views over Tokyo situation really good with access to vibrant centre and train stations would definitely recommend this hotel staff went way out of their way to make our stay of 4 days a fantastic experience

I stayed at the Park Hotel on the last two nights of a two week trip to Japan and loved every moment. The great experience began three weeks before I arrived when they made reservations for a very popular 7 seat Sushi restaurant. Like many hotels in Tokyo - the Park is on the top floors of an office building. The lobby is gorgeous - modern, with towering ceilings and a breathtaking view of the Tokyo tower. If I had more time I would have spent a few hours sitting in the lobby, sipping on a cocktail at the bar and people watch. My room was clean, a little on the small side - but again - that is to be expected in Tokyo). The concierge is very knowledgable and provided great suggestions and (most importantly) directions to sites in town.

Park Hotel is a very comfortable city hotel for a very good price (we booked well ahead). We liked our room with bay view on the 30st floor (in my eyes, there's no need to pay extra for tokyo tower/city view, to look across the river to the bay and down to the nearby garden is very nice, just make sure you book a floor above 29th so that no other office building blocks your view. the lobby is in 25th floor, from 26th floor upwards are the guest rooms). Rooms are well equipped with safety box, water cooker plus tea and coffee making facilities, chairs, desk etc. and they provide very nice, high quality toiletries. We didn't try the (expensive) breakfast, there is a Family store in the (under)ground floor of the building where you can get food etc. Staff is very friendly and helpful, e.g. when it comes to make bookings at restaurants or help with directions.Only small things: As usual in modern high-rise buildings, there's no possiblity to open the window and let some air in (not even the option to open a window for some inches, as you sometimes can even on high floors). The bathroom/toilet had a little smell, which must have come from the drainage system, and I guess there is not much the hotel can do about it. The toilets (washlet style) are comparatiely old with not so many features, but that didn't bother us.The location is very good, as the hotel close to the railway and subway line, it is also close to the fishmarket. but the impression on the map is still a bit missleading, as this is a very urban area with flyovers and highways, so you have to walk up and down quite a bit to the to the railway platforms. also, you cannot just cross the road (in some places it is not even clear how to get to the otherside of a crossing and you have to walk quite some detours). But it's still a good location, obviously, for public transport and for going to Ginza area although this is a little walk.

Great hotel in Tokyo.direct access to the subway system. View of the tokyo tower from the room. Comfortable bed, amazing bath and shower. The hotel bar makes good drinks, try their signature drink it is delicious and sour.

This hotel is a wonderful place. We had an artist queen room with a Tokyo tower view. It was like a dream. The reception staff offer me a bottle of champagne for my birthday. We really appreciate that!

If there's any people keener to please than the staff at the Park Hotel I haven't met them yet and I have met some very good ones. Having read that Japanese hotels are strict about check in times, it was daunting, after an overnight flight, feeling very jet lagged to be arriving at 11am. To be greeted by a smiling young lady who after the normal information exchange, said, "You look so tired, your room is ready now." Was the perfect news. We stayed 3 days and this attitude never changed, it was all about what can we do for you? Starting on the 25th floor the views from our room were stunning. One morning at breakfast I was lucky enough to be enjoying the sumptuous buffet, looking out with Mt Fuji as a distant backdrop, this is rare as I was told it is normally a shy mountain that hides in the clouds. The room was very comfortable there was a ice machine and vending machine in a little room on the same floor. The hotel has a fantastic location for transport, monorail and subway are virtually at your door. It is only a short walk to the Ginza strip and also the restaurant area. We ate at both the hotel's restaurants Japanese and French both of which are superb.They both have brilliant views a long with brilliant food and service. If you mention you need something it is there or the staff help you get it. The room was serviced as if by magic, it was quiet and yet this bustling city is at your door step. This hotel made our Tokyo stay as good as it might be.

We stayed 3 nights at the Park hotel and had a very pleasant stay. The room was small but very well equipped-the best selection of toiletries that I have seen. Beds were comfortable and a wonderful view of the Tokyo Tower (with Mt Fuji in the background on a clear day) and the city. We ate in the Art Lounge (not a huge selection)and the French restaurant (great food and services). The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The Hama-Rikyu gardens are an easy walk and you can catch the water bus to Asakusa from inside the gardens. Ginza is also within walking distance.

We are at the end of 3 1/2 months of travelling throughout the Middle East, Europe including Scandanavia and Russia, and the United Kingdom. This would be the best hotel we have stayed in regarding the efficiency, helpfulness, friendliness and respectfulness of the staff. This hotel is to be commended on their staff in all areas including reception, porters, concierge, housekeeping, restaurant and the bar.The room was an adequate size, large compared to some in London and Europe. The bed was comfortable and the pillows good. The products supplied in the bathroom were great. The shower cap even had a scrunchie supplied with it...a nice touch. The shower pressure was good and the bathroom was a good size.We had breakfast in the restaurant. It was the usual buffet breakfast and my only criticism, minor at that, is that only full cream milk was supplied. I asked for skim or even soy, but was told no. The dinner in the restaurant was delicious and the bar had a variety of cocktails to choose from.There is free wifi in the room which is excellent. The hotel is in a good location being within a short walking distance to Ginza. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would DEFINITELY stay here on a return trip to Tokyo.

First time to Tokyo and booked this hotel due to the previous reviews. This was a great location for me to navigate the subway by myself while husband worked, take my toddler to Disney world, do some shopping & see some cool sights.The concierge & all staff were so helpful, room service so fast and efficient and dry cleaning great too. You can even do your own washing if you wish. Easy access to he family mart & nearby station makes it easy with a little one + pram friendly. Great views & great place to base ourselves for a first trip. I would definitely come back.

Really enjoyed my stay here, the hotel was fantastic with a lovely design and feel. The room was great with a view of the Ginza. Everything is pretty much within walking distance and train stations are nearby.

This hotel is located close to a lot of sights, shops and restaurants. Sits atop an underground subway so handy that way as well. Rooms start on the 25th floor. We were on the 33rd floor and paid a modest increment to have a view of the Tokyo Tower. Rooms were very clean and much larger than we expected. Hotel staff were exceptional in their desire to meet our every request. Even booking over the internet they answered our questions on how to get to the hotel via the train system. They provided detailed instructions and maps. Saved us an expensive taxi and added a little fun to the trip. We would certainly stay here again if in Tokyo.

I chose this hotel during my recent trip to Tokyo. This was not my first trip to Tokyo and my last stay was another hotel on the top of the Tokyo JR station.I selected this hotel because of the location. It is closed to Shinbashi JR/subway station. Please note that only the Shinbashi station of Asakusa Line is closed to the hotel i.e. less than 2 minutes walk from the hotel. For all other subway/JR lines (Metro Ginza Line and JR lines like Yamanote Line), there are at least 7-10 minutes walk from the hotel via the covered (sort of underground) walkway. The Shiodome station of Yurikamome can also be reached from the hotel within 1 minute from the hotel. I booked the Corner Twin room. It was not very big. We could see the Tokyo tower and Odaiba from our room.There are airport shuttle service available to and from both Narita and Haneda airport at the hotel.There is a convenience store available at the basement level of the hotel building.You can find various restaurants and shops closed to the Shinbashi JR station. The female staff working in the porter service were very helpful. And I really appreciate.

it was nice hotel in tokyo,we really had a comfort and tidy room at that moment,and the staff also friendly and helpful,let my family feeling well,i ll remember all of your smiling, hope see u again and keep smiling for next guest ^^

We took our grandson to Tokyo and spent 3 days at this hotel. The rooms are very nice and the views can be very pleasant. We had a corner room which is a little bigger and a had large bay window. The staff were excellent. One of the concierges "N" was able to solve our every need. The have 3 restaurants in the hotel (japanese,french & their art lounge).The breakfasts in the lounge were some of the best we have experienced in a hotel. We will be stopping back in Tokyo for our return flight and look forward to another night in this 5 star hotel.

I was travelling with my adult daughter and we were lucky enough to be upgraded to one of their "art" rooms which was spacious and had a great view of the city. The hotel reception is located on the 25th floor which is a bit different and you can walk underground through mall's underneath Shinbashi station (about 5-7 mins) which is really convenient as good access to the train system is key to getting around Tokyo. It's also located close to Tsukiji fish market - must see and 10 -15 mins walk to Ginza. We ate in the Japanese restaurant in the hotel one evening - very good sashimi

Of the three hotels that we stayed at while vacationing in Japan, the Park Hotel was our favorite. By western standards Japan hotel rooms are smaller, the Park was the largest of the three we stayed in, it was also the only room which had a safe.For English speakers, Concierge spoke English perfectly and was extremely helpful with directions and eve confirmed tours we booked online. Location is close to Shinbashi station, there is a JR line that will take you to most of the popular stations.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Park Hotel. The corner room was lovely, reasonably spacious, comfortable and light. There was fantastic views of the city and Tokyo Tower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. It's nice and calm, slightly away from the hustle and bustle, but very close to two metro stations and a light rail track so easy to get in on the action and move around Tokyo from there. I would definitely stay again.

We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel overall. We actually had two separate stays , each of one night, at the beginning and end of our trip and hence stayed in two different rooms . The rooms are not huge but perfectly adequate for short stays, and the Art rooms certainly make what would otherwise be a fairly in exciting room more interesting . We stayed in Cherry Blossom and it was lovely. We were offered complimentary Sake in our room which was a nice touch , and yukata style robes and slippers were provided. It was easy to get to the hotel from Narita airport- the so called Airport Limousine service ( actually a coach) serves this hotel amongst others in the city centre and takes about 90 mins in traffic. The hotel is also close to underground stations, and is ideally located for the shopping in Ginza just a few minutes walk away (Apple, Uniqlo, Chanel, Prada etc etc). The Japanese Restaurant in the lobby was good but expensive- I think there is a European restaurant too but didn't eat there. The bar is excellent-an offshoot of the Scottish Malt Whisky Society with a good selection of Japanese and Scottish whiskies , and the barman chisels ice impressively too!As everywhere in Japan the customer service was excellent. Although not luxurious by some standards I thought this hotel represented good value for money, in a good location and great service. I would definitely stay here again.

The hotel is very well coated for public transport as Shinbashi Station and Shiodome Metro Station are just around the corner. It is very well equipped and the view from our room at the 34th floor was almost breathtaking.The staff is very competent and friendly.

Great hotel with a fantastic view. 5 min walk to Shimbashi and to the fish market. Go and have a sushi breakfast and continue with some Ginza shopping. Booked directly on their web page and got great prices. The close by sub takes you where ever you want to go.

Rooms are average size for Tokyo, but comfortable. Prices are reasonable, service very good. Stayed for four nights, no issues. Staff were friendly and helpful. Bus service to Haneda airport is very convenient.

We stayed in December 2014, on our 4th trip to Japan. We booked the park hotel again as it never lets us down. This time we opted to book an artist room, as they were a new edition, and a bit different. We arrived early or check in as we had a tour booked in the afternoon, but this was not a problem with hotel. Our bags had been sent on by our previous hotel, and we found that they were all ready waiting in our room.We were allocated the queen artist room - 100 Poems. The impact on walking in is stunning - beautifully hand painted and very relaxing. the attention to detail was stunning, including a painting of Mt Fuji on the bathroom mirror. The hotel also sent us a bottle of sake as a thank you for booking the room - very appreciated after a long shinkansen journey! The queen rooms are compact, but we had plenty of room for our 2 huge cases and ridiculous amounts of other baggage we had accumulated. The view was looking over Shiodome, and the offices opposite - still good for a bit of high rise people watching.I would highly recommend booking an artist room - they are just really special and add that bit extra to your stay. We wont hesitate to book again.

We stayed three nights at this hotel. The room was comfortable, clean and the views from our corner room of the Tokyo Tower were wonderful. It is conveniently located near trains and subways. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The brunch was a tasty way to start our days exploring Tokyo.Although you're in a busy city, I don't recall hearing any noises.Our first night, tired from our flight, we shared a steak with mashed truffle potatoes - at the bar/restaurant and it was great. The cocktails were impressive as well - giant balls of ice that are hand chiseled - probably the best moscow mule I've ever had!

The first thing that strikes you is the reception area being on the 25th floor so you take a lift of to the side of the entrance which appears to be poorly signed.But when you come out of the lift and enter in to the reception area you see a well laid out stylish and comfortable area that is also used for the breakfast area.The room I had was a standard double room and on entering it had the usual painting on the wall. The bed was comfortable not too hard, but there was only 2 channels in English and one of them was BBC news which had several sections dubbed.The rooms are quite spacious and the hotel service is excellent. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Ginza and close to the Shimbashi Station if you want to arrive by trainIn all it is a very pleaseant hotel with plenty of ameneties

Hotel has good size, comfortable rooms and sensible rates. Great location for easy walking to Ginza shopping area, and trains to get any where else. Buffet breakfast good standard. All staff very helpful.

Booked the room with view of the Tokyo Tower, and the view is indeed breathtaking! We can take as many pictures as we want in the room, with the Tower, be it day or night shot!Room comes with full amenities, clean and neat, spent a very comfortable 3 nights here. It looks smaller than I expected but all others is fine, as long as it doesn't have any musky smell which I came across for rest of my hotel stay in Japan. Location wise, its within walking distance to Shimbashi Station, which connects to most of the tourist attractions, eg Asakusa, Shibuya, Odaiba, these places took less than 20 mins traveling time.Excellent service staffs, very friendly and courteous 24/7! I would definitely book the same hotel in Tokyo during my next visit!

Really good location, really easy to get around on public transport from. The view is great as the hotel occupies the top floors of the towers. We had a third bed added to a corner room and still had plenty of space.

Great hotel to explore Tokyo. Everything you need is walking distance: transport links, Ginza, few family-mart shops to pickup small items like water, Tokyo Bay, fish market...Breakfast buffet was generous and well stocked with local and international options. Decent size rooms for Tokyo standards (don't expect large rooms), perfect views across Tokyo tower or Tokyo bay. I loved the shelf-sitting at the window; if you are good with heights; you can spend hours perched at the window watching the city lights.Staff cannot be more polite and most of the spoke good english. Free wi-fi with great speed and coverage. Room service available, mini-bar, kettle for coffee and tea, surprisingly quiet, quiet air-con (windows will not open), all toiletries provided incl toothbrush, comb, cotton buds, shower caps etc.Overall, highly recommended and would stay here again if I visit Tokyo.

Impeccable describes everything about this hotel. The room overlooking Tokyo Tower was amazing and on clear days the view of Mount Fuji was spectacular. The hotel service epitomises the best that Japan has to offer. The room service food although small in choices offered was beautifully presented, high quality and a fairly standard price for a hotel of this quality. The hotel is ideally located to Shiodome train station, about a two minute easy walk, which connects you to the many train lines in Tokyo and beyond. The hotel can organise a limousine bus to take you to the airport, cost is about $30. The lobby is one of sophistication and art with the moving art feature that is projected onto one of the towering internal hotel walls coming on at 7pm every night. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would highly recommend any travellers wanting a first class experience to stay here.

A very good hotel with decent sized rooms (for Japan standards) and mostly very helpful, cheerful and friendly staff. Could improve on facilities for families with younger children, but other than that, a very good quality hotel.

Almost every time I go Tokyo I choose the Park Hotel for my stay. Near Tokyo station, Ginza and Tsukiji fish market with direct connection to subway and 10 min away from Shimbashi JR line. Quality of rooms as well as service is at the top. Price is within the range for this type of Hotel and location. Highly recommend !

Everyone was extremely friendly and curtious! Some of the staff knew us by name. When we checked in and went to our room a prearranged tea service was given. She also took our pictures with our cameras. Hands down this is the best experience ever! Highly recommend!
