The young lady helped us with our luggages to our room. She showed us our room, and explained features and amenities. She then came back with a bottle of Champagne, a compliment from hotel for our anniversary. The room size is big in Japanese standard. It is actually bigger than 4-star hotel that we rented in Time Square, New York. The room was very clean and smelled good. Room amenities includes everything you need: razor and shaving cream, dental kit, hair brush, and so much more. In room, we has a kettle to boil water for coffee and tea, a small refrigerator for mini bar. The bathroom is good size. The bathroom has things that we don't have in the US: a defrosted mirror, a control panel for toilet seat warmer, water spray, and flush. The hotel location is excellent, especially for us to walk 40 minutes at 3:00 AM to see the Tuna Auction at Tsukiji Fish Market. At 3:00 AM, there is no subway available and taxi would cost too much. The Shimbashi Station is ten minutes walk connecting to the hotel's basement. The Shiodome Station is right below the hotel basement. From these two stations, you can take different subway lines to anywhere in Tokyo. It is very convenient, cost saving, time saving, and most efficient ways for transportation in Tokyo. The hotel has currency exchange machine in the lobby on 25th floor. It has a great view of Tokyo Tower from the lobby as well. The hotel has free wi-fi which was great for us to stay connected with our children at home. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was excellent with variety of both Japanese and American food choices. We tried almost everything and all tasted very, very good. There is a convenient Family Mart right below the hotel to get some snacks and drink. During our stay, all hotel staffs were so excellent, very polite, and extremely helpful with anything we need. They all can speak English very well. One thing that make this hotel so excellent than the other two hotels that we stayed in Kyoto and Osaka is the Park Hotel Tokyo has ready made map with directions of all popular attractions. This is our first trip to Japan. The Park Hotel Tokyo has made our trip so wonderful and memorial. Thank you so much to ALL of your staffs, especially thank you Ms. Nozomi Shimose and Ms. Mana Yoshihara. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plan to visit Tokyo. We will definitely stay at this hotel again whenever we can come back for vacation.

Why the Park Hotel in Shiodome? Well, to be honnest... because there are four hotels in Shiodome and I already tried the other three. I wanted to complete the set. Also: the Shiodome area is a very strategic place to stay. It is very well connected to big stations and it's on walking distance from Ginza (shopping area). But after staying I certainly appreciate this hotel. Of the four hotels in Shiodome, it offers the best product for the price.The lobby looks a bit odd. It is jam packed with furniture, making it hard to see what is part of the lobby or one of the in-house restaurants. The result: it is empty most of the time due to general confusion by the public. Check-in was quick and easy and the service like a 5 star hotel. Such hospitality! The rooms are fairly spacious and have a modern, Japanese / Scandinavian decor.Wifi is free and rather quick. I paid a bit extra for a "city view room" and indeed the view was jaw dropping! Tokyo Tower was right in front with Mount Fuji in the background on clear days. My camera was so happy with this room!Some things I did not like were the bathroom with a stand in the tub shower at breast height. I know the Japanese are not as tall as the Europeans, but why can't they build a European size bathroom in a hotel for foreign guests? Also, the safe deposit box is too small for the average laptop.

Staff couldn't be friendlier or more accommodating. But that seemed to be true everywhere in Tokyo. What distinguishes Park are the great views from the rooms and the delicious breakfast buffet! Also, it's convenient location

From the time of booking, I was pleasantly surprised by the service and helpful staff. Very quick to answer any emails and questions. Very detailed directions on how to get to the hotel from the train or airport. Staff upon check in were great. The room was amazing, it had great views of the tower which looked spectacular at night. Breakfast was really good, a good mix of Japanese and western food. The art in the foyer was incredible. The concierge went above and beyond to help us find a beautiful restaurant that specialised in tempura. A wonderful stay.

We recently stayed at the Park Hotel as a couple in Tokyo for a weekend. Here is some more information:Location – the hotel is very well located directly above the Metro station. Bing our first time to Tokyo we were nervous finding the hotel however we were in the lobby in less than 45 minutes after leaving the airport. The Hotel is located nearby the Ginza area which is great to explore, plus being so close to numerous metro lines this hotel is well located to explore the city.Room – we stayed in a standard room. The room was well priced, very comfortable, clean and included great amenities. All round a very high quality room for the rate we payed.Amenities – the lobby is very nice with great views over Tokyo incluing the Tokyo tower. We didn’t dine at the restaurant or use any other amenities as we were only there for two nights. We decided not to select breakfast with the room as it was expensive at the time of booking (USD $50pp) compared to what you can find at cafes nearby.Staff – the staff at the hotel were VERY helpful, polite and treated us very well. Their level of English was great.We would highly recommend this hotel to other travellers.

First time at this great hotel. Great facilities, friendly staff and super location for walking to Tsukiji Market, Hamarikyu Garden and Giza shopping; or simply walk into the metro station to take you anywhere in Tokyo. Concierge services could not be better - Mana was superb. Will return soon.

The flight to Tokyo from New York was a long one. We were worn out and cranky. It was so nice to arrive at the Park Hotel.The front desk is on the 25th floor of a tall building (rooms on floors higher than 25th floor). We arrived around 4 pm and did not have to wait to be helped. The people behind the front desk were professional, friendly and helpful.Our room was simple, but very clean. My wife and I upgraded to a larger room with a king sized bed. I recommend the larger room.Breakfast at the Park Hotel is a nice introduction to Japanese cuisine. I loved the rice with Japanese pickles!If you stay at the Park Hotel, be sure to take a tour of the fish market. It is really cool! Tokyo is such a large city that it is easy to be overwhelmed by its scale. From the Park Hotel you can walk to the fish market, which makes it so easy to see.

The Park Hotel was our first impression of Tokyo, and stepping into the lobby to see Tokyo Tower in the distance behind the reception desk was quite jaw-dropping. An incredible view you will struggle to beat anywhere, particularly at night with the tower lit up.All floors of the hotel are higher than the 25th level, so you are guaranteed a view of some sort. If you stay here, you will have the option of paying a bit more for a room that looks out over Tokyo Tower - I would recommend taking them up on this. You only live once and the memories of waking up to the tower and possibly Mount Fuji behind it will last forever. Seeing Mount Fuji will depend on the weather.The rooms are comfortable, modern, and reasonably sized. They contain all of the amenities you would expect and a sound bathroom. Until arriving I did not know a toilet could do so many things, though I won't go into the details.There are a few dining options on the lobby floor. We ate there a couple of times and honestly found the food to be on the average side. I think the Park Hotel has missed a trick by not putting a top class restaurant on one of the higher floors utilising that unforgettable view. Other hotels we stayed in offered better dining in better settings.The location is another good point - ideally placed for Ginza, Odaiba, the Tsukiji Fish Market and of course Tokyo Tower. This may be the absolutely perfect location for you and it may not - it all depends on what things you are mainly interested in. However, you can get on the Metro without leaving the building so nothing is really that far away. It is worth noting that the hotel is part of a mammoth complex and it can be quite hard to actually find your way in or out. Do your homework on the mapping of the area beforehand if you can.I would have to recommend the Park Hotel. It is far from a budget option, but in return for your yen you will get a slick, modern base for your adventure in this wonderful city.

It was a wonderful stay with a very friendly concierge who were most willing to help out with making restaurant reservations and even sending out postages to make one feel truly at home.The ease of accessibility from shinbashi/shiodome station is also a big plus point, without needing to worry about getting wet, since it's all sheltered.

Next time we are in Tokyo we will definitely stay here. The hotel is fabulous and the staff were amazing, the accommodated our every need. Wonderful buffet breakfast and great coffee. We had the Tokyo Tower view room and it was definitely worth it! The view was stunning!

We had a great time and the staff & services was the very best! The view from the room was Magical and we enjoyed every day so thank you Park Hotel staff! I strongly recommend this Hotel for everyone who is visiting Tokyo for business or pleasure.

The hotel itself is of French design and I really liked the art-centeric theme. We stayed with my sibling in-laws, 2 separate rooms. Each room had a very nice view of the city of Tokyo, with the Tokyo Tower nearby. The lobby is located on the 25th floor. There you begin to see the different artwork. If you're not a fan of art, or appreciate art in any form then I don't think you'd care for the displays, etc. Anyways, our room had rose petals painted on the walls as its design. The room and bathroom were very clean, although a little bit smaller compared to American standards. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, assisting us with organizing our airport shuttle the day prior to take-off. There was a guest room order-in menu, a restaurant, bar/happy hour available to the guests. Free wi-fi and TV with basic channels - both in Japanese and in English. The hotel is very close to the Shinbashi/Shimbashi JR Station and is a 10 minute or so walk away from the Tsukiji Market. Highly recommend the hotel and would come back here again!

Stayed with the missus, the baby and three parents. Hotel accommodated us all very well and we'd absolutely return. Staff were first rate (doormen, concierge, waiting staff, reception - all great - thank you!); there were even a few real characters there; particularly the guy who fed me the Ruri Coedo beer every evening. Rooms are simple but tick all the boxes and have fantastic views across one of the premier global cities. The lavatories here and all around the city are an eye-opener. Location was excellent and we had a superb time.Tokyo is a 'must-visit' and whilst I am sure you will get many good hotel experiences in a city like this, the Park Hotel certainly met our standards and expectations.

We stayed for 3 nights in March 2015. Reading some reviews, I was worried that smoking smell might be an issue. It turns out that they will only have non-smoking rooms from April 2015 so they're transitioning to a more non-smoker-friendly hotel I guess. I didn't smell any smoke during my stay there. Since our visit was quite short, we needed some help in getting dinner reservations and not wasting time waiting in line for a table or, worse, getting turned away. Ms. Yoshihara and Ms. Shimose were excellent at arranging dinner reservations and replying to our emails. We specifically asked for bars/restaurants where they do not allow any smoking. Whether or not a restaurant allows smoking is hard to figure out on the internet for an outsider. (At least it was for us.) They were immensely helpful in that aspect and suggested very lovely and fitting places. They also looked at some of the places we wanted to go to and told us which ones were non-smoking. If you're worried about your dinner or drinks getting ruined by cigarette smoke, it's very nice to know that that won't happen. Also, I stupidly forced one of my chargers into the weird/curvy outlet behind the TV and it turns out it was a locking outlet. (Now I know what a locking outlet is! Sorry!) So when it was time to check out, I couldn't get my charger out. They sent someone up to get it out right away and it looked like it was quite an ordeal. Of course, the employee apologized profusely and put in an adapter so it won't happen to the next guests. :)Room was squeaky clean. Everyone working at the hotel spoke great English. Wifi is fast and password-free. The views are great.

This hotel has nice views over Tokyo, particularly if you get the side looking out onto Tokyo tower - and on a clear day - Mount Fuji.Unfortunately, there are few other positive things to say about the Park Hotel. The lobby is terribly cluttered with dated looking furniture, obscure art exhibits, and leftover Christmas decorations. Rooms are for the most part very small for a hotel in this price range. They lack any finesse or charm. Furniture is simple and somewhat worn. Beds are still in good shape, and the room was sufficiently clean. But generally, business hotels in Tokyo costing half as much are built to higher standards. The hotel’s location is good if your business is nearby, with quick access to Haneda. Otherwise the Shiodome area - built up in the early 2000’s - is rather sterile, particularly at night. If it’s a view you’re after, you might want to consider the nearby Mitsui Garden Ginza Premier. Or spend a little more and look at the Cerulean in Shibuya. The Park Hotel certainly isn’t worth its price.

Stayed 3 nights in February and found the Hotel to be a bit weird .Staff was nice . The Lobby is on the 25 floor but when you come in down stairs it's hard to find how to get up to the lobby. Poor Signage . The rooms are very tiny with worst pillow I have ever encountered. It was like they were made of popcorn. So uncomfortable. When we travel we always like to start our day with a workout in the Gym. This is the #1 worst Gym in the History of Hotels!!! First of all you had book time in the Gym . Why? Because it only really holds 1 person at a time. Its about 6 x 6 with old crappy rusty equipment. Brutal!!! After about a 10 minute workout that's all I could take of this joke of a gym. On the positive side the rooms were clean with great views and the location is walking distance to Ginza and the metro. Would I stay here again? No there is better out there for sure.

Stayed here for a few nights around the Tokyo Marathon, amongst numerous other marathon runners staying at this hotel. This is a very westerner-friendly hotel. Lots of English speakers. The biggest selling point of this hotel is the breathtaking views, from the hotel lobby, lifts and the rooms. It is very centrally located too, and has excellent transport links too. It seems there are a lot of people staying on business, and other tourists. It’s a great hotel.

The hotel is very well located for starting excursions to mid-town Tokyo or to the fair Tokyo Big Sight. It is directly at Shiodome station of the Yurikamome line.The rooms are comfortable and well equipped. Just the WIFI could be faster. And it didn't seem to work all night. I would recommend rooms with Tokyo tower view. It is great. You can aslo see Mt Fuji sometimes.Breakfast is worth the price. In contrast to other hotels in Tokyo the share of Japanese food is relatively small. One thing could be improved: The toaster is lame and too small. A toaster with conveyor belt would be much better.

perfect location for our family of 6, including a 6 month old. rooms were quiet, comfortable, clean, lovely views, wifi in room good. staff 100% friendly and helpful. transport connections excellent. bar: very good drinks. bakery downstairs: very good. room service food: good. sadly, Japanese restaurant was temporarily closed and didn't try tateru yoshino bis restaurant. dining options good in neighborhood and great dinner next door at Hibiki in Caretta Shiodome. would stay again in a heartbeat!

Within easy reach to Shimbashi station-10 mind, Tsukiji fish market- 15min and Ginza shopping belt- 20mins. We stayed 4 nights in a designer Matsuri room and totally enjoyed the vivacious lustre. It was well kept and maintained dailyEverything would have been excellent if the hotel could offer a more sumptuous breakfast buffet spread

We were staying here for 4 nights ,hotel staff are very friendly ,atmosphere there was good, a walking distance to Subway ,train station and Tsukiji Fish Market . Many Restaurants are just about a 15 min walk from the Hotel . If you prefer a quiet place to stay, this will be the ideal hotel .

The hotel itself offers good rooms, an attractive environment and the staff is friendly, helpful and speaks very good English. Particularly we found the concierge desk valuable in guiding us on the use of the metro system, access to the various attractions, etc. The gym exists although it consists of only three machines plus a few extras and is placed in something that looks like a normal hotel room, i.e. it fits a maximum of two persons and must be booked in advance. The only slight minus about the hotel is the location with only other office towers in the immediate vicinity. However, in practice this wasn't a real issue for us with easy access within 5-10 min. walk to two metro stations, the Ginsa district and the Tsukiji Fish market. In conclusion, you get a lot of hotel for the money if you're willing to walk the fairly short distance a couple of times a day. Would indeed consider staying there again if traveling on my own expense.

Good service pretty much for the whole 8 days trip in Tokyo, was a little worried about this hotel when looking at map. However, the hotel has great location with good service, most staffs are able to converse in English.Location wise, the hotel is kinda connected to Oedo Line Metro (using the hotel elevator down to the basement). Otherwise, you could also walk to Shinbashi Station (JR Station) which is about few minutes from the hotel. You have also additional 2 options if you walk to Shinbashi Station, Asakusa metro and Ginza metro line. Not forgetting the Yurikamome line to Odaiba etc.There is restaurant at the basement of the building where the hotel is if you do not feel like eating in the hotel, there are also a few cafe/restaurant outside the hotel or you could opt for more options if you walk to Shinbashi station direction where you will find more restaurants (before you reach the station, looking left or right, you should find a basement like tunnel leading to more restaurants).Room is a lil small as compared to other hotel I stayed with in Tokyo, but overall it is comfortable. The bathroom is clean and has adjustable lighting options which is good if you do not like dim lit bathroom (I don't).Depending on how you designed your itinerary and how familiar with Tokyo, this could be your hotel or might not. Will I consider choosing this hotel for my 4th trip? Absolutely.

Spent five nights here with my sister, the location is excellent walking distance to a major railway station. Very friendly staff, reception is on the 25th floor, incredible view of Tokyo Tower. Room was clean, quiet, and the size was OK for two of us. I'll come back here next time in Japan.

Stayed for 8-9 nights with a friend here. After a lot of researching online and asking colleagues who had been to Tokyo, this hotel kept being brought up. Travel time by train from Tokyo Narita Intl was 40-50 mins. Pretty easy to understand rail network. The local main station is 'Shinbashi' It is a 3-5min stroll with your suitcase to the base of the tower the hotel is located in. The signs are pretty small, so keep your eye out for them.The staff are very polite and helpful. Our room was always immaculately clean.I would also like to personally mention the concierge as they helped me and my friend plan everything from booking dinner reservations, to organising day trips and Shinkansen (Bullet train) tickets toward Mt Fuji. I would happily return to Japan and this hotel again. Fantastic country. Thank you for having us back in July 2014.

I am so glad that we chose this hotel for our 4 nights stay in Tokyo.In terms of location, even though the nearest station is cited as Shidome Station, it's only 5 mins walk from Shimbashi Station on Yamanote Line, Ginza Line, Asakusa Line (just 2 stations away from Tokyo Station). It is only about 3 mins walk to Ginza as well. It is THE perfect location without the crowds you'd find at Shibuya, Ueno or Shinjuku, etc.The views from our room (Tokyo Tower Queen Room, i think that's what it's called) was just stunning that we didn't bother with any observatories or sky bars. You will never want to leave the room just for that view (try to get the city view room facing Tokyo Tower). The room is very clean and well-equipped with hair dryer and Thann brand toiletries. While the room was not huge, it was good size for two people.The concierge was just amazing with all our various requests such as helping us book restaurants, calling our next hotel for pick-up from the train station. Not only that they are very helpful, they are very quick in responding to our requests e.g. we were informed of gift items without having to ask(we got a free, small bottle of wine for 3 nights stay), the iron and board were brought to the room within 5-10 mins of calling the front desk. We also went to the bar there (good views of the city from there too) and I had the best green tea to go with my o-sake. There is also a discount for the hotel guests for the french restaurant, Tateru Yoshino. I thought I'd never say this about a bowl of carrot soup but it was just out of the world!!The only small compliant I have is the pillows. They are a bit small and not comfy enough. but we experienced the same thing in another hotel too. Maybe it's a cultural thing?Totally recommend this hotel. If you happen to choose this hotel for your stay, take these walking directions from Shimbashi station especially if you have a lot of luggage with you. This route will be the fastest and have lift access from the station to the hotel.- Assuming that you have arrived at Shimbashi station on Yamanote Line ( as most tourists will take Narita Express from the Airport to Tokyo Station), take the Ginza exit and walk diagonally to the right for about 10 seconds until you see the old Shimbashi station. - Take the escalator going up and walk straight. You will walk past Starbucks if you have taken the right-hand path. - after 10 seconds, you will see a connecting bridge on the right hand side to a tall building. Walk along the bridge and at the end of the bridge, you see a big clock and another overhead bridge / pedestrian deck ( above the intersection below) connecting to Shiodome Media Tower where Park Hotel is located. The overhead bridge will take you to the level 3 of that building where you can take the lift to the lobby level of the hotel. if you are looking to have a quick, inexpensive bite, there's a ramen shop that serves up big portions of delicious Tonkatsu ramen for 600-700 yen. From the hotel, go down to level 3, take pedestrian deck and walk down the stairs instead of walking towards to the big clock. Walk for about 100 meters and you will be able to see the shop diagonally to your right. It's still on the way to Shimbashi station and you will see it if you don't take the elevated way.

This is the second time we stayed in this wonderful hotel. The lobby is situated on the 25th floor with a fantastic view of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji (on a clear day). Service is impeccable. The English staff were most friendly and helpful. The rooms though small, are comfortable. We got upgraded to a room with a view of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji and the view was spectacular. We were lucky to arrive after the typhoon cleared the clouds and we could see Mt Fuji clear as a bell! Amenities were superb. The hand wash, shower gel, hair conditioner and body cream were all expensive designer types. In fact, the body cream was so good that my wife bought a bottle to use back home! The hotel has fast, free wifi.The hotel location is very good, right above the Shiodome subway, a few minutes walk to Shinbashi, 15 min walk to the Tsukiji fish market and to Gion.We will always stay in the hotel whenever we come to Tokyo!

We are finishing up our week stay in tokyo and I cannot say enough how much I loved this hotel. The room views were all amazing. The rooms were clean and close to subway and resturants. For me personally the staff service was extremely helpful. Being our first time in tokyo... they knew our schedule, suggested places to eat, helped with directions. Don't bother trying to figure it out on your own.if I visit again...it will be to this hotel.

One night stay only, good sized room and bed, clean, all amenities, stayed in water view room, bathroom appears slightly dated but clean and only minor criticism. Close to trains but a slightly long walk depending which line you travel on, but all underground walk, has some eateries nearby but no major shops. Overall good stay decent value.

The hotel is situated in a great location - easy walk to the JR, GINZA lines...the room is clean, orderly, and in good condition and the staff is super helpful. Even before we arrived the concerige was lining up reservations for us and ensuring that we had the proper directions. THis is an INVALUABLE service in Tokyo - as most restaurants you need reservations and sometimes they can be difficult to find. The concerige had printed off maps and pictures of the entrances to make sure we found it. Any question we had they answered and did what ever they could to help us attain what it was we wanted.....best concerige services ever!!! thanks for making our stay in Tokyo memorable Mana!!!!

I'd booked Park Hotel 2-3 months before travel date, Hotel Concierge is perfectly helpful and booked our Michelin Star restaurants. When we reach the hotel , Concierge has already prepared map of restaurants for us. Then, we enter our room , We're stunted with the Tokyo tower and Mt.Fuji. Room is clean and non-smoking allowed. Hotel location is near Tsukiji market that can walk about less than 10 mins and it's locate in the middle of Tokyo metro and Jr. In addition to a new line that can take you to Odaiba (Daiba).It's worth money to choose Park hotel again for me when i get back to Tokyo.

I was really pleased with all aspects of our experience at this hotel, except for one thing. I'm a non-smoker, and walking into the lobby to the smell of smoke, and then having to pass right through to get to and from the lifts was quite unpleasant (smoking in permitted in parts of the lobby area).The staff were very helpful, the breakfasts had a wide variety for us to choose from, and we had a great evening at the nice Japanese restaurant at lobby level (forget it's name).My biggest surprise was just how good the location was for what we were doing. We found it easy to get to everywhere either by walking, or by the different train lines. A real bonus.

My husband had been staying here on business and I joined him a week later for 1 night before continuing on to explore other parts of Japan. It had fantastic views and lovely comfy beds. I would recommend this hotel if you can afford it, it is definately worth the money just for the views.

An excellent experience, apart from one relatively minor thing. The "hot" breakfast (bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs and potatoes) was far from hot - barely luke-warm every day during my stay. To compound that the plates put out for guests were stone cold. By the time I returned to my table the food was congealing. I complained to the floor manager on day 2 and pointed out that it was not a healthy situation - but nothing changed. On day 3 I gave up on the luke-warm food and chose rolls, meat and cheese. Would I stay there again? Probably, yes, but I wouldn't risk the "hot" breakfast!.

Park Hotel ideal location close to subway, restaurants, Ginza district. Excellent hospitality & customer service. Room facilities were very good with everything catered for. Views are breathtaking from mountains to train 's snaking in & out of Tokyo. Water views , bridges, gardens..fabulous place to stay in Tokyo

This was a really tremendous find. There are two metro stations within falling distance connected either directly or along an elevated walkway above the streets, but it's also within walking distance of Ginza and the Imperial Palace grounds. Be sure to request the rooms with a view of Tokyo Tower, as there is a surprise bonus to that: Fuji. Staff were helpful, breakfast buffet was simply fantastic; they have their own bakery downstairs. A really calming experience. Bed very comfortable, room on the cozy side but fine with all of the expected Japanese amenities. Would absolutely stay here again. Great value based on my internet searches when I made the booking.

Spent five nights here, the location is excellent walking distance to a major railway station, the "monorail", the Tsukiji Fish Market, numerous restaurants, cafes. Room is clean but small and did the job, check in and out was easy breakfast was purchased with the room and was an all you could eat buffet very nice way to start the day, not to mention reasonably priced.

we arrived here at midnight 28th jan 15, after making our way from the airport. We had 3 days here, Very friendly staff, reception is on the 25th floor, incredible view of Tokyo Tower. Shown to our room on the 32nd floor, we had a tower view room, lovely and as you were so high we could leave our curtains open the whole time. Brekkie lovely, but wasn't included in our room price I think roughly $25 per person. We asked for directions, they were very helpful and nice. We booked a mt Fuji tour but unfortunately after booking someone from the hotel called us and said that the tour company said the day we were going was going to be overcast and suggested we cancel, which I thought was very nice. All up I recommend this hotel.

Arrived in the dark. Looked out of our 33rd floor window the following morning to a full on view of Mt Fuji across to the West of the city - what a bonus! And a birds eye view of the bullet trains snaking in and out of Tokyo Station. Very comfortable clean room in crisp new hotel which starts at the 25th floor. Ten minutes along pedestrian walkways from Shinbashi station. Asked for the same room on our return from Kyoto later in the week - no problem. Very helpful friendly staff. Ate in the hotel's Japanese restaurant - excellent and inexpensive course menu. Fully booked on return trip so ate in their French restaurant. Good food, but more expensive and much quiter, lacking the atmosphere of the Japanese restaurant. Good breakfasts - both Japanese and European. I hope we'll come back to Tokyo. If we do, this is where we'll stay, for sure.

The other recent reviews really say it all. Good, clean hotel, efficient, helpful staff. Convenient location for train access etc. We were offered a room upgrade on checking in, a Tower view room for 2000 Yen per night, which we took. So glad we did as we were treated to fabulous views of Mount Fuji on most of our 7 night stay. Lots of photos, sunrise, sunset and everything inbetween! The complimentary tea and coffee provided in the room were surprisingly good, although not too keen on powdered milk to go with it. Lots of good quality toiletries and other useful items in the bathroom, even a spare hairbrush! One criticism we would have is that the hotel bar is not a non-smoking area, something we did not realise until we were settled at the window with our drinks and a gentleman arrived and lit up a particularly strong smelling cigarette. Haven't downed a glass of wine so fast before! For the rest of our stay we bought a very reasonably priced bottle of wine from the convenience store in the basement each eveving and enjoyed it in our room, looking at the view. We had booked a room only deal so did not try the breakfast, however, there is a wonderful bakery down in the underground station walkway complex where we got fresh pastries and good coffee each morning, served by lovely, friendly ladies. On our last morning, laden with our suitcases and heading for the train to the airport we stopped by for our final breakfast. The serving lady popped out and came up to us as we were looking at the shelves and said that she recognised us from previous mornings and apologised that they did not have the pastries she had noticed that we usually took. We were very impressed with the service and quality of the food and coffee and would recommend it to anyone else (Bakery Kobeya, next to the ticket gates to the Asakua line entrance). Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Park Hotel and wouls definitely recommend it to anyone else.

Just a few minutes walk on a raised footbridge from Shimbashi station, and round the corner from both Ginza and Tsukiji, this hotel is in the perfect location for seeing almost all the sights in Tokyo. Shimbashi takes you to Shibuya, Shinjuku, Harajuku, Akihabara, Ueno (and on to the airport) - basically everywhere - within about 20 minutes. The hotel itself is surprisingly nice for the price. Rooms aren't ridiculously small as in some other hotels, there's no horrible smoke smell, while the lobby is bright and airy. You can even see Fuji and the Tokyo Tower through the window while you're checking in. And all this for a very reasonable price.Would definitely stay here again. It's not a particularly special or memorable place to stay, but it is the ideal spot to base yourself while you go exploring.

This hotel is located in Shiodome, which is a large new development near Shinbashi Station. The location is conveniently near JR Shinbashi, Yurikamome, Subsway Oedo-line, Subway Ginza Line, Subway Asakusa-line, but you need to get to know where are these stations are. The hotel is not luxury but very pleasant and reasonable price. The hotel people are very nice and we had good service. The hotel is in the walking distance from Ginza shopping area.

The Park Hotel boasts a very positive double whammy. (1) an uber-convenient location, very near the JR Yamanote Circular Line (Shimbashi Station) and several Tokyo Metro lines, Ginza & Asakusa lines (Shimbashi Station), Oedo line (Shidome Station). (2) simply THE best views in Tokyo; pay the little bit extra for a "Tokyo Tower View" room ... you will be blown away by the stunning views of both the Tokyo Tower and majestic Mt. Fuji.The rooms are spotlessly clean, uber-modern, eminently functional, ethereally quiet. The breakfast in the stunning atrium lobby area is sumptuous. The staff are the best combo of utter professionalism with genuine friendliness.All of this is yours for a very reasonable price in one of the world's most expensive cities. ENJOY!

Tokyo is chock full of high rise office buildings. The Japanese very cleverly use some of these buildings for hotels and restaurants by employing the top floors and thus boasting wonderful views of Tokyo. The Park Hotel is one of the better attempts to apply this strategy. The lobby is on the 25th floor with rooms located on floors 26-34. Views are terrific with either Tokyo Tower or Mt. Fuji (on a very clear day) visible according to the room's location. The rooms themselves are comfortable and sufficiently roomy (though placed within the context of Tokyo). In the same way that one doesn't expect large hotel rooms in London and New York, only the overly optimistic or wealthy expect expansive rooms in Tokyo.Cleanliness and service is quite high as is expected at a Japanese hotel. Most of the staff seems to have either fairly good or even excellent English and will go out of their way to assist. The area in which the hotel is situated is sort of curious. As Gertrude Stein said of Oakland California, 'There is no there, there." Meaning that you will not want to spend too much time in the immediate area although there are numerous restaurants ranging in price within a five minute walk so there is no necessity to travel. However both Ginza and the fish market are short walks away from the hotel. Another short walk will take you to Hama-rikyu Gardens which are well worth exploring. Moreover, the hotel are within short walks of a number of train and subway lines making the hotel an ideal starting point to explore Tokyo.From either airport the hotel can be reached directly by limousine bus. If you arrive or have to depart at times when the buses are not running the hotel is fairly easy to reach via the trains running from both airports. However some care needs to be taken when one arrives at the hotel's vicinity. The area is served by a maze of overpasses and subterranean routes. It is easy to become confused when traveling these routes with sign posting less than obvious. Be sure to get explicit directions from the hotel's website.I simply got a particularly good deal on my hotel room With value for money I was not expecting to be disappointed. But those expectations were more than met. This is definitely a hotel worth considering for any planned trip to Tokyo.

We stayed here for 3 nights.This hotel is located among JR Line Shimbashi station, Yurikamome Line Shiodome station, and Oedo Line Shiodome Station.Check in was quick, staffs were friendly and helpful.Room was clean, quiet, and the size was OK for two of us.Beds were comfortable. Bathroom was also clean and the amenities were great. Plenty of cafes and restaurant nearby. Convenience store is on the basement of the building which connecting to the Oedo subway line. Would love to stay here again.

My husband and I loved our 5 day stay at this hotel in Tokyo. We stayed in a king room on the Tokyo Tower side which has amazing views of Tokyo Tower and, on a clear day, Mt. Fuji. The room was comfortable and nicely kept. The pillows were a bit small, but not a big deal. The whole design of the hotel is very pleasant and clean.The best part about this hotel for us was it's central location with easy metro and train access. While the neighborhood itself is not that exciting, you can easily walk to Ginza and also the Fish Market. The Oedo Metro Line is located very conveniently near the hotel (you don't even have to leave the building to access it), and it's a quick walk over to the Ginza Line. There's a JR train stop also very close. Since the hotel is very central, going in any direction was quick and easy. We didn't have breakfast included in our room and it was rather expensive to eat it at the hotel. Luckily, there are numerous cafes close by (including Starbucks) which are easy for breakfast or a quick lunch.If we go to Tokyo again, I could see us booking this hotel again.
user_location: New York, New York, United States

review_body: My family and I shared a room on the 27th floor for 2 nights. The views of the city was amazing and we had a direct view of the elusive Fujisan.Although the room was small for 4 people it was adequate and the bathroom was spacious enough with a full sized bath, and basin etc. location was perfect for transfers to Haneda airport and handy to fish markets at Tsukuji and shopping area of Odaiba. We would stay there again.

Great views-Tokyo Tower & mount Fuji. Rooms are modern, clean and hotel is well priced for Tokyo. Using their website to book can be cheaper. May not be easy to find first time but is really hood location if you can work it out. I flew in to Narita and was leaving 24hrs later from Haneda. Both airports are accessible by rail from stations near this hotel. Very helpful staff. Beds comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel.

My family stayed here after our snowboarding trip for 2 nights and it was great. Good access to trains and subway and shops at Ginza. Service from staff about attractions like the Ninja restaurant and gardens etc was great.

Very happy with my stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo. Ultramodern, great beds, nice bathroom, very nice restaurant, super polite staff (as usual in Japan). Convenient location for airport limousine bus. Train station close.

This hotel is on the top 14 floors of the Shinkuku Park tower so you need a good head for heights. However the views over Tokyo are spectacular and on a clear day you can see Mount Fuji. Very convenient for subway, local sightseeing and entertainment.

Great views from hotel, spacious room, clean and comfortable. Great staff. Close to Tsukiji market, a Ginza and other shopping; however, lots of construction going on in the area so best to take cab or subway versus walking on street. Underground subway has lots of shops along the way to trains. There are local trains and express trains so be aware we caught the express by mistake.

Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in the first week of January. Excellent location in Shiodome (20-25 mins from Shibuya Crossing on the JR line) and a 10-15min walk to the heart of Ginza. I found the hotel to be located in a less cluttered part of Tokyo with everything within easy reach on the metro and on foot. Staff are extremely friendly and provided me with fantastic tips for my first visit to Tokyo. The room was not large by normal measures, however, the room was clean, efficient and for some one who only used the room to sleep it was more than enough.

This hotel is situated right above a transit hub, so it's convenient if you'll be using the subway: there's even an elevator that takes you directly from the lobby to the metro station level. It's a big station, though, or a group of stations joined by a mall, and can be confusing and disorienting at first.The farthest one is the Shimbashi station of the Yamanote Line, and that would be a long way, maybe a 10-12 minutes brisk walk from the lobby until you're boarding the train, so if you're planning to use the Yamanote Line extensively, maybe this hotel is a bit far away. And at night (after 10, maybe?) some underground doors are closed, so you must exit to the street in order to reach the hotel, and that would be some 15 minutes from the train platform to the hotel lobby.The hotel is nice and new, located in the higher floors of a building, with great Tokyo views. The staff is polite and friendly, although a bit cumbersome sometimes, specially when English is involved, and that can be tricky sometimes. They let us do an early check in with no trouble and with the most courteous manners.The room was a bit on the small side but cozy and comfortable. The bathroom was small but manageable.This is a smart hotel, makes you feel at ease, where you can rest and enjoy Tokyo. Maybe a bit expensive.Breakfast is served in a large airy space, and it's good and not overpriced.

Excellent location, great view from the window. A huge number of restaurants and cafes. The proximity of Ginza, the fish market Tsukidzhi. Several metro stations and line Yamamoto allow quick access to any part of Tokyo. These are the main advantages of the hotel.

The Park Hotel is well located for access from the airports (Keisei's SkyAccess train from Narita goes direct to Shimbashi station which is just five minutes' walk away, and the monorail to Haneda is one stop on the subway or five minutes in a taxi) and is within a short walk of the Ginza area. If was also handy for my business meetings which were close by.I stayed in the dragon and lady themed room which made it a more individual experience. The room was a good size for Tokyo and the price was reasonable. Waking up on a clear morning, I had a fantastic view of Mount Fuji. Two small niggles. There's no power socket at the desk so I had to trail a wire around. And the English tea served at breakfast was too weak to be drinkable. But that didn't detract from a good stay and from the overall excellent service.

We stayed in a triple room with 2 adults and two small children (4 and 6). The room was spacious for a city hotel and we had a stunning view on the harbour and the Skytree. Breakfast buffet is really good and our kids were free. Reception was extremly friendly and helpful with any kind of question (airport transfer, metro, etc). Ask them for restaurants nearby - there are plenty. We would definitly go there again.

Great Hotel, friendly helpful staff, great location at the end of the Ginza. Rooms pleasant with great views. Beautiful Bar with Views of Tokyo. The view behind the reception at sunset is worth a look, amazing views of Mount Fuji.

We stayed for 2 nights and found the hotel to be comfortable, efficient and with charming staff. Located from the 25th floor up, there are fantastic views to be had over the city with Mount Fuji in the distance. Situated over a subway station it's well placed for getting around the city on the metro system. There's also a good selection of shops, bars and restaurants in the area.

Loved the location as subway is so easy to access. Elevator to 25th floor for reception. We had amazing views of Mt Fuji from here. Our room overlooked the beautiful harbour and gardens and facilities were excellent. You do not need to take anything as all is provided. If you need to buy anything though, take elevator down to B1 to convenience store - great prices! Breakfast is well organised and something for all tastes. Highly recommend.

i would definitely recommend this hotel for it's perfect location, wonderful views over the city and great service. overview of advantages:-location: shimbashi metro station is right below the hotel-friendly and helpfull staff-good value for money-incredible views-clean and comfortable rooms-laundry room (we stayed over a week and really apreciated this facility)after this great experience we stayed in other park hotels all over japan and were really enthousiastic about it.

This is our second visit to Tokyo and our first stay at this hotel. Great Hotel with friendly, and very "willing to help" english speaking STAFF, clean and comfortable rooms, great position, and great views from your room. This hotel is very conveniently located with the subway downstairs as a hub to sight see around Tokyo. Highly recommended!!!!!!

This cool hotel is about a 5 minute walk from Shiodome station. It is atop of a business building; starting on the 25th floor. Once on the 25th floor, you can access other elevators to reach the room floors. The staff is really friendly and knowledgable. They have great service. The rooms are western style, so you do get an actual bed, and a fancy toilet with all the buttons. Clean it not a word I would use, its more like "super clean". They do offer buffet brunches that I did not get to try, but looked amazing. The pricing is quite decent. My Room was on the 26th floor, very quiet, and very nice views of the city. Since we are very high up, depending on the weather, you might be in the clouds,

This is a great hotel with views in all directions (unfortunately we didn't get fuji views). The area outside is a buisness area and very clean and away from sleeze. Good if you are traveling with young children. Japanese restaurant in hotel is great but very expensive. Food outside can be hard to find at night if you had kids unless you like udon/soba soup as most other restaurants allow smoking.

Stayed here for nearly a week in Jan 15. Very impressed with the hotel.Why? Firstly, convenienceIt is connected to the Shiodome and Shinbashi stations via a subway - these stations serve several lines (4?) so are a great hub for travel.If coming from Haneda, I suggest you catch the monorail to Hamamatsucho Station then a taxi to the hotel. It should only cost 730 yen but will save the hassle of dragging luggage around while looking for directions.Also, there is a family mart convenience store in the basement of the hotel plus a 3 storey restaurant shopping centre right outside in the subway.Also, it's within walking distance to Ginza's shops and restaurants.Secondly, the rooms were spacious and very nice. Stayed in a room with a Tokyo tower view and highly recommend it. Saw the snow capped Mt Fuji every morning in the distance.Other commentsThere's a coin laundry in the hotel for those who need to do some bulk washing plus the usual hotel laundry service.Overall very happy with our stay at the hotel and would highly recommend it to others and will stay here when we next return to Tokyo.
I stayed in the artist room and it was a great experience. This hotel makes me impressed with various sense of art and beauty.Very modern, clean and pleasant!

We were staying in the sisterHotel of the Park (Shibu Park, which was also very good), but had to move for our last night in Tokyo because the Shibu Park was full. We had no idea what to expect, so we were completely blown away by this hotel. Reception is on the 25th floor, our room was a corner room on the 28th. The views? Wow! The room was very large by Tokyo standards, the staff delightful. We didn't eat here, but the restaurants & bars looked impressive.Next time I'm inTokyo (& we'll be back), we'll stay here.

My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights just before christmas. We had a corner room (tower side) on the 33rd floor which had spectacular views across tokyo. The hotel itself is in a very good location, out of the way enough to avoid the hussle and bussle but within walking distance and excellent commuting distance to all the nearby attractions. From Narita airport it was a train ride in to Tokyo station then we hopped in a cab and they took us to the hotel for around 1900 yen which is about £10. Way worth it if you've had a long flight and dont want to work the subway out straight away. Take the elevator down to the basement floors and it takes you in to Shiodome station, this station is smaller and has access on the Oedo line. Just 3-5 minutes walk which is literally just following the signs underground is Shimbashi station which serves wherever you will want to go. Rail fares are very cheap and have english speaking options, easiest thing to do though is google map where you want to go using the hotels free wi-fi and it will tell you what station and what line and the price as well.The hotel itself is very good, always clean and tidy and the room was a very good size for tokyo. Breakfast was quite good, just a typical continental style. Small choice of western foods but you're in tokyo. Overall this hotel was excellent as a base for sightseeing, the staff were attentive and polite and Id recommend signing up for the parks membership before you (its free)

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights+1 night (went to Kyoto in between). Although many of the staff are not fluent in English, they are all very friendly and helpful. Make sure to get a room with the tower view. The view is breathtaking. If weather permits, you can also see Mt. Fuji behind the tower. However, we are not lucky enough to see this. The location is very convenient, within walking distance to Ginza. There are also many food choice around. And one more thing: make sure to apply for their membership on their official website before you go. It's free and it will give you small goodies or free room upgrades depending on the number of nights you stay with them.

I spent a week in Tokyo and happy to have selected this hotel. The hotel is well located within a business (towers) area, so there is restaurants and some shops in the bottom of the towers. Also the Shiodome have additional small shops. The hotel is within 2 minutes of subway and train stations. I used the JR Yamanote that is making a circle connecting the major quarters in Tokyo. Using a day pass (approx 8 dollars) to can reach key location easy without complications. Also this one is also in English so easier to understand with limited Japanese skills. Taxis are ok for the airport (Haneda) but a bit expensive, I think it's simple for arrival and departure but that's it, the train is excellent, I really liked the Yamanote. The personnel was very nice on my arrival on 15 December especially after a 13hrs flight from Canada. I had a corner room on the 29 floor and had a very nice view of the Sky three and building area with lights at night. The room was very spacious even in North American standards. Nice bed and everything very clean. The wireless internet was fast and TV had typical Japanese channels, interesting to look at a bit. The breakfast was too expensive for my taste and after one day I decided to buy some items at the 7eleven below the hotel and eat close to the main shops around train stations. There is also a little bakery at the bottom of the hotel but close on weekends. You are in walking distance to the Fish market, Tokyo tower, Ginza stores and a Zojoji temple. If you want to shop, I liked the Shimbashi, Yurakucha (close to Ginza and have movie theatre in case of a rainy day, subtitled. ) and the Akihabara. Shibuya could be nice, but not on weekend and evening as it's very crowded. Historic locations are a must; especially the Imperial Palace and different temples.

Corner King Room with Tokyo Tower View was very nice. As soon as we got to our room, we saw that we had a great view of the Tokyo Tower. The only thing I didn't care for was the pillows. We had a king bed but the pillows were flat. The staff was ver nice and polite, helped us manage the subways getting us to Disney and different districts. The hotel is located in the business district of Ginza, not the busy nightlife part of Tokyo but very easy to find the subway and be in a different district in a few minutes. Overall great stay. Great breakfast buffet in the morning even though it costs $20.

We stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo for two nights over Christmas 2014 and had a wonderful stay on the 34th floor. The rooms were clean and very functional. The hotel is conveniently located near the transit lines and everything was connected via the 3rd floor walkway or the underground walkways - so there is not need to be walking on the surface streets (unless you want to). My only concern is that the elevator lobby on the 34th floor had a very strong cigarette smoke smell.

Clean, nice rooms. Helpful staff. Beautiful view of Tokyo Tower and Mt. Fuji from lobby. Walkable to Tsukiji Fish Market and short taxi ride from Haneda. I would definitely stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo again.

We were blown away when we entered the gorgeous, chic, hotel with incredible views from the lobby. As it was our first time staying at this hotel and I inquired about the 'Artists' rooms, they graciously offered us a free upgrade to the "Dragon Room". (Thank you for this!!) The room was beautiful and it was really cool to watch a video of the artist explaining the meaning behind the murals. The room in general was modern, clean and comfortable and the art just made it all the more special. The views from our room, and I believe all of the rooms in this hotel, were stunning. We had a view of the entire city and were told that when the weather is right, you can even view Mt. Fuji. The staff at this hotel was very friendly, professional and helpful. We also loved that we were just steps away from an exciting area with so many stores and that the train station was literally right there. Definitely recommend!

Nothing but good things to say about this hotel -- staff is nice and helpful, rooms are clean (albeit small) and pricing is very good. All in all a good value for a nice clean hotel close to transportation. The hotel is located in Shiodome, which is a fairly new area that has been built up recently with lots of large office buildings and hotels. It is walking distance to Ginza and close to several types of transportation (JR Line, Metro, etc.) so getting where you need to go is very easy. Stayed here a number of times and would not hesitate to go back. The only reason we stay elsewhere is when we feel like splurging and staying at the Penninsula.

i stayed here twice in 4 weeks, I would have given it a 5* rating but both times I couldn't manage to get a city view with Tokyo tower. Great view of Mount Fuji on a clear day. If not the lobby has a perfect city view. I had a view of hamarikyu in my second stay which was nice. Like most hotels in Japan the rooms were a tad small but very comfortable, nice bathroom and lots of amenities, breakfast was nice, the lounge area is very nice and the staff all speak good English and are very helpful. They sorted out my transfer back to the airport very easily. I went on my own so I don't think it was necessary for me to stay here but I had a very pleasant time here and there were no faults at all. I checked in two hours early both times and they still got me into my rooms early, which was great.

I stayed Deluxe room at 30rd floor. I like this hotel because of few reasons:- Location: With convenient location for my work, I walked some minutes to take the train to meet partners. Nice view – splendid landscape. From the bed I saw whole Tokyo city at good height.- Decoration: Japanese traditional style from color, lamps, pyjamas, Yukatas as well as slippers. They were very lovely- Luxury bathroom: It was a place for me to be refresh and relaxed- Restaurant: It is opened space with many different areas (public area: coffee, enjoy meals, ; private area: parties, meeting, …) From here I also both enjoyed my breakfast, have overview of busy city through glass window and felt wonderful mornings at this sunrise country.

Similar to other reviewers, we wanted a hotel location that was easily accessible but not right in the busy areas. The Park Hotel is in an excellent location right above the Shiodome subway station and minutes walk away from Shimbashi rail station. Took a taxi ride to Tokyo Station with our luggage for Y1000 which is about $10 CAD.Staff were attentive with a good grasp of English and more than happy to assist. We sent off our luggage to our hotel in Kyoto and the Park Hotel staff made it an easy and seamless experience. Check-in and check-out was a breeze (maybe I just missed the rush) but do expect the process to take a little longer than what we're used to in North America.The room itself was large in size by Japan standard and small to average by North American standard. We opted for the Premier king (two twins joined together) with a wonderful view of the Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji in the morning. It was quite something waking up to the view of both in bed. Only downsides were the somewhat dirty carpet and the room had the smallest hint of cigarette smoke but not noticable after the first night.With so many places to explore in Tokyo, we didn't utilize any of the restaurants or lounges. For breakfast, we saved some money by heading down to the convenience store (Family Mart) at the basement level and picked up some food there instead. With Tsukiji being so close, you can also just head over there in the morning and pick up some food.All-in-all a wonderful stay at the Park Hotel and will likely return in the future.

Park Hotel had a cool feel and lovely artwork, as well as an amazing visual display going up the whole inner atrium. The concierge was incredibly helpful (especially Shimose!!! She was great!)-- I emailed them several time with random and specific questions that they were quick to reply to in full detail with relevant links. They also helped up figure out our 3 days in Tokyo-- sitting down with us to work out the whole itinerary in detail, including how to get from one place to the other by public transport and which exits to get out at (extremely important in Tokyo) and maps with directions and highlights.The views from the lobby is amazing-- able to see Mt. Fuji on a clear day. Even on the opposite side of the hotel (where our room was) had nice views of the city.The room was pretty spacious, especially considering Tokyo standards and the bed was really comfortable.Though it is not in the areas that people often say to stay in (like Shinjuku), we found it to be a very good location and easy to get to all areas of the city. The only issue is getting to the hotel lobby from the Shimbashi station if you don't know where you are going (there is a long underground passageway). It is easier for the first time to come from Shiodome, but Shimbashi has more connections. Walkable to the fish market and Ginza and Ichiran Ramen (was amazing) is outside of the Shimbashi station too.

We want a hotel that can be reached by either train or bus and not in the middle of shopping area like Shibuya or Shinjuku. And based on the reviews from Tripadvisor, we booked this hotel and requested a Tokyo tower view room. We had high expectation but came out even better than we expected. The hotel is located in the Shiodome where it is a complex of offices. It can be quiet in the evening but It is super convenient. Once you got your direction down, you can reach a lot of places through either underground or overpass. For instance, going to the fish market is just 10 minutes walk and subways to other cities in Tokyo is also 10 minutes. There are many restaurants and fast food within a few minutes of walking as well as other convenient stores. At the end of the day when you come back from a day of hectic sightseeing or shopping in Tokyo, this is like a quiet oasis of relaxation. Service staff speaks excellent English and very attentive. The attention they gave you makes you think you are the only guest in the hotel. The service level is comparable to any of the five stars hotels we've seen anywhere around the world. The condition of the hotel and rooms are spotless and modern. The design and architecture is simply awesome. Finally the view of the Tokyo Tower from our room. Make sure you have your camera. I took tons of pictures, day and night. Got my money's worth :). Highly recommended and we will be back.

We stayed here as a family for 2 nights. Rooms were (just) slightly bigger than usual hotels. We got to see Mt Fuji from our rooms. It is directly above the Tokyo metro and near the Tsukiji market (1 train stop away). Few amenities within the immediate vicinity esp at night but I was told Ginza within walking distance (we didn't try). Staff was so-so. Overall pleasant experience.

I was travelling for both business and pleasure, and found the hotel location OK for business - its a decent walk to Shimbashi Station and shorter one to Shiodome - but as a tourist it would have been more convenient to be closer to Shibuya. I found the service to be underwhelming, having to wait for long periods for service when they were busy at the front desk as there was usually only 2-3 staff members. Breakfast is not great, very small selection so not worth the price, even with a discount voucher. Don't rely on the gym facilities, as this only caters to 2 people at a time so you have to book in advance. All in all this hotel is underwhelming for the price (although Japan is obviously not cheap), but rooms, cleanliness and condition of the hotel are good.

We only stayed here on our final night in Tokyo. We had the view of the Tokyo Tower, and it was so beautiful that I'm glad we only stayed here one night, because we may not have ever left the room otherwise! The service was great, room was large for Japan and had all the western conveniences. Beautiful hotel.

Rooms were tiny, but this is Tokyo. Were promised King sized rooms and when we arrived there were none available so started off a bit disappointed. But the breakfast was nice, ambience was lovely. Almost like not staying at your regular hotel made for a really nice change, and although the rooms were tiny it appeared good value for money.

The excellent concierge at the Inter Continental booked us in at the Park for dinner.... you soar way up into the clouds with the most splendid views of the city lit up at night...The service was very good...the wine list was excellent... although one or two of the best wines had sold out...sadly!The Japanese food was delicious and a fitting end to our last night in Tokyo.The beef was some of the best we have tasted.... not being great meat eaters it was a change and a treat after all the sashimi... of which there was plenty too... the tasting menu was delicious....The meal was excellent value.A memorable end to a very memorable holiday.

We stayed at the Park Hotel for a mini vacation during the US holiday of Thanksgiving. As a global traveler, I want to say that this location is very good. It is literally a hop away to the subway system via underground mall. The hotel is nice and the staff were helpful. The concierge was not very friendly but gave good advice. Breakfast was not good so skip it. The remainder of the staff were ok. I would not say that the hotel added to our experience of visiting Tokyo but would stay again for the convenience and the reasonable price. They have a beautiful view of the Tokyo tower. Our room was facing the other direction but you can see it from the lobby.

I stayed at the Park Hotel for a couple days on a stop-over en-route to India. It was very reasonably priced an in a decent location. This hotel is close to the Shiodome and Shinbashi metro stations on the Yamanote Line which makes Sibuya and Ebisu and Shinjuku a subway ride away. All attractions will typically be a subway ride away, but the hotel is effectively connected to the Shiodome station. The Trsukiji fish market is walking distance from the hotel. The lobby was quite nice although there were not too many places to take advantage of the view. The room was typically small for Japan, and I had a room overlooking the station. This was my first time in Tokyo, so the concept of a hotel in the middle of a skyscraper is a bit new, but kinda cool and definitely common in Japan. The Shinbashi district is within walking distance, but that's not specifically a tourist area but you can get a good amount of cultural immersion along with the business-folk blowing off some steam after work. This is a business travellers hotel.

I am a location guy more than anything and this hotel was a pretty well located as a base in Tokyo. That's why I gave a 4 when everything else is a 5 here. Tokyo is so big that you kind of have to pick a spot to be based at. This is good location, walking distance to the Ginza shopping district and the fish market, and subway rides to everywhere else. The hotel is in the top floors of a business tower, and is located among other business buildings for the most part. But everything you need will be in the subway walkways if not above ground. You will walk a lot in this city, even for subways. Conveniently, this hotel is right above the Shiodome station, but it isn't a major station, so you will need to transfer when you venture out most days. The hotel itself seemed to be mostly business travelers with a good share of tourists. The staff is very polite and the service is excellent. There is a bar with city views and smoking, so you might get an occasional waft of it if that bothers you. I brought small children and we had no issues. The room was predictably small but comfortable and had a nice city view. They provided a crib too. It is modern and chic with a boutique-y feel in a high rise. Great experience in Tokyo.

I stayed here for a week in a city queen room and it was fantastic, the view over Tokyo was beautiful, and the staff were super friendly and willing to help in regards to tours or airport transports. The bed was super comfortable and the daily room turndown was an unexpected and pleasant surprise! P.S. I was supplied with not just the usual shampoo and condition but also body wash, hair brush, tooth brush, toothpaste and every other toiletry you can think of! They constantly went the extra mile and I can't wait to return!

We spent 4 nights in Tokyo at the beginning of our 2 week trip around Japan. The Park Hotel Tokyo is well located, close to Ginza by foot and various train stations allowing to get around Tokyo easily.The rooms are of a decent size for Tokyo, the bed was very big by European standards. The breakfast was good, with both Japanese and Western style food. The choice of food though could be better and does not vary much.This hotel is a very good choice for the price.

I highly recommend the Park Hotel, Tokyo. We stayed in a double room which was wonderfully comfortable, a large bed, a nice little bathroom and it also has free WiFi, which was excellent for downloading maps, planning routes and keeping in touch with home. The room was made up every day so when we got back from adventuring we could relax. We didn't have a tower view room but that was no worry as our room faced east so we got an excellent view of the rising sun in the morning. Our room also had a good view of the Hamarikyu garden which was beautiful. The hotel is in the centre of Shidome and is served by Shiodome station and Shimbashi station which makes getting anywhere super easy. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to visit nearby and for fans of Studio Ghibli Howl's clock can be found close by, it is well worth checking out!All staff members are kind and courteous and can't do enough to help you. The hotel is in a very beautiful building and starts on the 25th floor so you can be safe in the knowledge that you will get good views. It is also full of artworks. An amazing hotel and excellent value for money!

The Park hotel Tokyo is a great place to stay while a short sightseeing trip. It's an hotel with a modern and stylish design. The room quite big enough for 2 persons, the bathroom nice and clean . Great location, very friendly staff.

This hotel is really very nice and central to almost every tourist spot... the staff is really very helpfull and courteous ....I would definately stay in this hotel again next time when i visit tokyo...

Room with a view!The hotel is located on the 25th floor of the shiodome media tower. Exiting the lift you enter a stunning atrium space. Nothing but good first impressions, although check in was very busy I was offered a seat and managed to check in within 5 minutes. Staff very polite and helpful. The roomAmazing view from the room even though it was on the side facing away from mt Fuji. Very clean with a really comfortable bed. Powerful shower and a high tech Japanese toilet! Was a really nice space to come to after a days sightseeing and I loved opening up the curtains in the morning for the view. Breakfast was buffet style and was decent with good filter coffee and the usual bacon, scrambled eggs etc. LocationTaking the lift down to subway level you are a 5 minute walk underground to Shinbashi station which has the Ginza line, Asakusa line and the overground JR lines with direct trains to narita airport via the narita line. To haneda airport you can walk from the hotel to Hamamatsucho station and get the monorail direct. Overall a great location for jumping on the train or metro and exploring the city.The area is mainly a business area but Shinbashi has tons of restaurants that cater for the salarymen. I had the best ramen ever at ichirin just outside the station. I would highly recommend this hotel, it seems that the hotel had 50/50 business and tourist travellers and it serves both well. Tokyo is an amazing city and this was a great hotel to stay in whilst here.

In the recent years I have been several times in this hotel, it is nicely located and starts at the 25th floor. In Nov 2014 I have been there again and it is a lovely hotel. The staff is extremely friendly, the rooms are not big but for Tokyo ok, the bed is fantastic and so is the shower. Breakfast is nice with western and Japanese choices. It is easy to walk to Ginza (any shop you can imagine) or to Shimbashi station (more traditional shops, electronics, small pubs and restaurants), all very close. There is a direct bus connection to Narita airport (Airport Limousine bus). Next time I will be back.

We started our Tokyo trip at Park Hotel and then moved to another neighborhood on second half of the trip. And Park hotel is a great hotel to know the city. It is next to two train stations. Walking distance to Ginza. Rooms are not big but big enough for Tokyo standards and the price you pay. the staff is very friendly. While we were there there was even a hip party at the lobby are - and no you don't hear the music from your room so relax:) - plus you are on vacation, loosen up a little and enjoy and meet locals. I am so happy that we stayed here and would highly recommended. - note if you are looking for a hotel that is in the heart of nightlife etc. then consider Shibjuku or Shibuya areas - but remember Tokyo is a mega city and each areas are itself very big. so decide what kind of stay you want and book very specific hotel that is close to train systems - there are many different train systems and they all work separately and you need them all to see the whole city- so pick the location of the hotel carefully and Park Hotel is located in a very strategic place that you can reach different part of the city.

Stayed here for our last night for holiday in Japan. Had booked the queen room but upgraded to King Corner with view of Tokyo Tower for 4000Y more and was a good choice. Had awesome view of city skyline including mount Fuji on the clear afternoon. Nighttime the Tokyo Tower lit up was amazing. Would be very suitable room for honeymoon or romantic getaway. Location was good if you were looking to make the most of the stay as had access to large shops and department stores in Ginza as well as plenty of resteraunts. Train to airport was also very easy from this location and initially the main reason we booked.Although not the cheapest hotel I would def say you get what you pay for.

The Park Hotel know what they're doing. Everything worked, the rooms were clean and well-maintained, the atrium and lobby area are amazing - a huge, high ceiling gives a real sense of space. The reception staff were courteous and knowledgeable.The restaurants (choice of Japanese, French cuisine, or bar meals) were all quite pricey, but fairly typical for a restaurant in a hotel. There is a whole row of independent restaurants just outside the hotel if you walk through the Shiodome metro station and into the shopping centre beyond it.About 7 minutes walk (along overhead passageways) to Shimbashi station on the Yamamote line, Tokyo's "circle line" (for Londoners).The only minor niggle, if I had to find one, was that the western breakfast things were sometimes lukewarm... tepid bacon and slightly warm scrambled egg.... Mmmmmmm!But that didn't detract from an excellent stay.

I have stayed at the Park Hotel approximately 10 times, for both business and pleasure. It is not quite a 5-star hotel, but it is still an excellent facility, conveniently located, and fairly priced. I also have found the staff to be helpful (with reasonably good English skills - always appreciated, since my Japanese is limited). From my most recent stay earlier this month, I note that Momo of the bell staff was especially helpful, both for arranging takuhaibin (luggage transfer) services and providing advice about a later travel stop at Tokyo Disneyland. I certainly expect to return.

As by pervious reviewer, hotel at Shiodome with JR and metro within walking distance. Exploring Tokyo is not an issue. Even going to Shisui premium outlet, just drop to Daimon metro station and take the express bus (bus lane 1), about 60-80mins. Walking distance to Tsukiji market. Hotel service was excellent initially, during just check in. The service counter notice that we are couple, so change room from 2 single bed to double bed (well done). 3 nights later while check out, notice that we are going to Hakone, provided us with all necessary information and recommended to take the 2 days pass(well done). But 1 day later, after our trip at Hokane, we re-check in the hotel (which we did informed them during the first check out that we will be back) , but during the re-check in we were given 2 single bed. A bit disappointed, but we did not pursue as this is a small issue. Overall, I very impressive hotel and I will return again.

The Park Hotel Tokyo is located in Shiodome, which is a newer area of Tokyo adjacent to Ginza and Tokyo Station. The area itself is very clean and modern, albeit a little sterile – it doesn’t have any traditional Japanese elements at all. However, the location is very good, with access to the subway, monorail and train. Personally, I’m willing to give up being in the middle of a traditional Japanese neighborhood for the convenience, etc.The hotel is near the Royal Park Hotel – do not confuse the two! As is the case with most large hotels in Tokyo, the Park Hotel is on the upper floors of an office building. The lobby is reasonably big and contains a restaurant/lounge. Check-in was smooth.My room was small, as is the case in many hotels in Japan. Furnishings were modern, and bathroom amenities were generous and varied. The room showed a few signs of wear and tear but nothing substantial. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I was very happy to spend time in the room and get work done.One of the best parts of this hotel is the Thann Spa. I didn’t get a chance to get a massage or facial, but they stock Thann products, which I was happy to purchase! (I didn’t have time to go to the Thann stores in Roppongi and Omotesando.)I was able to book this hotel at a discount (I can’t remember why/where). Provided that I can find that discount again, I’ll definitely stay there again!

This hotel is located in a large office building near the Shimbashi Train Station. You take the elevator up to the 24 th floor where you check in. The hotel staff spoke very good English and were very helpful. I found the rooms well furnished and comfortable. The service in the bar was outstanding. I liked that there were several restaurants in the hotel that served decent food. I would stay here ago. I liked the close proximity to the train station. I was unable to use the train to go to my destination without any trouble.

The hotel is located above the Shimbashi Train Station that is a short 5 minute walk through an underground passageway. The staff is very professional and most of them speak respectable English. The rooms are clean and quiet. Thank you for chopsticks Ms. Simose. We will definitely stay here again.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this beautiful hotel, the room was very comfortable, with a great view of the city and nearby park. The breakfast buffet was delicious, with a wide variety of hot and cold foods.Best of all were the very courteous, helpful hotel staff, they made our stay a very happy experience, thank you!

I wasn't sure what to expect from the Park Hotel since it was a lot less expensive than some of the other hotels my travel agent recommended. I was very pleased!First, note that it's in a high rise office building. You enter on the first floor and take the elevator to the 25th floor to reception. The staff are very, very friendly and accommodating (as you might expect in Japan), and offer complimentary sake or green tea upon arrival.The rooms are very clean, a good size, and well appointed, with free, fast wifi, coffee, tea, and a small mini-bar.(Respectable) massage is available in the evenings in your room for reasonable rates.
