A bit dissapointed on arrival when after having travelled for the past 20 hours we were told we couldn't have the room for another4 hours.The room was kept very clean and we never saw the cleaning staff all week so thank you to them. Staff were all very polite and helpfull. The buffet breakfast was very basic not a lot to choose from but o.k. for us. Handy to all the rail lines and shopping and would certainly stay here again if we return to Tokyo.

Great location ... a couple blocks to Shimbashi train station, and a subway station right outside the door! The hotel staff are all very, very helpful, and speak really good English. There's a small business center with free internet. Elevators are quick. We upgraded to a corner King with city view, which was a great choice .... the floor to ceiling windows gave us a panoramic view of Tokyo, which was ever changing day or night. Better than watching TV! We only partook in the hotel breakfast once. We found it a little overpriced for what was offered. There were plenty of dining options right outside the hotel doors. Great little bar, nice restaurant. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed at the Park Hotel for 11 days in May. First of all, I have to say that we were blown away by Japanese customer service. Everyone there was showed a level of kindness and professionalism that I rarely see in American hotels. With that said, here are the pros and cons:PROS:-Great view. We paid for the Tokyo Tower view and it didn't disappoint. It was a great way to wake up in the morning, and a fantastic thing to see before going to bed.-Easy access to the Tokyo subway. It's right off the Oedo line at the Shiodome station and a block or two from Shimbashi station, so it was easy to navigate the city from one of those stops.-Convenient to the Tsukiji fish market and Hamarikyu Gardens. The gardens were a nice break, especially when the Tokyo humidity got to be too much.-Nice breakfast. With the hotel discount, the breakfast came to 22 yen/person. A nice mix of western breakfast items (scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage, croissants) with traditional Japanese food like miso soup, noodles and fish.CONS:-No English language TV. They had CNN and the BBC, but both stations were dubbed in Japanese. It would have been nice to have at least one station in English.-A little too far away from Shinjuku and Shibuya. The Tokyo subway system basically shuts down at 12:30 am, so if you're planning a late dinner, and want to check out some Tokyo nightlife, then you'll have to cab it back to the hotel. We did that a couple of times and from Shinjuku, a cab ride was about 50 yen. Also, even with the directions provided by the hotel, the cab drivers could never find the hotel. We were taken to the Park Hyatt at one point. -The hotel did have kind of a weird smell of smoke. We noticed it when we first arrived and didn't later on in the trip. Which makes me think we just got used to it.When we go back to Tokyo, we'll probably stay closer to the Shinjuku/Shibuya area. But this was a decent hotel for the price.

I stayed here for 4 days and found this hotel very close to my office and restaurants near by. This is actually above the metro station so connectivity is never the issue. Limousine buses come directly to hotel from Airport so its very convenient to commute. Service is good, rooms are clean. Only feedback for improvement would be to improve on amenities. Gym can be accessed only by 1 person at a time so its a hassle booking for a gym.

I stayed here for three nights in May. It didn't meet my hotel snobbery expectations, but the view is undeniable. We had a perfect view of Tokyo Tower. The hotel smelled faintly of cigarette smoke (you can smoke most everywhere in Tokyo, but most other establishments seem to ventilate the smell much better) and the rooms definitely needed a refresh. The carpets were dirty. It was kind of a pain to get to from the station. In general, it was fine--but the only reason to stay there was for the view.

The rooms are comfortable. The staff is GREAT. And the view of Mt. Fuji from the front desk the day we left? Spectacular.We didn't have the buffet, but people truly seemed to enjoy it. The location of this hotel is good--it's easy to get to many train lines from the tunnels on the lower levels or on the skywalks above ground. The restaurants in the area are good and you're two steps from Ginga. We found the restaurants near the Shimbasi station generally good. Enjoy.

this hotel on the top floors of the building.It had great beds and comforters,it was zen,modern,quiet,...just like japan...what great views and just a short walk to Ginza and the fish market. the shimabshi station is past the The TV studio and a convaluded walk make sure you know how to get back..peopel working in the shops underneath near the station dont know...big hassle just remember to go towards the new monorail ..heres a good maphttp://johomaps.com/as/japan/tokyo/metroatlas/shimbashi.html....

i stayed here for 1 night and it was ok, nothing special. the room was a little tired and could have done with a bit of paint and a new carpet as there were quite a few stains. the view was nice onto Tokyo bay.The hotel looks easy to get to from shimbasi station however its quite a walk up and down lots of stairs to get to it so its not as near as you might think.i would not stay here again as i have stayed in nicer hotels in tokyo which are nearer to stations and have better views.

it's a two minute walk from Shiodome underground and 5 minutes from Shimbashi Station (not too easy to find it with all the over walks crossing etc.) and 10 minutes from Ginza... so the location is good - the view is great as this hotel starts on the 25th floor ! The rooms are not too spacious but big enough for a couple of days. The bathroom amenities are from Thann but unfortunately the shower is in the bathtub with a curtain (which is not the best standard anymore) I haven't had the breakfast. The staff at the reception was extremely friendly and the concierge service extraordinary helpful and friendly. I will stay there again for my next Tokyo trip.

Tokyo Park Hotel is on the 25th floor of the Shiodome Media Bldg. The hotel and rooms are very nice and well maintained and the staff are friendly and courteous. It is right above both the Yurikamome train to Odaiba and the Shiodome Metro station. The Shiodome station has a straight route to Narita and is also one station away from Tsukiji Market. For the other Tokyo landmarks, best to walk to Shinbashi station(around 10mins). Ginza is also 10min walk away. Ear when you're fresh but a bit of a pain when you're already tired. Make sure to ask directions as it is best to walk underground and it can be a little confusing. I would give this hotel 5 stars if it was a little more convenient to get to.

This is a business hotel that is tourist friendly. Staff here speak English. The hotel is new with the lobby on the 25th floor of an office building. It is near subways and a JR station, although you have to walk through a somewhat confusing underground to get there. Our room had a great view of the Tokyo Tower and we were even able to see Mt. Fuji on a clear day. The breakfast buffet was both Japanese and Western and both were very good.

Stayed here two nights at early May during Japanese golden week with my wife and our two children. I selected this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and room price. This was one of the only places I could find which did not charge any extra when we had two children staying in standard room with us (4yrs and 1yr)! That was the selling point for me, room rate booked directly from hotel webpage was 19200 yen/night (first night was more expensive and second cheaper but this was average of two nights) standard room for 4 people with baby cot :)Breakfast was not included and we bought it separetly at the hotel. I remember the price was about 2500 jen/person, and our age children were free. Of course you can get much cheaper and same level breakfast from the street cafes if you want to save some money.Room was quite small which I guess is normal in Tokyo, enough for 4 people no problems. Very nice view from 32nd floor to the Tokyo Bay. Room had all the armenities one needs and beds were very good to sleep on at least in our taste. First time for me in Tokyo so I can not say much about the location but there are many subway and trains stations basically downstairs of the hotel and Ginza area 10 mins walk away so I say that the location is excellent. We came from Haneda airport and there is direct train from Haneda that comes to hotels undeground area in less than 30mins.I would definitely stay here again if I come back to Tokyo.

We got a standard room with a tokyo tower view. The room is big enough and met our expectations. It is in walking distance out hotel doors to 2 subways and the JR line. It is alittle difficult to work out the underground as even though it is signed well you may not know the areas referring. Walking distance to fish market and ginza area. Definitely a good spot and would recommend.

Good: amazing views, especially in the "art room" is stayed in. The room was painted by an artist and had an amazing dragon. The service is great. The bed was good. The bathroom good. The food was good. The location is great too, right next to Shimbashi station on the Yamanote line which allows for easy access to all of Tokyo.The not so good: relatively expensive, but everything in Tokyo is.Bad: nothing.

I stayed in Park hotel for 4 days with my family. We have enjoyed its convenient transportation whether to Shimbashi or Shiodome stations. It takes less than 10 mins and 1200 yen by taxi from Tokyo station. Room is very quiet and clean.

This hotel occupies floors 25-32 of a modern high rise, with an attractive central atrium running the full height of the hotel part. The staff all speak good English and were very friendly and eager to please. The facilities are top notch although the rooms were a little small - but no smaller than comparable hotels in New York or other expensive big cities. We were on a small group tour and all 24 of us thought the breakfast was exceptional - a very wide variety of both western and Japanese food.The view of the skyline from the 25th floor lobby was quite amazing, including the Tokyo Tower, which resembles the Eiffel Tower. Our room faced the other direction and the view was less spectacular, but still interesting. There are good transit connections and it is an easy walk of about 10 minutes to get to the Ginza area.

Services was excellent.Very friendly and helpful concierge.Thank You MR FUKUSHIMA for making my dream come true to watch Miyavi concert live at kafu.You did a superb jobs for getting and print out all the train schedule and information needed and send it to my room.

It was our seventh time in this hotel and we stayed at the hotel 10 nights .Very comfortable , clean , good service, very friendly staff. We hope in the future to come back to this hotel. *** breakfast menu throughout all stay was not changed

We stayed here for only 1 night (last leg of our trip). It is quite a metro ride away from the Shinjuku area (especially with heavy luggage). The Shiodome area is absolutely lovely and looks wonderful from the highrises. I loved the magnificent view of the city from the lobby, although I thought the smell of smoke was much too strong. Our room was a great size, the bathroom a little on the small side. The bed was somewhat comfortable, the pillows were great and the city view from our room fantastic! They assisted us in a friendly manner with any directions we needed and with our reservation on the Airport Limo Bus (picked us up right outside).We didn't opt for the breakfast, and instead went to the Carrera section and had a wonderful breakfast at the Hawaiian restaurant.

They charge for using the Gym. Rooms are really small. Breakfast is very poor. We arrived late in the evening and wanted to have a quick dinner at the hotel and all of the restaurants were fully booked with locals. They should reserve some spots for hotel guests..Needs lots of improvement.

We staied 11 nights together with our two kids (5 and 8) in a two bed room. no problem to share the bed wit a kid. Very good service and the possibility to wash clothes ourselves was appreciated. Lot of convenient stores and restaurants in the close area if you don´t want to use the once in the hotel every day.

Decent size rooms with great views. Very impressed with this as first place to stay on our honeymoon in Japan. Good subway connections via Shiodome and Shimbashi. Close to the fish market and has a good bar. Concierge is friendly and free wifi. Would happily stay there again

We chose this hotel for a 3 night stay In Tokyo. following our cruise. Turned out to be a good choice as the hotel is in a central location, not far from Ginza and close to a train station. The room was excellent and hotel service very good. We had an early start one morning for a day trip to Mt Fuji so couldn't have breakfast in the dining room so the staff arranged for a breakfast box to take on the bus. We were impressed by the Japanese efficiency in meeting timetables... when advised by the concierge staff of our pickup times for our daily excursions and transfer to the airport, the relevant buses arrived at the hotel precisely on time.We had one evening meal in the hotel's french restaurant which was somewhat expensive but there are quite a few good Japanese restaurants nearby around the train station. Overall, a pleasant experience.

We stayed in Tokyo 3 days prior to departing on a cruise in April 2014. Our travel agent suggested Park Hotel. It was excellent. The service and food very good. One thing we wanted to see was Jigokudani (snow monkeys) while staying in Japan. The Park Hotel Conciege recommended an outstanding local guide who gave us an amazing day tour. We felt this was a comfortable and welcoming hotel for any world traveler and gives you a first hand experience of the charm, sophistication, and extraordinary courtesy of Japan. Well located, great city views. The lobby is on the 25th or 26th floor.

Finding this hotel was like striking gold - the location, interior and service are exemplary while the price is very reasonable for Tokyo. It seems that the hotel might not be very well known thankfully for the guests who have found it. Lobby on Floor 25 means that there is a quite good view from most rooms but I strongly advise to get the corner room with the view of the "Eiffel Tower" - it is worth the extra money. Ginza area is in ca 7-8 minutes walking distance, Tsukiji fish market is ca 15 minutes away. It is 5 minutes to Shimbashi JR station and 2 metro lines - you can choose to walk either via the underground shopping gallery, street level or elevated paths. A building with some 20-30 different restaurants is across the street.

We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon trip to Japan. We mainly chose this hotel because of its excellence view of the Tokyo Tower and I will say that they view in night time is absolutely PRICELESS. The location of this hotel is also very strategic, if you go down to the basement you are within walking distance to the shops (including 24hr minimart), eatery and train station.The only 'minor' downfall to this hotel is that there is no 'proper' lobby on the ground floor as the Reception on the 24th flood if I'm not mistaken and when we arrive there was no one to help us with our luggage or direct us to the reception. Also, the rooms are a tad bit small. Other than that, everything about this hotel is great

The hotel starts from 25th floor, there's a small turn from the main entrance, take lift and go to reception at 25 floor. Mine was a single room, though the room was small but it was Ok per Tokyo standards. th ebed was comfortable, because of the big glass window on other side, you will not feel that the room is small in size. overall very clean and comfortable stay. But the charm of stay is the toilet and the toiletries in the bathroom. the toilet seat is warm and you can sset temperature of both water and seat (spend 2 mins to understand that) :) The toiletries were good and plenty. Only thing they can imrove is put some entertainment channel on TV in English. most of the channels were in Japanese and so never watched TV after checking the channels on day 1.if you want to take train, JR Shimbashi station is nearby. Plenty of taxis in front of hotel, but generally people avoid taking taxis as they are too expensive.For airport shuttle, you can book limousine bus from reception. the hotel staff is very helpful and will provide you maps in English for nearby places.Morning breakfast was ok, not grand but sufficient.

I'll be repeating what other reviewers have already said-simply put this is a great place to experience the luxury that Tokyo is known for. Service is exemplary, original art in all rooms, and what a view! Our room was one floor from the top and wow, that view of all of Tokyo below us was stunning. Tokyo can be overwhelming to a first time visitor, but the gracious staff will help you with anything you need, from directions and help with the Metro to restaurant reservations or suggestions. It can be hard to find at first (we were looking befuddled and a Japanese businessman on his way home from work stopped, called the hotel and then insisted on walking us to the front door, very kind) but once you figure it out you realize the location is really convenient, with a Metro stop right nearby. If you want to experience Tokyo at its finest I'd highly recommend The Park. We loved it.

The hotel is located above the Shiodome station and just a few minutes walk away from the Shimbashi station. The hotel starts at the 25th floor and goes up so, weather permitting, there are great views over Tokyo from all aspects. Our room was well proportioned, clean and with the usual amenities and, most importantly, a comfortable bed. The front desk was, unfailingly, courteous and very helpful. Our only criticism would be of the buffet breakfast; the offerings were on the slim side but you wouldn't starve. Overall, the hotel can be wholeheartedly recommended as being an excellent base from which to explore Tokyo.

Park hotel is located 5 minutes walk from Ginza, and the Shiodome station is just in font of it, so transportation in Tokyo is easy and comfortable.The rooms are nice and clean with everything you need. Reach (but expensive) breakfast, local and western.The staff very helpful.

We opted to stay here because we read some people stayed here before and were able to get reservations at certain Michelin-rated restaurants we wanted to eat at. I had a number of requests and the concierge team did the best they can, delivering on all but two restaurants which were full even before we attempted to make a reservation. We also enjoyed the hotel's proximity to the train stations and Ginza. We never took a cab because everything was in close proximity. One issue I did have however was a certain smell that seemed to emulate all over. At first, we thought it was solely in our room and I was thankful they had an air freshener spray available in our closet, but I soon realised that I could smell it as we came out of the elevator as well. Eventually we got used to it and it wasn't a big deal towards the end of our stay.

Had a great stay vat the Park. Staff were very helpful and all requests were always promptly addressed. The hotel is 7-10 minute walk from the JR or Tokyo Metro station.Apart from that, it is conveniently located. Overall though it is a but on the expensive side

Service is excellent - staff very helpful in all situations - walked me down to get cab and shuttle to airport. Good location. Views of either the river or city are equally good. Many choices at breakfast. English language newspaper available.

We had a corner room at the hotel with great views over the city and Mt Fuji in the distance. The room was very clean, well laid out and comfortable. The bed was firm, as are most of the beds in Japanese hotels, and a slightly softer bed would have made the experience even better. The Shimbashi location was the best that I have experienced in many years of travel to Tokyo. The JR station and subway stations are both within a few minutes walk, and Ginza is just 15 minutes walk away. The buffet breakfast had a good variety of foods and the fruit was very fresh. Overall the Park Hotel was an extremely pleasant base for exploring Tokyo and excellent value for the money.Dave D, Sydney

My stay was excellent! The room was very clean and above average for Japan, but not plush. The bed was comfortable and the view was spectacular. We had an unobstructed floor to ceiling view of the Tokyo Tower and, on clear mornings, of Mt. Fuji behind it. The staff provided great service and was always willing to accomodate us. The location was great! A central train station was next to it, and a very large park with Japanese gardens was a couple of blocks over. The Tsukiji Fish Market was in walking distance. Many restaurants were nearby and on the premises. We chose to have breakfast at the hotel and were given discount coupons for those meals. I thought the buffet breakfast was very good and provided many options. I would definitely stay again.

Park Hotel looks impressive on the web but wasn't when on site, it's just an average hotel in the Tokyo CBD. Location is great for traveller using monorail to/from Odaiba. Shinbashi station (JR line + subway ) is 8mins walk from the hotel via underground passage. The reception/lobby is on 25 floor with a beautiful view of Tokyo Tower as a permanent X-mas tree on the background. The only problem is smoking hazard which could eventually get into your room via the air con. We stayed 6 nights in a non smoking conner room which look down the rail line and the Tokyo tower on the side way. The room is small for a family with 2 young children on 2 single beds, this seem normal for JP hotel standard. Shower pressure wasn't strong enough, room services lack of details/personal touch (dirty glasses weren't removed but they put the cover over them). The sheets were not as clean and good quality as other hotels we stayed in JP. Breakfast was a mixture of JP and western with average taste and average selection, not recommended. Not all the front staffs were helpful and professional, I would prefer them to smile, not bow with a serious face!

Good service.Breakfast is OK. Helpful staff.TV and news in Japanese.Needs more English movies and programs.Convenient location.Easy access to public transport and Ginza.Lots of restaurants and coffee shops around.A few more bathroom amenities eg.soap would have been better.Room a bit small.Uncomfortable pillows.The view from our room with Tokyo tower was beautiful,especially at night.A three and a half stars's hotel not 4.Nice area,would stay there again..

This hotel was okay, the bed extremely comfortable, the view over Tokyo amazing. We had a corner king room. The room was small, only one lounging chair. A shower over the bath. Wi fi in the room was good.You could walk into ginza easily from this hotel, shinbashi station huge. This hotel is situated in the business district and is remote from other sites. Taxis are an expensive option in this city. Breakfast was adequate, not bad but not fantastic either.The rt work in the hotel is fantastic. The staff were good except for the tour desk operator who was less than helpful..Should say, the room was clean, the temperature in the room was good and they had English stations on the tv..

I choose this hotel because it was not far from Tokyo station, and not far from Ginza and the fish market.The problem is, that it's situated in a maze of skyscrapers and it takes a while until you find your way around.The room was fine, nothing special, the beds were good and the view was nice.Food wise, breakfast is average.We had dinner in our room, and it was terrible, Sushi,( the fish was like plastic.)They could make an effort, service is soulless.

It's in a great location - very handy to lots of public transport, so a great base for touring. We had a view of Tokyo Tower which was beautiful at night. Loved the art work on the walls in the lobby area, and the illuminated works on the big walls each evening. The staff were all friendly - gave us a great first impression of Tokyo. I appreciated having a laundry for guests to use - much cheaper and quicker than sending to the hotel laundry. The corner room was a good size - compact by Australian standards, but quite sufficient for 2 people a few days

The hotel is well located, walking distance from Ginza area. Two minutes from 2 subway stations and with plenty of nice restaurants around (pricey and posh in top 2 floors of one of the tall buildings around, and local and typical below/around the train station), Walking distance from the fish market and to the park from which you can take a nice boat ride (on a nice day) to North Tokyo. Rooms are spot clean and staff friendly and helpful. Rooms are not huge but very reasonable in Tokyo (or New York) standards. Lobby is nice and the views from the windows beautiful.Prices vary per the time of the year; we paid around $200 in mid-April which I feel was a reasonable deal. Overall warmly recommended if the price is right.

Even if you are not on a business trip Park Hotel Tokyo ist worth staying.We-a family with one child-spent there 5 nights.The stuff is really friendly and helpful.Great clean rooms and a wonderful view from the reception,even to Mount Fuji.Breakfast is not really cheap but there is a good choice of japanese and western fod.The location is excellent,,close to subway and railwaystation and there are a lot ofrestaurants and shops in the nearby shopping malls.

The Park Hotel is in an outstanding location and a short walk to 3-4 food courts, 2 subways. The hotel is really 5 star with excellent interiors and a gorgeous lobby. Rooms were very accommodating. The only weaknesses were lack of concierge service after 6 pm however, the front desk staff were also good (look for young staff for restaurant recommendations). The other was that the use of Wifi internet was overwhelming to their network. Wifi worked best during off hours. During morning times and early evening, it was very very difficult to connect. iPhones could not connect either. Laptops were problematic. As a tip, breakfast is cheaper as room service since the all you can eat buffet is about 20% more.

The service was excellent. Very friendly and helpful concierge, restaurant and reception staff. On check out one of the reception staff even came down in the elevator with us to make sure the taxi driver took us to the correct railway station. The hotel is close to subway and railway stations and is therefore well located to travel around Tokyo. Good western and Japanese breakfast buffet in the hotel. There are some high quality restaurants in the hotel, and also a choice of restaurants nearby in office towers/shopping centres.

Small rooms for such a pricey, up-scale hotel. Breakfast in the lobby seems a necessity of design rather than the concept of coziness. A few more bathroom amenities would have been appreciated (make-up remover especially). Staff was courteous and polite, but was not proactive. Restaurant 'Tateru Yoshino' and manager/sommelier Mr.Kanda were fantastic.

I travel to Tokyo on business about once a month. The Park Hotel Tokyo always delivers. Great room, good lobby/restaurant/bars. Very helpful and friendly staff.If you need to be in the Shiodome area. This is the palce.

As obvious from all previous reviews the strong points of the hotel are location, transport connections and view. Apart from that I experienced the hotel, especially the lobby, as an oasis of quiet and relaxation. Every night there were video projections on one of the walls and the music was always so pleasant...The rooms are small indeed as expected but the view was breathtaking. Breakfast was the same every day (both western and Japanese) but that didn't bother me at all since I had what to choose from. The French restaurant was great, the Japanese one also and at the bar in the lobby we enjoyed some of the best cocktails ever.The staff were always very polite and helpful.

This is hotel is my first choice for staying in Tokyo, it has everything you can ask, and I always recommend it to everybody. The rooms are all above the 25th floor so the view is spectacular, especially if the room is faced to the Tokyo tower. The rooms itself are not big, but very modern and functional, I suggest to pay a little more to have the corner room which is well worth the price difference. The restaurants are not big but the quality is very good. The real plus of this hotel is the position, is close to the Shinbashi station (JR) and above 2 line of the metro, and directly connected to the Yurikamome line. Also is in walking distance to Ginza and in the evening the Shimbashi area is rich in bar and resturants. I stayed at the Park hyatt in Shinjuku and at this hotel during my last trip, and I still prefer the park hotel.

good accommodation with good connection to nearby train station. I am guest since years but realized that due to high frequency the restaurant chairs are already very old and uncomfortable.Breakfast room beside the lobby has sometimes extrem dirty tablecloth - very bad image for a Japanese hotel in such class.Like me it seems we all were getting older.

My husband is a member of the Scotch Malt Whiskey Society, and was thrilled with the scotch selection - and the member discount! The rooms were roomy enough. Opted for the view over the Tokyo Tower - amazing at night. Opted out of the $25 (Canadian) breakfast, and hit McD's instead for $9 (for both of us). Location is great to get onto the JR Yamanote line. Friendly Airport LImousine hits this hotel as a stop on their service from Narita airport (about 2 hours).

The hotel is near the Shiodome and Shimbashi stations where train and subway stops. It is on the edge of the Ginza shopping district in the heart of Tokyo. This is an easy walk. The fish market is within 10 minutes walking distance and there is a park across the street. The monorail to the port district is near the hotel entrance as well. So the location is great. It is also two stops from Tokyo main train station, which is convenient if you are travelling by train or coming from or going to Narita airport. Take the airport express train here. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor of an office building, with rooms going up to 34th floor. View are great. Ask to have a room as high up as possible with views on Tokyo tower/mount Fuji, although the other views (port view and rest of the city) are great as well.The hotel itself is pretty average. Rooms are small-ish, which can be expected in Tokyo and a bit dated. Bathroom is standard Japanese hotel bathroom (compact). The room is a bit dated. Breakfast is in the big lobby. Found that a bit limited.All in all an average hotel with a great location and stunning views.

Stayed here for three nights on our arrival in Tokyo. The room was excellent- good size and well maintained with great views and very quiet. Breakfast was included in our package and this was the best breakfast of the three hotels we stayed in. Staff were friendly, efficient and helpful. There are good transport links and plenty of places to eat nearby. The hotel is well placed for the fish market and a lovely garden nearby.Would stay here again if I visited Tokyo again.

Am writing this review whilst staying at the hotel on our second leg of Tokyo. We stayed here for 8 nights prior and had foolishly prepaid for the second leg- would have changed hotels immediately had we not done so. We weren't very impressed first thing when we came to the hotel and could barely find the hotel lobby. Having arrived after a long flight, we were told that our room was available but as we were early for our check in, we had to pay 6000 yen for the 90 minutes prior to check in. How pathetic. Have never come across an inflexible hotel as such. Rooms are extremely small which is expected of Tokyo- very dated. But so small to a point where the shower head would spray water over the bath tub and leak all over the floor. They also allow for smoking in the hotel lobby which is extremely disgusting. Not sure why we decided to pick this hotel but we do NOT recommend to anyone. Absolutely horrible hotel with some staff members who lack personality.

The Park Hotel is based in the business district of Shiodome, not far from Haneda Airport which is the closest airport to Tokyo. There are two train stations Shiodome and Shimbashi which you can access easily from the hotel. Tsukiji Fish Market and Hamarikyu Gardens are also within walking distance from the hotel. The lobby has a wonderful view of Tokyo and Tokyo Tower. In the early morning you can see Mt Fuji in the distance and at night the view is quite spectacular with all the lights. Our room was a good size, very clean, had huge glass windows, so we have an awesome view of tokyo. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the buffet breakfast was not bad either. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Tokyo.

In new Shiodome Media Center attached to several other buildings, two train stations, other hotels, many restaurants and snack bars. Among glass passageways three stories above the street. Hotel is on floor 25 and above of an office building. Rooms r tiny but have glass walls viewing across Tokyo. Very clean n new. Great breakfast buffet for 2600 yen. English newspaper at breakfast. Exc internet in rooms. Very helpful staff

This hotel is very well situated in an area of Tokyo with great train and metro links. Its also 15 mins walk to the fish market and a great park.The rooms are all above 26 floor, so have a great views. Although not huge, they have everything you would want and are very clean. The views are amazing.We didn't eat breakfast, as its so easy to eat out, and the cost was about $20 each, which seemed a little steep.In summary, i'd recommend staying here if visiting Tokyo for a few days or even a week.

Very modern well run hotel with easy access to both Metro and Japan Rail Stations. Staff are exceptionally helpful, friendly, and efficient. Rooms are quite large by Tokyo standards. Breakfast, if not included in room rate is a bit expensive. Lots of shops and restaurants in the 3 level underground city below the hotel.

Park Hotel is based in the business district, right on top of Shiodome and Shimbashi metro stations. It's very easy to travel by train to and from the hotel and there are plenty of taxis too.The hotel feels luxurious and more boutique than business - it is cosy and fellow guests all appeared to be well-dressed - lots of hushed tones and good manners! We were aware of our noisy children but nobody ever made us feel out of place. The staff brought teddies and treats up to our room and made us feel welcome.We stayed in a triple room which was definitely big enough for the 4 of us (3 beds and 1 cot) plus our luggage and pushchair. The bathroom is small but has everything you need with powerful water and a heated toilet seat. The views from the rooms are fantastic - Tokyo Tower on one side and Skytree on the other. We slept very well and never heard another guest.The food is high end so we only ate breakfast at the hotel, and had lunch and dinner when we were out. The room service menu isn't extensive but you can get something if you're desperate. In the local City Centre tower and also just along the walkway towards Shimbashi there are lots of local cafés plus more international coffee shops for informal food. In 15 minutes you can walk to Ginza for good restaurants too.My only gripe is the sometimes snooty staff at breakfast who were happy to stand back and watch while we made countless trips to the breakfast buffet to get glasses of water and all the food required for a family of four for breakfast, particularly on one occasion when we arrived just before they were closing. But that seems to be the style of this hotel, and timings in Japan seem to run like clockwork.We would stay here again and recommend this hotel.

The limo bus from Narita goes to the doorstep which is great (but bear in mind there are only a handful of limo buses from Narita in the morning, unless I'm mistaken. You may have to take the Narita Express and get off at Shimbashi, there's a flight of stairs opposite the hotel, take that and it connects you to the 3rd floor lift lobby, the hotel is on 25th floor). Decent service, decent sized rooms, no complaints. There's a convenience store in the basement which comes in handy. We stayed only a night, would definitely pick it the next time around.

Good location, not a main street but walking distance to a central area and to a major train station. Amazing view, beautiful lobby and excellent service. Recommendation: ask for a tower view room and reserve a room with breakfast.

I have not too much to write about as I only spent one night here. However, my impression was that the staff was very helpful, location was great and breakfast was good.Pros:- Fantastic view to Tokyo Tower!!- Clean room- Impecable service from all staff!- Heated toilet seat :-)Cons:- Rooms are really small (in general in Tokyo)- Noisy, you can hear everything that your neighbour is doing (also in general in Tokyo hotels I have found out!?)

Really modern hotel in a easy to get to everything position. Plenty of space in our double room to accomodate our teenage son. Generous breakfast buffet. Take a printout of instructions from the hotel web site if arriving by train, easy walking distance from station if you follow the instructions. Best view in Tokyo, of Mount Fuji, from the reception desk, just get up early on a clear day.

Park Hotel Tokyo has great links to travel around Tokyo with the Oedo Line practically below the hotel or access to further lines via a 5 minute walk to ShimbashiThe views from the hotel were spectacular, especially at night when Tokyo was lit upAfter my first night in the hotel I realised the duvet had feathers in it and unfortunately I had forgotten to mention when booking that I had an allergy, I asked the front desk if it would be possible to have a feather free duvet and they had this made up for the remainder of my stayAll the staff were very courteous and gave great information on how to get around Tokyo and helping find local shops, etc

After two weeks skiing in Hakuba we spent a couple of nights at the Park Hotel. As we'd come to expect in Japan the hotel staff we extremely courteous and throughout our stay the service was impeccable.The hotel is well placed being close to a number of rail and metro stations all accessible via the underground walkways so it's relatively easy to get to other parts of the city. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Ginza too which was worth a visit for the great shops.At the reception level there are two restaurants; one French and one Japanese although we didn't eat in either. We did eat in the lounge area though and the food was fine. A very tasty wagyu beef stew is to be recommended.There are innumerable restaurants close to the hotel but I feel they're more intended towards feeding locals rather than visitors and that is fair enough; it's their city. I does mean that unless you can read Japanese then you have no idea what you're ordering which made it exciting! Even the pictures that a few of the restaurants had on their menus didn't really help. However we enjoyed our food, whatever it might have been, on the two evenings we were there.The view of the Tokyo tower from the bedroom in the evening was a real treat and we could just have gazed out over that cityscape forever. You might think that one high rise city skyline is much like another but they each has its uniqueness in my view.The room was perfectly adequate in size and the bed very comfortable (a relief for my wife who didn't get on too well with the hard beds in Hakuba).I would without a second thought stay at the Park hotel again if I ever go back to that wonderful city.

Clean hotel, friendly staff.the location was perfect.The subway/train is just minutes away and very easy to use.If you are going to be using the train a must is the JR pass. We took it everywhere, inside and outside of Tokyo!Also 30 minutes walking distance if you're doing the tuna auction,need to be there at 4 am if not you will not find tickets.I would give this hotel 5 stars but was not happy with the breakfast buffet overpriced and not enough items No omelet station? There are some interesting small restaurants under the surrounding hotels and shops on your way to the train.

Location superb with easy access to public transport, staff also found taxis quickly when required. Room ideal with great views. Breakfast excellent. Didn't try the evening meals. Great place to stay in a truly wonderful city.

We had a very good experience in our 4 night stay. Yes the rooms are small, but in for Tokyo standards, they are excellent in space The Shiodome station is just on the other side of the street. Ginza is ib a walking distance. And the staff of the hotel is really friendly. The only con I can find is that the breakfast wasn't that good, but I might be biased because I am western and I just fins the buffett very oriental, but I guess that is expected: I was in Japan!

I got to the hotel was 10:30am in the morning. It was not the check in time. But I paid $20 for a upgrade room which was tower view room,and got early check in. That was worthy. I could see the beautiful view of the Mt. Fuji and Tokyo tower. Not the clear day, the tower view was pretty,too.The room was small. But it's in Tokyo. For me, the small room wasn't a problem. It was clean,bed was comfy, I didn't like the Japanese bead pillow. The bathroom was Japanese style,small.But friendly.It got enough counter space for all my girl stuff. I like the warm toilet sitting.Nice in the winter. I like the comfy tower. They have plenty of bathroom amenities,nice.The hotel location was good.15 mins walk to the Tsukiji fish market, Which you can got delicious fresh sushi lunch(probably dinner,too). And 15 mins walk to Ginza. Some nice restaurants nearby the hotel. 1 min to the Subway station.10 mins walk to metro station. I bought the subway ticket was metro 2 day pass. Lots of subway it couldn't use. But that's ok, railway ticket was not expensive,and very easy to get from the machine. TV had lots channel,but all in Japanese.Even the CNN.But the wifi working good and fast.I don't had to watch TV at all.The breakfast at hotel was little disappointed.Not a lots chooses.But it doesn't matter,I had a pleasant stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo.

I transit for 1 night in Tokyo before back to my country. My partner booked this hotel. The hotel is very nice, good service, nice staff and great location. I around near hotel to buy something and yap, very great location. But, room is small.

Good location not too far from shopping areas, restaurants, and train stations. Nice property with clean and spacious room (relatively) in Tokyo. Only drawback was the quality of pillows, which seemed small, old, and lumpy for both the Japanese bead-type and regular type. This somewhat hampered sleep quality that otherwise would have been great.

Stayed for a few days in Tokyo. Room was comfortable, clean and great view of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji. Staff were friendly, English speaking and helpful. Finding way out of the hotel to Shimbashi station was tricky even after asking for directions. It took a few trips to station and back, to get used to the underground walkways. Close to small family mart/supermarket, take away shops and bakery. Convenient location.

Clean, comfortable hotel within walking distance of Shinbashi station (take directions with you as a bit complicated without them). Great views, excellent service, family friendly (difficult to find hotel room accommodating 4 in Tokyo). Great bathroom amenities. Organised transfer bus to airport and last minute booking to Nobu on Friday night. Stored baggage on last day. Very helpful. No complaints other than would be nice to have cost a little less (wouldn't it always).

Room - corner room with view of tokyo tower. Small in size for its price. Large king bed.Lobby - vibrant, artsy. Impressive atrium style. Guests - mostly business peopleBreakfast - typical buffet breakfastLocation - CBD. Very close to Conrad Service - warm, polite; typical Japanese type of service

Stayed for 1 week when on holiday in Tokyo with my boyfriend. The park hotel was a great find, the staff were very accommodating and let us check in early after we arrived after a long flight. Room very clean and comfortable. Highlight was the Michelin starred Ty restaurant in the lobby, who managed to fit us in last minute on a Friday night.

Hotel staff helpful and friendly. Location is very convenience can asset to public transportation very easily,there is a lot of dining shop which is quite near to the hotel and even in midnight there are still some shop open you still can have a late supper .This is our family holiday ,Seven of us satisfied and Happy to stay in this hotel.

This was a great starting point for our trip to Tokyo. Super close to the famous fish market and Ginza district. The hotel was clean comfortable and a good value we booked on orbitz. They brought us champagne for our one year anniversary, thank you! We stayed 4 night and easily navigated the train station near by. Part of me wished we had stayed in a busier part of town. All in all it was a great place to start our two week vacation in Japan.

With a number of different train options nearby this is a great place to explore all over Tokyo from.The views from most parts of the hotel are fantastic and the lobby is stunning with panoramic views including Tokyo tower.Rooms are not big but certainly not tiny and the breakfast is excellent.

We chose to stay at Park Hotel based on the review of the tripadvisor.It has been a great choice for my hubby and teenager son.Great location ! Good service !Great accessibility to all train stations were a very plus point !The hotel also has the airport pick up bus which is very convenient and at reasonable price Hotel Staff can also speak good English.The trip sharing room was big and very comfortable.Beautiful view facing the Tokyo Tower from our triple sharing room.The view from the hotel lobby was awesome.With the clear weather, we can see Mt Fuji from afar.Will definitely choose Park Hotel to stay when back in Tokyo in the near future

This is a very nice hotel with a reasonable price considering its location (being in Tokyo and all). It's centrally located, with subway and lightrail stations within walking distance. They have very interesting exhibitions at the lobby (AWARE: it's not on the ground floor. Read the instructions on the lift) and apparently every now and then they would project some short films onto their giant white wall for ones to watch. The room was rather spacious, and the view was very good; we could see the Tokyo Tower from our room. However, there are two thing that you need to be aware of (nothing about the hotel facility tho):1. Unless you are on a business trip that requires you to stay near Ginza, this area may not be a bit boring for it's kinda far away from all the fun places. Except that there is a giant clock opposite the road (on your way to the subway station) influenced by Howl's Moving Castle which chimes every now and then. It's definitely worth checking out if you are nearby. 2. I find that many luxury hotels in Tokyo have a distinctive feature: they occupy only the top floors of high-rises. This can for sure provide you a good view, however for one that can't stand a rapid lift due to the air compression like me or one with claustrophobia, it may not be an enjoyable experience. Park Hotel is definitely one of these hotels so you might wanna take that into consideration.

It's really convenient because of the location. The view at the Lobby is awesome, too.Above all, staying the night view at my room can make us feel relaxed and everything is worthy, especially in higher floors.

As we were flying early to Sapporo from Haneda Airport, it was too early for the airport coach. We used the Asakusa subway line. From the hotel, it was a 5 minute walk to Shimbashi station using underground arcade and under cover from the snowy weather. There was no train transfer necessary. Hotel to airport took less than an hour and was hassle free.

amazing views, fantastic staff and service. could not fault it in any way. convenient location with shops nearby, and as it is in the business district you are always going against the traffic so the trains were not crowded.

Stayed at Park Hotel Tokyo for business during the Japan Golf Fair. Website is easy to book reservation, check-in was pleasant, and rooms are clean with mind-blowing views. Irons are not stocked in rooms so you may need to ask for one. It will be hand-delivered to your room within minutes. Breakfast in lobby is outstanding- delicious produce, juice and a mix of American and Japanese style food. The hotel 2 minute walk to mono-rail and other train stations. Will look forward to staying at Park Hotel Tokyo for future business trips to Japan.

The location is excellent, really near to Shimbashi stationThe room are clean and comfortableThe lobby is very nice (with a spectacular view) - only point is that the wifi is cutting very often so it's quite difficult to work from the lobby

We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. Things we liked about this hotel:1) great location. It's about 5 mins walk to the JR Shimbashi station (covered via underground passageway). Shimbashi is just 2 stops away from Tokyo which connects you to the rest of Japan. It's actually walkable to Tokyo station via GInza, which is what we did for both days as the weather was great out. it's also just a 5-8 mins walk to Tsukiji fish market.2) airport limousine stops directly at the hotel, which is very convenient if you have a lot of luggage.3) Room was very comfy. Spacious by Japanese standards and the provided Thann toiletries is a very nice touch. Bed was also very comfy.4) staff was very helpful and provided recommendations on the restaurants around the Shiodome area as well as assisting with restaurant reservations.We usually stay at the villa Fontaine shiodome next door but decided to give this place a try as we got a really good rate for our stay (they were running some winter special when we booked). We're glad we tried this place and will definitely return in future.

We stayed here seven nights on a holiday in Tokyo during Chinese New Year.The hotel is in the top half of an office building, which is actually fairly common and depending on the direction of the window is facing, you may get a view of Mount Fuji.The rooms are basic and average size for Japanese hotel rooms. Not much wardrobe space and a desk that is also a TV stand. The internet is super fast but there aren't any English TV channels and only limited to less than 10 channels. Where are the standard international channels?The hotel is very much on top of a subway line, a monorail and a short 5 minutes walk from the JR station which has many connections. So as far as getting around, it is convenient, but that said, there really isn't that much around. It is all office buildings in the immediate area, hardly any pedestrians once it gets dark and many restaurants don't open on the weekends. So if you want a quick proper meal late at night, you will have to go to Shimbashi station.The hotel has a shuttle going to and from both Narita and Haneda airport, check the times on the hotel website.Another thing I liked about the hotel is that it does have coin operated laundry for those on a budget. This can be very useful for those travelling more than a week.I was happy with the hotel given the price we paid and it was a very good hotel, but for holiday, you will want to be a bit closer to the action, e.g. Shibuya, Shinjuku or Ebisu, for you to really feel like you are in Tokyo.

Excellent, central location. Great access to JR rail system and Tokyo subway. Great base for visiting Tokyo. Spectacular views from the 25th floor lobby - Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji (on a clear day). The rooms are clean and modern - on the small side but probably large by Tokyo standards and all you really need. The staff are knowledgable and helpful. A great stay.

Conveniently located, mostly clean and professional establishment. Nothing too particular about the interior or rooms, staff was helpful but not especially so, breakfast was simple but enough, everything worked as things should. We stayed in both queen double and king size corner room (4 nights total). The corner room had much better view and I think it is worth its higher price. Convenience store downstairs and easy access to subway/trains are really good. Did not try the tiny gym or spa facilities. Bathrooms come without proper air flow and don't have real tiling (bit of a plastic feel overall), composite materials instead of solid wood used in interior. It was slightly difficult to manage a comfortable temperature given the cold weather outside (small room was either too hot or too cold, the bigger room was easier to control). Bed was good.

stayed for 4N of which 3N in standard room and 1N in corner room. internet was fast and worked well in both rooms. hot shower was hot and the bathtub was clean. breakfast was only so-so, and the lobby smelled like cigarettes.the room was horribly cold and if used in heating mode, the A/C gave out quite a smell. view was nice, and the hotel was conveniently located on top of an Oedo line subway station and a FamiMa store. good base for exploring tokyo, if in a bit desolate location. this was not exactly cheap either. when looking for power socket i noticed they don't clean under the beds. I think next time in Tokyo I'll go to a smaller hotel that is right in the middle of the action.

The location is very good for people who want to stay close to everything but don´t want to be in the middle of it, like Shinjuku area. The Hotel is very easy to find and has good public transportation links to the city. Staff is polite and helpful and rooms are nice and clean. The rooms could be little more bigger, but this is Tokyo after all. We stayed in a room with "Tower view" and it was very nice view indeed, on a clear weather you could even see Mt. Fuji towering on the back. The best thing in this Hotel was that it was very close to Tsukiji Fish market, where we had Sushi breakfast every day.

Very nice hotel right next to Tokyo Tower. Easy to get to trains and the staff speaks english. I booked through hotels.com and got a premium room. It's easy to get to Roppongi Hills, Harajuku and all of the other locations I want to see in Tokyo.

A lovely hotel with good transport links very close by. The food and drinks are relatively expensive in the hotel but there are plenty of eating options in the immediate vicinity. A special mention must go to all of the staff who were very helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was compact but bigger than we expected for Japan and had great views of the city and Tokyo Tower. Finally, loving those Japanese toilets!!

We enjoyed good vacation in this hotel. We have two children and my mother. We would like to stay in one room. It’s difficult to search room for our needs. The room is big enough and the additional bed is also good.We can see sky tree from our room. We also found good view through labby of hotel. It's real nice experience.

Trusted trip advisor reviews and booked this hotel for our two day trip during transit to Taipei. Very important, Don't take a taxi from Narita airport to the hotel. It was a very expensive lesson and next time we are definitely taking the airport shuttle. JR (Japan Rail) and subway would be too inconvenient with five pieces of luggage. If you are arriving or leaving from Haneda airport than taxi would be doable. Front entrance of building is not the entrance of hotel but the entrance to the Shiodome Media business Tower. You must go through the revolving doors to get to the elevators which will take you up to the hotel lobby on the 25th floor. Don't expect any hotel staff to help you upon arriving at the tower entrance but once you're in the lobby staff are quick to help with your bags and take you to front desk. As other reviewers mentioned, staff are helpful and friendly but not very personable. They are more than happy to help with any questions or issues but won't go out of their way to assist. Rooms are small for American standards but average to large in Japan. Our queen tower view room was much roomier than the double at the Washinton Hotel I've stayed in ten years ago. The view from our room was as advertised. We were lucky to have good weather during our stay and could see snow capped Mt.Fuji during the day. Tokyo night lights were stunning as well. Location couldn't be beat. There were subway, metro, and JR all within the 3rd floor walkway or escalator to B2 away. If possible opt for subway, TOIE or Tokyo Metro, easier to understand imo. Going to Disneyland takes two TOIE transfers and a JR to resort entrance. The concierge will gladly show you on the subway map. Near the Shiodome building are many local eateries and drinking establishments as well as western chains and pubs. Hotel has a nice dining area for breakfast which we tried on day of check-out. Average to expensive for what they offered but convenient if you're short on time. Checking out was quick and staff are very efficient with bags and had a taxi ready for us at building entrance. Tipping are not required and some will even refuse politely. We left gratuity for housekeeping the day we left so they couldn't refuse. Hotel has everything you would need but not over the top. Great for business travelers. Between average to above average but everyone's standards are different. My s/o gives it very good to excellent.

Great stay, great location. Very good service from all staff, extremely helpful & welcoming. Good buffet breakfast, excellent choice of food. Lovely comfortable room. Enjoyable base for exploring Tokyo.

The best part was the beautiful view of Tokyo tower from the window. I definitely recommend getting a room in the hotel with a view. The staff were very friendly, provided good directions and spoke English well. It is a bit tricky to get to the hotel at first from JR Shimbashi station, however, concierge can inform you of the best way to get there. I recommend asking them for directions to the hotel before your stay. The queen room I stayed in was not very spacious, but you can forgo this for the beautiful view, cleanliness and great service. The hotel's location was great for getting to and around Tokyo.

Location was perfect for my business, and staff were most polite and professional. Breakfast buffet was very good, and so was the food in the atrium restaurant. This as my third time at this hotel, and all rooms are above the 25th floor and with great views. I will stay here again.

The highlight of this hotel is the friendly and helpful hotel staffs in the hotel concierge. They spoke good english and eager to help you to see the best of Tokyo and Japan in general. Other than that, the room is Japanese-standard. We have read many reviews where the guests were upgraded but we were not that fortunate during out 6-night stay in the hotel. Although, I was expecting the hotel will consider an upgrade the fact that we're long stayers or maybe its also because the staff in the receptionist who helped us to check-in was not as friendly as his colleagues. The hotel location has good access to Shimbashi station, either through the outdoor pedestrian sky bridge or indoor underpass; this was proven to be good during our winter visit since the evening temperature might be too cold for some people. The breakfast was very average, I would recommend you to spend the money somewhere else.

Our driver had a bit of trouble finding this hotel, as the lobby is 24 floors up, and the street level entrance is not prominently signed. Once there, however, the staff were very helpful, and able to cope with our terrible japanese language skills.The rooms were not huge, but big enough, clean, and have fabulous views. We spent 4 nights there and were very happy. Like most places in Japan, they have no idea about coeliac disease (3 out of 5 of us have it), however when I explained the situation to the concierge - at 8:30 at night, mind you - she got on the phone and spoke to a local restaurant and persuaded them to stay open late so that my starving kids could eat something gluten-free. We were extremely grateful for that, as it had been a long day of travel.The breakfast buffet was good, although I missed espresso coffee.The location is great. Shimbashi station is a 5 minute walk and is only two stops from Tokyo on the JR line. Shiodome station on the Metro is an even shorter walk.

The staff were very nice and provided us with everything we could possibly need. The restaurants inside the hotel were great and gave us the opportunity to try authentic Japanese food. The breakfast buffet was great! The location was great and the view of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji was amazing! Hard to beat!The room was serviced daily and the room was very clean. The room was small but in a city like Tokyo you don't spend much time in your room, so it was perfect!

This was a great home away from home for our 10-day trip in Japan. The staff was incredibly helpful and polite, and the room was rather big by Japanese standards. Shiodome subway station is accessible from the building of the hotel and Shinbashi train station is a short walk away. There are plenty of restaurants around, from cheap and quick to more refined cuisine, and the Tsukiji fish market is within walking distance.We upgraded our room for the last night to have a view of the Tokyo Tower, and it was well worth it. The lit up Tokyo Tower at night and the city view in the morning with Mt. Fuji in the distance was quite a sight.When we switched rooms, we had left 2 tea bags on the bedside table and the staff was thoughtful enough to put them on the desk of our new room when we came back later that evening.

It was a 6 night stay that I will not soon forget. Extremely comfortable and clean, although the room was a bit tiny, well, call it japanese size. All the staff was impeccably nice and helpful, they would even go out of their way to help, even if that meant leaving the front desk to take us to the underground entrance. The view is fantastic if you like skyscrapers and are not afraid of heights, and it is just pretty much as central as central gets! Close to metro and train lines, and walking distance to Tsukiji fish market is about a 8-10 minute walk, 5 minutes away from Hama Rikyu gardens, and 15 minutes away from Ginza. If you want, you can walk all the way to Tokyo Tower as it is always visible in the skyline, just make sure to memorise your way back. Breakfast is a must! Do not miss it. Overall, great experience and free wifi! Something a lot of hotels are forgetting (or maybe not). Hope to repeat this in 2015!

I have been there twice now for an annual conference in Tokyo for business.Really convenient location to explore the city and to get to Big Site. The stop for the Yurikamome line is right next to the hotel tower (3rd floor?) as well as the Shiodome underground station. Shiodomi is connected to Shinbashi via underground walk way and you will find a lot of small food places inside and outside the stations You can easily walk to either Ginza or the Tsukiji Fish Market in about 20 minutes. In the basement of the tower is a 24/7 Family Mart which is really convenient to stay hydrated in the summer.Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful and up to par with their service. I love the bar with their views and drinks and the whole hotel has a great service overall. If you need to sleep in you can have your room cleaned in the afternoon. And I love the small drip coffee packs they provide :-)

We stayed at Park hotel for two nights. Excellent choice. Great staff. Helpful concierge fluent in English ( a luxury in Japan). Trendy reception. Nice style. Good location near Ginza. Breath taking views. Go!

Great overall stay. Top standard hotel for value price! Even though you're 25+ stories high you can somehow hear the Shinkansen pass. Weird. Otherwise perfect hotel and highly recommended if you're looking for a good hotel but don't want to pay stupid prices

This hotel is a very strong 4 start. Helpful bellwomen and beautiful view at check in. Nice concierge and great bar staff, stocked with a nice selection of whiskeys. Breakfast was unremarkable. The hotel is in Shiodome which is close to a lot in the city but far enough away. remember its between both the pink and yellow lines. You can take either stop.

It's interesting to stay in a Japanese brand hotel. I would say that everything is simple but with the touch of technology of Japan, ultra-clean and excellent service. The breakfast and wifi are good enough. We stayed in a very special room decorated by an artist which was what we needed to really differentiate fro other hotels. Just down the hotel you will find the metro and JR so with that you are virtually connected to all Tokyo and beyond.The fitness center is virtually non-existent but I recommend to talk a jog outside the Imperal Palace, really worth it!

We loved staying here. Easy to get around Tokyo, amazing views - including Mount Fuji. Delightful artwork on display and and good standard of breakfast buffet. The staff were welcoming and friendly. Our rooms exactly matched the website - really comfortable and had everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again. The lobby was on the 25 th floor and our room on 31st.

I stayed here for 3 nights in January. The hotel is located in the Shinbashi district, which is newish and consists of a lot of tall buildings. As such, the hotel is a bit hard to find. After finding the hotel, we checked in and loved our room, which had a view of Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji. The bed was large and very comfortable. The room was also large compared to the other rooms in which we stayed in Japan. The bathroom was also fine, although a bit small compared to the room. We went to the hotel bar 2 of the 3 nights. The bar has great views and good but expensive drinks. Con - the hotel bar closes promptly at 11:30 and gives last call promptly at 11. No late night drinks here! There is not much to do in the area immediately surrounding the hotel, but it is within walking distance to Shimbashi station, which is very well connected, and if you take a different exit from Shimbashi station, you can find some local, Japanese areas with great food, drink and activities.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in a room with view of Tokyo Tower. It was a very nice room, spotlessly clean, comfortable bed, good size so you weren't falling over suitcases. We found the room quite cool for the middle of Winter and we weren't able to increase the temp late in the afternoon and early evening. It is disappointing there is not a dedicated English Channel on TV. You can get BBC (2channels) but both these channels revert to having Japanese language superimposed over English language. We were given the discounted breakfast option and found it to be reasonably priced and an excellent choice. Check-in and check-out was excellent and went quickly and smoothly. English was spoken by all members of front house staff. Shimbashi station is within walking distance but can be challenging if you have suitcases as there are a number of stairs to encounter and directions are not all that clear. However, I would recommend this hotel as it only cost ¥1000 to get a taxi from Tokyo station to Park Hotel Tokyo and that included suitcases.All staff at the hotel were polite, courteous and helpful.

Stayed 9 nights at the hotel in a room with views of Mount Fuji. The room was well equipped and being so high up was also extraordinarily quiet. Great service too in helping us with tour and restaurant reservations. Location is great being a 5 minute walk from Shimbachi station and with Ginza also being in walking distance. Loved it

Park Hotel Tokyo was beautiful, reasonably priced for its class, and conveniently located. The view is fantastic since it's located on the upper floors of the Shiodome Media Tower, and there are easy access pedestrian bridges as well as ground/underground passages.We arrived at the Shimbashi JR station, and initially finding the hotel took a little time. Some more signs would help travelers coming from Shimbashi station, and there were some staircases with no escalator or elevator (at least not within obvious reach). Prepare for a little bit of a walk, especially challenging if you have many heavy suitcases. Another minor quibble: our room had a very slight body odor smell, but the room had a deodorizing fabric spray that helped.If traveling solely by public transit, this location is likely more suitable for those who can do a lot of walking, though that may be the case for Tokyo in general. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk away from Tsukiji fish market, excellent for Japanese sashimi breakfast! The new waterfront rail is also nearby and provides a beautiful view along the way to the Fuji TV building and Oedo Onsen. I would love to stay here again!

We stayed just 2 nights here, but we had a comfortable stay. Check-in was perhaps a bit disorganised with only 1 staff member taking care of all the check-ins with 1 other staff member to manage the queue by taking down names of who was next in line. This may not be an issue most of the time, but we may have arrived at a busier time.The complimentary drinks upon check-in were a lovely touch and the rooms were comfortable, clean, and exactly what you'd expect, if perhaps a little on the small side. There were also some great views of Tokyo as we took the elevator up to the hotel lobby floor.

Stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo over Thanksgiving. The staff are all so friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was very good but if you want more of a bargain ask the concierge to suggest a café that serves breakfast. The concierge is extremely helpful and friendly as well.The location is perfect - it is less than 10 minute walk from the subway station as well as Tsukiji Fish Market and Ginza shopping.The rooms are comfortable, spacious and clean. I would definitely stay there again.

What a wonderful choice for our combined business (my husband) and vacation (me) visit to Tokyo. This was our first time in this exciting city (Dec 2013). While my husband slaved away in Shinagawa, I was able to see the entire city thanks to the marvelous concierge, who set me up with an all day city tour and also answered my many questions about how to get to an obscure shrine, a festival, etc etc etc! The hotel is very reasonable, clean, modern and quiet with gorgeous views (what else to expect from our 33rd floor room) in a very convenient location. Our "Western" room was perfect for two people and the bathroom - well can I just say, I wish I had that bathroom at home!! The buffet breakfast each day was delicious and vast, enough to keep me going for the day's sightseeing. An added bonus was the lovely art show in the lobby during our stay. I want to go back and I will recommend this hotel to all my traveling friends.

Excellent hotel located on the top floors of the Shiodome Media Tower...our second stay at this hotel (last stay about four years ago)...very professional, courteous, and knowledgeable staff...set us up for our Nikko bus tour, bus station within a half-mile from hotel...also easily accessible to subway lines and trains...walking distance to Ginza and busy Shimbashi districts...quiet and well-appointed room for breakfast buffet...great views of the city from our room...free wifi a plus. Even though the room was small, it was comfortable. We would definitely stay on a return visit to Tokyo!

I stayed there with my husband and 2 young boys for 4 nights in early December 2013. Overall our experience was very positive. It is located in a relatively quiet business district, not too busy just what we like anyway. Shiadome train station is attached to the building and it is also a short walk away to Shimbashi area, very convenient. Room was clean and bathroom amenities were of good quality. I also wish to highlight that 1 Japanese female front desk staff was able to speak in good English and was very very helpful. Truly service with a smile.

I stayed there with mom for one more week for our first Japan trip in life, it's a really small hotel..I mean , room very small...with every equipment you want. Customer service is just soso..meet your basic requirement. The time I stay was peak season, so I paid almost the offical room price without any discount but expensive for their room..so compare to the price you can buy on Agoda for Conrad Tokyo (just next to it), we were disappointed. i applied for membership card online before I get there..but the staff at reception insist I don;t have any record and ask me to fill in again and without the card provided until the end. And except the manager, the reception staff who served me is really poor in English. The most annoying point is, he didn;t understand what I'm asking for, but keep nodding his head and repeating his own words no matter what I said, until his manager came and talked properly in English to communicate with me. And the luggage arrangement is also not considerable compare to Ritz Carlton Seoul I stayed later.Um. everything ask for extra charge(seafood price however, really disappointed..first staff told me better view cost 1000Yen, another told me 2000yen..N i told him I asked it before..then he amended).. for the window view..to the room arrangement (orignally said I need to move my room a few days after my stay to make me have a good view , plus I need to extra pay..though finally didn;t happen)..Anyway, I won'y come back again. The location is inconvenient and far for pleasure or family trip. I think it's good for business only.

Beautiful modern high upon the city with amazing view on Tokyo. A western-japanese gate to modern Japan. clean and spacious rooms, delightful breakfast and a ministore downstaris. We can even tell that the earthquaiq we felt in the morning was like another adventure and the building took it extremely well! The staff could be understood and some knew a very good English. There was also and art exhibition in its lobby. Very intersting and beautful.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel during the last week of November. I found many Travel Advisor returning to the hotel after their first, second and third visit. And our stay confirmed all the positive feedback in the site.Location is very convenient. We walked to Ginza. Train stations were within walking distance. We went to Yokohama and took the JR train. Tsukiji is a train ride away. View was spectacular particularly with the lighted Tokyo Tower. The snow-capped Mt Fuji was visible on the clear day we were there.The only downside for the rooms with the Tokyo Tower view was the background noise of the train speeding their way to the train track right near by. But we got used to it rather quickly and was not a real problem unless you are quite sensitive to background noise.We will plan to be back.

Hotel staff was extremely gracious and helpful. I stayed in three different rooms and each was nicely appointed. The rooms were extremely dry to the point of discomfort. Windows could not be opened. Each room was clean although the carpeting and upholstered chairs were soiled.

It's my second time staying at this hotel. Location was excellent, with nearby stations of major metro lines including the JR. Family mart just down on B2 level for drinks and snacks. Stayed in the triple-room having the Tokyo tower view, which was amazing! Was lucky one morning to also be able to see Mt. Fuji in the distance. Hotel staff very attentive and polite, spoke fluent English. One little disappointment was that we booked a room for three adults with one child, but was only given three sets of towels. Had to call housekeeping for extra set, but after room make-up the next day, was back to only three sets. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay.

We have been to Tokyo three times and each time we go we stay here. This time around they stuck us in a corner room which was smaller than what we are used to. But the hotel is very clean, the bed is super comfortable, and the staff are extremely friendly. The first two times the views from our room was amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

Conveniently located hotel next to Ginza. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Many restaurants and shopping located within a 10-15 minute walk. We had breakfast every morning at the Tsukiji fish market. Located near many of the train stations to get to various lines fairly easy.

Very nice hotel with very good transportation facilities nearby. Direct access to Oedo-line subway from basement floor and walkway access to Shimbashi station (JR Yamanote-line). New transit Yrikamome to Odaiba also very close. Very helpful and pleasant concierge and really good staff. Also nice view from the lobby in 25th floor, rooms were pretty decent in size and - at least mine was - very quiet and peaceful. I didn´t have breakfast in my room rate, but I purchased it one morning - and I really liked. Not the widest selection I have seen, but very high quality.

Excellent hotel right outside the Ginza district. Rooms were a bit tired looking and mine had an occasional odor. Close to the famous fish market and all tours picked up @ the hotel. Wonderful breakfast buffet and staff services. Stayed there on Amex points so overall no complaints.

Beautiful Hotel . Hotel staff could speak English . Rooms where fantastic, You could get to the metro station from hotel without going outside. Metro really easy to use . Recommend getting metro card. We Used Inside Japan who where fantastic providing us with all information before we travelled and we paid for a guide for the day to get around some sites. Fantastic place to holiday . Very clean and people very helpful . Loved it . Hope to go again one day .

This will be my 4th time in Tokyo and I've been staying at the Park Hotel Tokyo for the past three visits. This hotel is conveniently located in the shiodome neighborhood which is rather quiet but is virtually a 10-15 minute walk to Ginza.This time I flew into Haneda airport which was superbly convenient to travel into Tokyo compared with Narita.If you do fly into Haneda international airport take the Monorail and wait for the Haneda express which will cost you 470 yen ( about USD 5 ) and take it to the final one stop to Hamamatsucho station. Then get a taxi to the hotel, which is literarily 5 mins away and cost about 710 yen. So convenient, fast and cheap.Now back to the hotel, the rooms are comfortable if not on the smallish side, my partner and I still find it cosy nevertheless. The amenities are abundant and I have to say the bed is extremely comfortable and the rooms are quiet.Breakfast is served everyday at 7am, you may choose to purchase this as a package when booking your room or choose to add that to your bill.
